Summary: We booked the Camelot as a good neighbor hotel with our Disneyland package. We had a double room with lots of space. The room has a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. Also has a hairdryer. All the rooms open to an exterior all, and there was some noise from there but that's it. Walls seem pretty insulting. The pool is 3 1/2 foot throughout and small but the kids were loving it. The hotel is directly across from the park so we were able to watch from either the pool or  even our room window. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. It was less than a 10 min walk to the park entrance and there is a McDonald's and Panera next door with other restaurants within walking distance. We were without a car and didn't really miss it. The room was clean, the beds were comfy, and it
Manager Response: Dear Misarisa, We greatly appreciate your compliments regarding our property's comfortable rooms and ideal location. It's great to hear your family enjoyed the fireworks view from our 4th floor pool. See you next time!

Summary: Great spot right across the street from the most magical place on earth!!! Not 5-star but has all you need, spending most of your time at the park? This is the place. Mickey D's next door and pretty easy walking distance to and from. Stayed here a couple times and would again. And fireworks from your balcony!!
Manager Response: Dear timposing,  Thank you for writing your favorable review. We are happy to learn you found our property to be of good value and that you enjoyed our convenient location. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This hotel is a great location right across from entrance.  It is next to grab and go food - no food on location so dont get fooled by the 50% off food offer.  The outside walk way is a great location to view the fireworks - without the crowds and when done you can get comfortanle in your room.  A GREAT STAY!
Manager Response: Hi Diana D, We appreciate your great feedback regarding your recent stay. It's great to hear you took advantage of the Disney fireworks view from our property. The 50% food offer is valid at The Cove on Harbor, located at our sister property next door, the Tropicana Inn & Suites. Thanks again for your review. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: If I could give it a 0 I would. Absolutely horrible. Blood on our ‚Äúclean bed sheets‚Äù then when asked if we could have new sheets were given attitude and were left on the floor outside of our room an hour after we called!
Manager Response: Hi marymoreno2312, Our property prides itself on exemplifying high standards of cleanliness. We would never place soiled sheets on a guest's bed nor would our staff leave requested items outside a guest's door. We have been trying to contact you as we have no record of this incident and we have yet to hear back.

Summary Heading: Suited our needs while visiting Disneyland.
Summary: This is a five story property with self or valet parking, self parking is not free.  The property needs a makeover but that may raise the cost of getting a room in the future.  We had a suite and were surprised there was no bathroom in the main suite, only the connecting suite had a bathroom. The beds were adequate for our needs also.  The rooms were always clean upon our return at the end of each day.  The rooms could use more outlets or lamps with outlets on them so we don't have to look for outlets all over the rooms or pull tables out to get to the outlets. The property is across the street from Disneyland and is a short walk to the park entrance.  On certain nights, I guess, S. Harbor Blvd gets noisy with vehicular traffic. There are a couple of restaurants nearby, McD's
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate your feedback and we're excited to share we will be renovating all guest rooms in the beginning of next year. It's great to hear your family enjoyed your visit and we look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: Nice and comfortable hotel.  The hotel location is across the street from Disneyland.  There are many good places to eat within walking distance.  The restaurants are chain restaurants but are quality.  We will stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi Mike P, We're happy to hear you enjoyed our convenient location and spacious guest rooms. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: LOCATION: Camelot Inn & Suites is located right across from Disneyland and is one among many hotels on south Harbor Boulevard. It is a very short walk to the parks. In fact, when going to/from the park, you will be walking more on Disney property than outside of it. When our little one was overwhelmed and went for a nap in her stroller, I just wheeled her back to the hotel. That would have been much harder to do if had to use a car or a bus. In terms of location, only Disney's own hotels can beat Harbor Boulevard hotels. Coming there before 10AM on Saturday we were lucky that our room was ready right away and we didn't have to wait until regular check-in time at 4PM. Regular check-out time is 11-12, but for the extra $52 it can be extended until 3PM.  PARKING: Like the other
Manager Response: Hi Alex_54321, Thank you for your thorough review. We appreciate your feedback and we're happy your family enjoyed your recent stay. Hope to see you again during your next visit to The Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: We were very happy with our stay at Camelot Inn & Suites and will be staying her the next time we visit Disneyland. We were a family of four and the room was nice and big and we did not feel like we were tripping over each other. We had plenty of space to put everything. The room is a little out dated and the furniture is beat up. The pool area is quite small but the kids didn't seem to mind. The only thing we did not like is that the sink area is in the bedroom with the two beds and there is no door so it is hard to get ready in the morning without waking up who is sleeping there, a sliding door would be a great addition to that area. The hotel is right across the street from the park and it took us about 10 minutes to get from our hotel to the security check.
Manager Response: Dear Kimberly M, It's great to hear your family enjoyed your accommodations and close proximity to Disneyland. We appreciate your review and we're excited to share with you that we are planning on renovating all guest rooms beginning in early 2019. Stay tuned!

Summary: It's a nice hotel, across the street from Disneyland. Bathroom was clean, water hot right away with a good flow, bedding was clean and beds were comfortable. Room was quite big. Carpet was outdated. In overall we are glad we stayed here, we had good sleep and rest time every night before returning to Disney parks. It's also worth to mention that hotel is quite. We didn't here other people speaking or kids running and jumping in other rooms. Also it was nice to watch a fireworks from the property.
Manager Response: Dear Nadiia1987, It was indeed a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and we‚Äôre happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay! Thank you for your review.

Summary: From the very friendly valet to the hotel desk clerk, everyone was always very cordial, pleasant and helpful.  We chose the hotel because it is located across the street from Disneyland and the price was better than the other hotels located nearby.  My friend and I have stayed in multiple hotels on Harbor Blvd as we do a girls trip every year to Disneyland and this year, this was the best deal. We had a very nice room on the top floor (5th floor) with a view of the fireworks if we desired to watch them from the balcony.  The room was very clean had a mini fridge and microwave.  There are plenty of places to eat near this hotel. A couple of negatives although they aren't earth-shaking are: The coffee supplied was not great...somewhat bitter, but since the hotel is walking
Manager Response: Dear kathyw9371, Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We are happy to learn you found our property to be of good value and that you enjoyed the fireworks view from the 5th floor. We appreciate you choosing the Camelot Inn & Suites for your girls getaway and hope to see you again next year!

Summary: Last time we did a RunDisney trip we opted for the sister resort, the Tropicana. Bed choices had changed a bit now with our then baby now nearly 4 so we went with the Camelot family suite. Downside was only one bathroom but the upside was having 3 beds. Having two rooms is always superb - more space for everyone and the kitchenette provided a second sink and an actual table for eating at. We weren't huge fans of the Camelot pool - small and shallow and opted to walk over to the Tropicana pool instead. Front desk staff were helpful though there ended up being no early checkin. Having said that, they offered us a room early on a lower level and we opted to wait for the higher floor. They were happy to hold our bags until the room was available. As the room windows face the
Manager Response: Dear hollydan31, It's nice to hear your growing family enjoyed staying in our spacious Family Suite. We appreciate your review and look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot for four nights. Very convenient to Disneyland. The front desk staff are fantastic. Housekeepers not as perfect. Forgot shampoo and ice container liners. Had to go ask for them.  Competitively priced. Pool and hot tub very shallow. Fantastic place to watch Disney fireworks. Would be nice to tell me how to use the television channel guide.  Worth the price room nothing special.
Manager Response: Dear Brian B, Thank you for providing feedback regarding your recent stay. We apologize you had to remind Housekeeping to replenish some items. It's great to hear you enjoyed the fireworks view from our terrace level pool. Your review is appreciated and we hope your family had a blast visiting the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary Heading: A little bit tired, but what a great location
Summary: Stayed here for four nights while visiting the Disney Parks as the first stop on our US tour from Australia.  We had arranged an early check-in as we arrived from Aus at sunrise but had a bit of trouble making the reception staff understand - he kept telling us that check-in was much later in the morning and seemed reluctant to review our booking details.  We eventually managed to make ourselves understood and were given access to our room without further delay.  Other than this minor problem we found reception staff to be very pleasant and efficient.  Our room was clean and comfortable but clearly showing it's age.  The facility overall looks to be due for some attention but while it is unlikely to wow any guests, it is in such a great location for Disney visits that any other
Manager Response: Dear Michael L, Your comments regarding your recent stay are appreciated. We are excited to share we plan to renovate all guest rooms beginning early next year. Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We hope to welcome you and your family back again in the future!

Summary: This was our first stay at Camelot even though we have stayed at several competitors in the area. We picked it due to the connivence in relationship to Disney (across from the main gate). We were immediately impressed because we were early for check In but the rooms were ready! They were able to move rooms around to accommodate us being close together. It was a clean, comfortable affordable nice room.  Every member of the staff we came in contact with was friendly and efficient.  Our rooms were cleaned timely every day so we could come back from Disney in the late afternoon and relax in our freshly cleaned room.  The water pressure in the shower was awesome! Great view of nightly fireworks from our balcony. The only downfall..parking is pricey. Paying for the convince. Highly
Manager Response: Dear JMM65inLV, Thank you for your favorable review. We are happy to hear you found our property to be of good value and that our friendly staff members helped make your stay memorable. Looking forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Very Convenient Location for Disneyland- Older but super clean
Summary: Stayed here with my daughter for 7 nights.  It was super convenient to the main gate of Disneyland & California Adventure park.   The rooms are older style but are kept very clean.   They missed cleaning our room one day but wasn't a big deal.   The staff were friendly and helpful.    The pool and hot tub are really small but for us wasn't a big deal as the weather wasn't really warm enough for pool time.      There was some noise from floor to floor and between walls but overall was really good.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa A, We greatly appreciate your compliments regarding our helpful team members and ideal location. It was a pleasure having you as our guest. Hope to see you again next time.

Summary: We got in early from Hawaii on a Saturday for a 4 day trip to Disneyland at the start of Spring Break. Got to the Camelot Inn at 8 am and Carlos got us a room at 11:30 am. Thanks Carlos. We got a room facing Disneyland so we could enjoy the fireworks and do people watching. Staff were very pleasant and rooms made up when we returned from the parks. My 6 year old granddaughter said that this is the best hotel she stayed at so far and she wants to stay here again when we return.
Manager Response: Dear toddn4835, Thank you very much for your review. We will be sure to pass your compliments along to Carlos. We hope you and your family enjoyed your time at The Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: We stayed for 6 days and got a good deal through Expedia. I‚Äôm glad I got such a good deal because I would not have paid more than I did. If you fly into Anaheim and your doing Disney and universal and LEGO land don‚Äôt waist your money on a rental car they have shuttles that go to all those places at Disney. The hotel charges for parking and we paid 70$ to park. The rooms are ok but I wouldn‚Äôt pay more than 130 per night. It is very close to Disneyland and there are a few restaurants attached to the hotel if you don‚Äôt want to pay park prices for meals.
Manager Response: Dear Jacob L, Thank you for providing great feedback regarding the convenience of our location. The parking fee is clearly listed on our website, confirmation emails (including Expedia's), at the valet podium, and on the check in paperwork. We hope to welcome you back to Anaheim during your family's next visit to The Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: This hotel is extremely close to Disneyland as well as other restaurants not in the park. It was a bit pricey for the simple accommodations, but for the convenience it was worth it. You do have to pay daily for parking $15.00 a day per vehicle, but also for the convenience it was worth it.
Manager Response: Dear Lee B, We are happy to hear you enjoyed the convenience of our location. Your review is very much appreciated and we hope to see you again for your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: We got the suit and it was perfect for a family of 8. My son with his kids n wife were comfortable n me with my other two kids kids n my wife. Affordable, spacious n really close to the Disneyland main entrance.
Manager Response: It sounds like our spacious Family Suite was the perfect choice for your party of 8. We appreciate your review and hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Clean, reasonably priced and right across the street from Disney
Summary: I have stayed here 3-4 times over the past 7-8 years and have never had a bad experience.  My most recent stay (Feb 2018) was probably the best yet.  My complaints in the past was the poor wifi and hard beds.  However, they appear to have all that fixed/upgraded and our stay was great.  The only thing to keep in mind is that they will charge an additional $17/day for parking which is on top of your normal room charge.   That's really my only complaint about this place - everything else is great.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your visits to the Camelot Inn & Suites. We appreciate your comments and are delighted that your most recent stay was the best one yet. See you next time :)

Summary: I requested a specific room and was told I would have that room. I did not have that room. I booked 3 rooms and not one of those rooms were the rooms we requested and were told by staff before we booked that would have.   Very close to the park. As close a walk as when we stayed uh the Disney Grand. Beds felt VERY stiff, however GREAT night sleep.  Don't call them and ask the staff anything. They don't know anything and won't go the extra mile to find out. All I wanted to know was what type of bed they use for the king size bed, he puts, me on hold and comes back says, "ehhh it's just an industrial bed. Call later and see if someone else can help you"   ARE YOU KIDDING ME!?!?!?!?!?!? Not to worry, the next time I drop $2k on hotel rooms for my family I'll book elsewhere.
Manager Response: Although we try our best to honor guest requests, specific room numbers are not guaranteed. We apologize that our staff did not provide a more detailed response regarding our mattresses. They are from a special hotel line made by Serta.

Summary: We picked this place due to location. We got in late Monday and check in was super quick. Our room  was clean and kept that way our entire visit. We were on the 5th floor and loved the quiet. Our shower had plenty of hot water and the pressure was great. The wifi is good for facebooking and web browsing. Not sure if  streaming movies would work though.
Manager Response: Dear Dave E, We are delighted you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms comfortable and our location to the parks convenient. Your comments regarding your room are appreciated. Thank you for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: We stayed here during our 4-night stay in January 2018.  This was our first time at the Camelot and we chose this hotel due to the affordable family suite.  The suite was absolutely perfect sized for our family of 4, with plenty of space for more.  The room was very clean and very spacious.  Each room in the suite had a mini fridge, wardrobe, 2 dressers and TV.  The "kitchen" table was large. The microwave was clean and efficient. There was plenty of space to store our luggage.  The only reason we didn't give this hotel 5 stars is because the king-sized bed wasn't too comfortable and it needed heavier blankets.  Plus there was construction next door at the McDonald's that started at 6am!  Jackhammer and all!  Needless to say that was an unwelcomed awakening.  The proximity to
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review. We're glad our spacious family suite was comfortable for your family. Your comments are appreciated and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: DONT STAY HERE, YOU CAN DO BETTER!!!......AND CHEAPER
Summary: I stayed here for 5 nights with my family (wife and 2 kids).  I have stayed here before and have always had no issues.  I specifically picked this hotel this time because I knew they had fridges and microwaves in the room and needed same.  This hotel was more expensive than other options available but still went with this hotel.  Every morning of our stay we had issues with our shower where the hot water wouldn‚Äôt get hot and cycle from cold to luke warm.  There was a note that said the showers were being worked on the next day so i figured that the problem would be resolved. No such luck therefore the next morning i called after my cold shower and complained to the front desk who said they would have maintenance look at it today.  Once again, the next morning another cold shower
Manager Response: Dear Chris W, We are very sorry to learn of your experience and we apologize for the delay in fixing the inconsistent shower temperature. Upon hearing of your situation, our front office manager called and left a voicemail offering to upgrade you to a suite on the same floor as your family due to the inconvenience. We would like to discuss this further. Please give us a call in the Sales Dept at 714-635-4082.

Summary Heading: Not fancy, a little rundown, but overall pleasant
Summary: The hotel is not new. Nothing about it is new. You can tell that the carpet, the furniture, the building, everything is old.  That‚Äôs the downside. They could really use a fresh coat of paint. On the plus side, our family of six usually cannot sleep well in a hotel room because were all on top of each other. Thankfully in this hotel room everyone had a comfortable place to sleep (we didn‚Äôt even have to use a fold out couch).  Two bathrooms would have been really nice, but two sinks, a table, an eating area, and a fridge were enough to keep things very comfortable. The outdoor pool was heated, so even though we were there in January the kids were able to swim. The real winner here is the location! Walking onto Disney property was amazing! We have stayed close, but never this
Manager Response: Dear Jennwp, Thank you for your feedback. We excited to share we are planning to begin room renovations later this year. Stay tuned for more information!

Summary: Have just come home after staying here for 10 nights. This is my 6th stay at this hotel. The staff are all very helpful and polite - nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are clean. This is a easy walk to Disneyland and many places to eat. Would recommend this place especially for families with young children- you can easily take them back to the hotel for an afternoon sleep and head back to Disneyland for the night
Manager Response: Dear Den271, We‚Äôre delighted that your family took advantage of our close proximity to Disneyland. Our guests have the option to walk back to the hotel anytime for a nap, meal break, or dip in the pool. We greatly appreciate being one of your favorite hotels in the area and thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: there are alot of other hotels just as close. choose another one
Summary: STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!  My family stayed here in September 2017 for 8 days.  Our room was fine, 2 full sized beds. We were on the 5th floor.  Ice maker didn't work on the 5th, or 4th floors.  We had to go down to the 3rd floor. There is a gift shop on site.  The stuff is actually cute, just don't disturb the lady watching her tablet... service with a snarl. My daughter and I did go in multiple time.  We did choose to not purchase souvenirs because of her attitude.   My issue was with the parking.  We had a car only on specific days, only over night, and never consecutive.  The day we arrived 9/8, we had a rental, charged $ 17.55            Three days later, rented another car from Select RentACar, 2 doors down and told "we deal with them all the time, just leave it in the
Manager Response: Dear Jmknahiku, We are surprised by your review. The parking fee is clearly listed on our website, confirmation emails, at the valet podium, and on the paperwork you signed at check in back in September. Your review is unclear about the number of cars parked on property each day. We recommend contacting Select Rent A Car regarding the date your vehicle was picked up. If you believe there is a discrepancy in the charges, please give us a call and we‚Äôd be happy to discuss it with you as we need more information before we can research the vehicle logs and your folio.

Summary: This was our second stay at the Camelot, and just as before, our suite was clean, quiet, and spacious.  However, there was one hiccup this time:  the wi-fi.  The signal was weak and spotty, and for most of our stay, we couldn't get on at all.  When my husband called the front desk to ask about it, they said that it was likely a problem with his phone.  But none of our five devices (three iPhones, an iPad and a Kindle) could get online. Nevertheless, If this is not an issue for you, I would still recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer_Elder,   We apologize for the slow Wi-Fi connection experienced during your stay. Our IT Department is currently re-wiring and installing new access points to cover dead zones and improve the speed for all hotel guests. It is nice to hear that you enjoyed your accommodations and we hope to see you again during your next visit to The Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel in a perfect location
Summary: I came with my son for New Year at Disney  and this was exactly what we needed. Across street from the park. View of the Matterhorn. Big room with fridge and microwave. Shampoo conditioner and lotion provided. Mini mart and Panera next door. Disney shuttle from airport available. Pool and tiny hot tub. Nice staff. If all you do is sleep and shower at the hotel this is perfect and reasonably priced. If you want a luxury hotel the Grand Californian is great but easily three times the price. Given the option I‚Äôd pick the Camelot and save the extra money for more vacas!
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you and your son enjoyed your recent stay. Thank you for highlighting the many conveniences our property provides. We appreciate your review and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: this was not our  first time at the Camelot Inn. We stayed here in april for a four days and again in November for seven days. Both times the hotel was exactly as advertised and we enjoyed our stay. The location is easily the best feature of this hotel but the staff were excellent. Of course it was difficult to assess their problem solving ability since from check in to check out every thing was excellent.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your compliments regarding our helpful team members and ideal location. It was a pleasure having you as our guest. Hope to see you again next time.

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot December 20-27. This was our first time staying here, as we usually stay next door at the Fairfield. We were not disappointed with our decision. Our family of 5 stayed in the family suite which was perfect and had ample room for everyone. The price was very comparable to the rates for a regular room anywhere else. The only thing I would recommend would be to have another bathroom (perhaps even a half-bath) in the family suite. It was very nice to have a kitchen table in the room though. Beds were very comfortable and the housekeeping did a stellar job tidying up our room each day.   The walk to and from the gates of Disneyland was perfect for us. Nice and short.   No restaurants in the hotel, but McDonald‚Äôs and Panera are right next door. We even took an
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback regarding your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. We are happy to learn that you found the Family Suite to be comfortable and spacious. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: First stay at this hotel. It‚Äôs a nice place and super convenient for accessing the park. Nice to just walk across the street and be in the park or back in your room plus you can easily see the fireworks from the balcony. The rooms are clean and well maintained and the staff is nice. Valet parking included too.
Manager Response: We‚Äôre happy to hear that your family enjoyed our close proximity to Disneyland. Our guests have the option to walk back to the hotel anytime for a nap, meal break, or dip in the pool. Thanks so much for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: It's a decent place, and the location can't be beat.  The beds were comfortable enough, and our suite was spacious.  The wifi is just wretched.  Also, the hot water frequently changed temperatures, which was both annoying and dangerous.  On the plus side, they are friendly, there's a McDonald's right next door, and there's a Panera right next to that.  Also close to stores with beer, which you'll need after a whole day in the happiest place on earth.
Manager Response: Dear Randy W, We appreciate your compliments regarding our convenient location and comfortable rooms. Thank you for bringing the inconsistent water temperature to our attention. Our maintenance team is addressing the issue and we apologize for the inconvenience. For future reference, if you ever experience issues in your room, our staff would be happy to send maintenance to resolve the problem during your stay or move you to another room.   We hope your family created many magical memories at the Happiest Place on Earth and we hope to see you again next time!

Summary: There was a time I recommended everyone when coming to Disneyland to use this hotel however that time has past. This past trip using this hotel has completely changed my opinion.   There was a day  we left the room and requested a late room servicing. We had bought our sons new hats and one of them left their's behind. We come back to the room later that evening and find the hat to have two different spots of staining on it. Closer inspection showed it as Powerade as there was some left in a cup nearby. My mother-in-law went to the front desk to speak with them about it and was told they would leave a note for the manager in the morning to call us after they speak to staff. That day came and went without any contact from the manager.   We left it be considering we were there for
Manager Response: Dear JasonA491, Your review has been previously addressed and resolved by our front office manager. Should you have any additional questions, please feel free to contact us.

Summary: This an a clean hotel for big families We have reserved four rooms two weeks prior to x mas holidays One of them is a junior suites The rooms are spacious with two double beds The beds are comfortable On the roof top there is a tiny jacuzzi where you can watch the fireworks at nite It is only ten minutes walk from the gate The showers are hot After a long day at the amusement park,you come back and put your legs up and felt asleep right away,you will not hear the noise generated by the kids along the verandah, the alarm of the cars or the cart wheels noise generated from the chamber maids There are all the necessary amenities,except there is no restaurant within the hotel,which is not really necessary Right next door is the McDonald,the IHOP  and the Denny,  Parking is extra
Manager Response: Dear Allan & Amy T, We appreciate your detailed review and we're very happy to learn that your family enjoyed your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. Thank you for pointing out our spacious rooms, convenient location, and Disney fireworks view from the terrace level pool. The daily parking fee is actually just $15 plus tax per day.  Happy Holidays to you and your family!

Summary: This will be a bit detailed. First off yes the rooms are dated. Decor is old as is the carpet etc. That being said bathroom was nice and clean as we're all the beds. I paid 200 a night for 2 bedroom 2 queens and 1 king with a full size couch/pullout bed. Here is the deal, neighboring hotels either don't comfortably fit 5 in a suite or they make you pay damn near 400+ for their biggest suites.  This is a 5 min walk from the entrance which was needed after 10+hr days in the parks. Valet was very punctual. Washer dryer on 1st floor was clean. This isn't a 5 star hotel by any stretch but for big clean beds, nice bathrooms, tons of space, bargain price, it can't be beat. If I wanted a big flatscreen tvs, granite counters, and pier 1 looking furniture I know where to take my money.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. It is great to hear that your family enjoyed your accommodations in a spacious Family Suite and found our property to be of overall good value. We are excited to share that we are planning to renovate all guest rooms within the next year. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to see you again on your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: Used to stay there 1-2 times a month this last stay we didn‚Äôt get the room we were promised even though we paid extra. We were offered a different room and took it. I went to take a shower only to find boogers on the shower curtain. I attempted to use a towel and there was feces on it when I contacted front desk and asked for a manager she never came we got the run around some other lady came to take pictures then left. I called front desk to ask for the manager and they wouldn‚Äôt answer my calls but when I called from my cell phone they would answer. Odd? I think not pure incompetence. I went down to the front desk to see why it was taking so long and I was told by the employee the manager must have left without telling them after she tried to give me the run around about her
Manager Response: As per our previous conversation, we have researched your concerns with the staff members and manager on duty during your stay. Although we honored your special request for a Disney view room, you were still dissatisfied. Cleanliness is of utmost importance to us as demonstrated by our many positive Trip Advisor reviews. The room you were checked into was in fact cleaned and inspected prior to your arrival. When our front office manager gave you a call to address your claims, it became clear that we were not best fit for you. She encouraged you to find accommodations elsewhere and provided a full refund. Wishing you all the best.

Summary: We recently stayed here for four nights. The room was clean and large, bed comfortable. We were actually right by the elevator and we only heard people walking by on occasion and only if they were talking loud outside the window. We never once were able to hear our neighbors while they were in the room. The location can't be beat. This has now become our "go to" hotel while at Disneyland.
Manager Response: We are very happy to be your hotel of choice when visiting the Disneyland area. Your positive comments are appreciated. See you next time!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 days. The rooms were very clean, beds nice and comfortable. Yes you can hear your neighbours walking around, using the water facilities but given that I‚Äôm extremely sensitive to noises I was able to sleep perfectly fine!   Housekeeping did an excellent job and couldn‚Äôt rate them highly enough.   Location was excellent. A very short walk to Disneyland, Mc Donald‚Äôs, IHOP, Denny‚Äôs and other restaurants.   The only downfall was the pool area. The pool was rather small. (Enough for my kids) however it was on level 4 which made me really uncomfortable as I hate heights and for this reason I would think twice about staying here again. But if heights don‚Äôt matter to you then 100% would recommend this place.
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed and thoughtful review. We are delighted your family enjoyed your recent stay and we will be sure to notify the housekeeping supervisor of your compliments. Our 4th floor pool is a popular spot to view Disney's firework show. However, you may prefer the pool at our sister property next door, the Tropicana Inn & Suites. Their pool is quite large and is located on the ground level.

Summary: The room was quite large, but the beds were painfully uncomfortable, and the shower was less than thrilling (there was hair in the drain upon arrival). Quick walk to Disney was the only plus. Also, parking is quite difficult.
Manager Response: It is surprising to hear you found the beds to be uncomfortable as we typically receive rave reviews on them. Although parking can be tight when the hotel is running at full occupancy, we do guarantee on site parking for all guests. Thank you for bringing the shower issue to our attention. We will address it with the head housekeeper. We appreciate your review and hope you enjoyed your time at the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Clean Room, Comfortable Beds
Summary: Really liked the 5 minute walk to Disney. Convenient to nearby restaurants. The room was clean & the beds were comfortable. I would likely stay there again if I go back to Anaheim. Some traffic noise could be heard in the room, but usually just sirens or large trucks.
Manager Response: Dear Joe C, It was indeed a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and we‚Äôre happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay! Thank you for your review.

Summary: The hotel is in a great location, just a quick walk to Disneyland.  The room was clean and neat.  The people at the front desk were a great help when we needed to arrange travel.  Would have like a list of close restaurants in the room.
Manager Response: Dear Brenda L, Thank you for highlighting our ideal location and comfortable rooms in your review. We appreciate your comments and hope to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: I have rated this motel poor because of their policy regarding the rental of scooters. The last several times we have visited Disneyland we have rented scooters from the same rental company and have always been treated well, received a repeat customer discount and had quality scooters. This time, however, we stayed at the Camelot and was not aware that Camelot had a scooter company on premises. In the past, I would arrange with my preferred scooter company to have my scooter waiting for me at the motel when we finally arrived via flying or driving. It was always there waiting for us, ready to go. This time, I was told by Camelot that I would have to be present when the scooter company delivered the scooter! Or--I could rent from Camelot onsite company. If I went with my desired
Manager Response: Aside from your disappointment in the hotel's policy regarding scooter delivery, we hope you enjoyed your room and made many magical memories at the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: I stayed here from October 1st to the 8th and had live cockroaches in my room. When I saw them at 12 at night after all 4 of my kids were already sleeping I called the front desk. The man on the phone was very rude when I was worried about waking my kids and ruining our first day at Disney saying "well I don't know what you want me to do about it" the maintenance man came and looked at my pictures then acted as if he didn't know what it was. It is very clearly a cockroach. He said they would spray the following morning. Not wanting to upset my children or ruin our day we went to sleep. Luckily we weren't in the room very much on our trip. I did continue to see them for several days. The only good thing about this place is the location. The rooms are very dated and the pool is
Manager Response: We deeply apologize for the inconvenience you encountered while staying with us. Although we maintain a bi-monthly process to exterminate outside insects from entering guest rooms, there are those unfortunate rare occasions when a water bug will make its way from the public street plumbing through our plumbing, and land itself into a guest room drain up into the sink.   Upon learning of your experience, our staff offered to move you to another room. Your decision was to stay in the same room and allow the maintenance team to spray the following day. The front office manager provided a partial refund which you accepted. After thoroughly inspecting and cleaning the room, we found no other traces of insects. Thank you for your review and expressing your concerns.

Summary: The best part of this hotel is it's close walking distance to the Disneyland park entrances. The rooms are old and outdated. Our room had live huge cockroach running around that made our stay very uncomfortable. We called to complain to the staff and they blamed it on the City of Anaheim. I know commercial properties can call termite and spray their property inside and out. Very disappointed in the way the staff handled our complaint and made us feel our complaint was not valid. I will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Felicia E,  It is disappointing to hear that you were dissatisfied with your stay as we would have been happy to move you to another room. Your complaint was called in one hour after check out. The front desk team member that answered the phone did assist you, and he connected you to the front office supervisor who provided a partial refund. In addition, our maintenance and housekeeping staff were sent to the room to inspect the plumbing for the water bug.  We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed the convenience of our location and we hope you‚Äôll consider returning to us in the future.

Summary: We arrived before regular check in but we were able to check in and get to our room early. We had 2 queen and there were 3 of us and plenty of room. Had a fridge and microwave. The property is nice and close and a quick walk across the street to park. You can see fireworks from pool area on 4th floor. Staff was friendly. Our only issues were wifi was poor and we could barely connect( seemed to work if you were closer to front of property) and the black out curtains would not close properly, if I stayed again I would bring hair clips to keep light out at night. The "cons" are minor. Overall enjoyed the stay.
Manager Response: We're delighted that you enjoyed your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. Your comments are appreciated and we are excited to share that we plan on renovating next year. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is probably third closest to the park. The Tropicana is closer and is a sister property. But the Camelot is right next door to a McDonalds and Panera, which matters since none of these hotels serve breakfast. There is also an IHOP where kids eat free after 4 pm and a few other places pretty close.  The rooms were spacious enough to bring in bags and stay several days. There is an on site pay laundry mat, a pool with a hot tub that we didn't use, a gift shop, and a place to rent strollers and scooters that are well priced for the area.   Parking anywhere near Disney is horrible so make sure to line that up with your reservation. It costs $15 a day extra but they let us park there for an entire day while our room was getting ready and if parking isn't available you can
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your detailed and thoughtful review. We are happy to learn that your family was satisfied with our comfortable rooms, convenient location and hard working valet staff. We hope to extend our hospitality to you again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: It is close to the entrance to Disneyland Resort. Hotel has basic amenities (ice machines, soda, gift store and pool). Room was clean and staff friendly. There are restaurants nearby (McDonalds, Panera, Tony Roma‚Äôs, & iHop). There‚Äôs a market steps away that sells snacks along with beer and wine.
Manager Response: Thank you for highlighting the many conveniences our property provides. We appreciate your feedback and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and perfect for Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights at then end of our USA trip.  Perfect location to not only Disneyland, but also other food options.  We had the Family room which was great - the kids got their own beds and bedroom!  Slept well every night and usually went to the Panera bakery or next door to Macca‚Äôs for breakfast.  The wifi was very slow and unreliable for the duration of our stay which is the only reason I have marked this place down a star.  Highly recommended and will probably stay here again if we come back to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We‚Äôre delighted that your family took advantage of our close proximity to Disneyland. Our guests have the option to walk back to the hotel anytime for a nap, meal break, or dip in the pool. Thanks so much for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: Always looking for a close to Disneyland hotel. We have been here twice and if you ask for a quiet room you are golden. Very clean, a little dated. Friendly staff. Laundry facilities and next door to Mc Donald's and a short walk to Mimi's Cafe. Two miles from the stadiums (appx.)
Manager Response: Dear Robin G, Thank you for the great feedback. We appreciate your comments and we hope to see you again next time.

Summary: The hotel staff were very helpful.  Position is great for disneyland, only 5 minute walk. Lots of fast food eating places surrounding it. Beds were comfy and the drapes were super block out, so we slept really  well being rather  jet lagged.  Only disappointing area is the pool. Its not very appealing, we had a quick swim one afternoon.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and we're happy you enjoyed your recent stay with us. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Well this was our third visit in 2 years. This time we took all 6 of our grandchildren. They range from 17 to almost 2. Once again the staff at the Camelot Inn are just out of this world. This hotel is a little tired but I understand they are going to start some renovations. The cleaning staff are the best. We had breakfast in our room every morning and with that many kids it got a bit messy. They gave us big garbage bags and we did our best. But they did the rest. Every afternoon it looked like a knew place.  With Disneyland just across the street we could go back with the little ones for a rest before the evening events started. We spent 11 days this time and it was just the best. I hope when the renos are done the prices done go up.  Thank you again we love your place.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback during your stay with us.  We will be sure to pass your compliments along to our Housekeeping staff. It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and your grandchildren and hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: A short walk to Disneyland from this hotel. Late night check in was not as good because he was cold and unprofessional. He made us take out our own luggage in their storage room while others (we've stayed here before too, so we know how it's supposed to be handled) took out Le bags out ourselves. He offered no assistance to get our luggages to our rooms, and really didn't care I was upset about how he checked us in. No one deserves to be treated like that by front desk person. He represents the hotel andy first impression was not so good at all with him. Other than that the rest of our short stay here was good.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that the person checking you in was unfriendly. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This staff member has since met with the supervisor regarding his demeanor. Despite this, we are happy to hear that our other team members were helpful and we're glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: The train is running again!!! The new guardian's ride is amazing. Check out single rider passes for the impossible wait rides! Always our favorite food is a gem in the Disneyland Hotel called Steakhouse 55! Yum
Manager Response: Dear MelCqt,  We are delighted that you enjoyed your time at the "Happiest Place on Earth".   We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Our go-to hotel on frequent Disneyland trips
Summary: This is always our preferred hotel when going to Disneyland, and have been staying here for years. The rooms are older, but clean and large with comfortable beds and pillows. If you are staying with a larger group the family suite is perfect-two rooms converted into a suite, with a kitchenette and dining table. The staff is always polite, and helpful. They do charge $15 a night for parking, which standard in the area. Best of all, its an easy walk to the main gate of Disneyland.
Manager Response: Having you as our guest is always a pleasure and we appreciate your feedback regarding your most recent visit. We hope you were able to enjoy the fireworks view from our pool area located on the 4th floor. See you next time!

Summary: We booked the suite with the king and two queen beds and two rooms. It was ideal and was about a 5 minute walk to the Disney parks and saved us a lot of money (rather than booking a hotel in the park grounds). Very spacious and comfortable. The staff were so helpful and courteous all the time. There's no restaurant in the hotel itself but the McDonalds next door fills the weary traveller long enough to last until a decent meal can be had. Very easy check in and out too. The only quibble would be the air conditioning which was head splitting loud and leaking fluid but other than that, an ideal base so near to the bus stop for day tours and trips to LAX.
Manager Response: It sounds like our spacious and comfortable Family Suite was the perfect choice for your party. We apologize for the malfunctioning AC unit. Our maintenance team has repaired the issue based on your feedback. Thank you for taking the time to write your review. See you next time!

Summary: Highly recommend this place if you want to stay close to Disneyland. The Disneyland grounds was right across the street. Also price per night was better than the surrounding hotels. The room was clean and large. It had a fridge and microwave. Only thing that could be improved on is the lighting in the room, not enough lamps.   Parking- if you don't find a space, they valet for you for free as a guest.   Staff- all very nice  Food- right next door is a Mcdonalds.
Manager Response: Dear Caroline B, We're very happy to hear that our ideal location and friendly front desk team members helped make your stay a memorable one. Your review is appreciated and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot Inn and Suites 3 nights. We had a Suite with one King bed, and 2 queen beds. This was perfect for our family of mom, dad and 2 daughters 12 and 19 yrs.  Everyone slept so much better having their own space. The room included a dining room table, couch, coffee table and a small kitchen area with a sink, fridge and microwave. The sink area was configured so it was easy to use as an additional area to get ready, since it also had a mirror above it. The rooms were clean, plenty of towels for our family, plenty of space for luggage and to hang clothing. We could see the fireworks easily from our room or out on the balcony. Room was very quiet--just plan on hearing Disneyland fireworks each night around 9:30 since it's across the street. A McDonald's, Panera
Manager Response: It is wonderful to hear that your family enjoyed your stay. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks. The majority of our guest rooms face north away from the street and offer a view of the fireworks from the outside corridor. See you next time!

Summary: I enjoyed staying here and would do it again. The rooms and everything our older but it is a five minute walk  to Disneyland and there are a few different restaurant options to eat at within walking distance if you didn't bring a vehicle or purchase a  rental car. The rooms were clean and safe. You can also see the Disneyland fireworks from the rooms or rooftop style pool. This also means you can hear them, which may bother seem if trying to sleep early in the night. Overall, great place to stay when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms comfortable and our location to the parks convenient. Your feedback is important to us and we're excited to share that room renovations are expected to begin next year. Stay tuned!

Summary: We stayed here from July 29 to August 5. We had a great stay. The room was very nice and clean the air conditioner worked great which came in handy because it was very humid when we were here so it was nice to be able to walk across the street and cool off in the room. The bed was very comfy and we slept great. Over all it was an excellent stay. We will be definitely coming back soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. It is great to learn that you were satisfied with your room, hotel amenities, and the convenience of our location. We hope your family created many magical memories during your stay!

Summary: Large two room and 3 bed suite was our base for our visit at Disneyland Anaheim. Great for 2 adults and two teenagers. The location of the hotel is perfect for the Disney visit and it only took 10 minutes from the hotel to the front gates. The pricing is ok looking at the location - rooms were a bit oldish but clean and very spacious.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience during your most recent visit to the Disneyland area. We enjoyed having the opportunity extending our hospitality to you, and hope to have the privilege again on your next stay.

Summary: Spent 5 nights here with my wife, my daughter and her husband, and our grandson.  We were quite pleased with our stay.  The rooms were very clean with abundance of towels.  Staff were friendly and helpful. We picked this hotel due to its proximity to the park hoping it would make the walk there with 18 month grandson tolerable and it really was. Amenities may not be the best for example no restaurant and a rather small pool but that would be the only down side. The rooms were probably the quietest we've been in a long time so that was a big bonus.
Manager Response: It is wonderful to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks. We truly appreciate your feedback and we thank you for your review.

Summary: The size of the family suite was nice.  Plenty of room for everyone to spread out.  Wet spot on the carpet when we checked in so they gave us 10% off the first night.  Turns out it was from the AC unit which leaked outside the room for our entire stay.  Not sure it was working right anyway, didn't seem to maintain the right temperature.  AC in the other room worked great.    One refrigerator was not working when we checked in but they had it replaced the next day.    Two of the lamps did not have light bulbs.  We were using those outlets to charge our phones.  Housekeeping would plug them back in every day but did not replace the bulbs.  Lamps with outlets in them would be great.    We were hanging towels up every day to be reused but they kept replacing them.  Two out of four
Manager Response: We apologize for the maintenance and housekeeping oversights you experienced during your recent stay with us. The supervisors of each department have been notified and will ensure these issues are resolved before the room is rented out again. We pride ourselves on demonstrating the highest standards of guest service and we are very sorry for dropping the ball. Thank you for providing constructive feedback which allows us to improve. We sincerely hope you‚Äôll reconsider returning to us in the future.

Summary: We had a party of 6 and booked a family suite. Our room was quite large and although it has only one bathroom there is a sink in each room which is very helpful. The location couldn't be better and the room rates are reasonable. The valet and front desk person at check in were very welcoming. Housekeeping did a good job, we had enough towels for all of us (that is rare). This property does not offer breakfast but Panera and McDonalds are right next door.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your positive feedback during your time with us. Thank you for sharing the convenience of our location to the parks and local restaurants. It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and your family and hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: Great hotel. Very clean and only 5 min walk to Disneyland entrance.  Mcdonalds next door.  Pool was small but adequate. Small shop selling toiletries and items was useful. Woudl stay here again, great value for money. Could see fireworks from outside room.
Manager Response: It's great to hear that you took advantage of the Disney fireworks view from outside your room. We very much appreciate your thoughtful review and we hope your family created many magical memories during your stay. Looking forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Huge Room and super close to disneyland
Summary: We stayed in a two-bedroom suite and the room was big and accommodating. Beds were comfortable. No breakfast and I wish I didn't have to pay for parking - but I cannot complain for the price. The staff was pretty friendly too.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback regarding your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. We are happy to learn that you found the Family Suite to be comfortable and spacious. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay and walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Had an excellent stay at this establishment. Was on the 4th floor where the pool is as well as the best spot to see the fireworks. Room was clean, beds comfortable. Microwave and fridge came in handy.  Located next to McD for convenient food options and minutes walk to the front entrance in Disneyland. This location is excellent for midday break for pool fun or to refresh for the 2nd half of a Disney day! Staff was friendly especially the parking attendants
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience. It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you while visiting the "Happiest Place on Earth" and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: We had a suite on this visit and were happily surprised with the amount of room we all had. Two double beds in one room and a king in the other. TV's on both sides, full bath with mirrored area outside the toilet area and another area to get ready on kitchen side. Microwave, small fridge, dinner table as well. In room safe. Just a small walk to Disneyland entrance, right beside McDonalds and Panera, and other restaurants. Pool was busy so not much seating area but was nice to have. Easily able to watch the fireworks each evening from hotel. Staff were great; friendly, and quick to get our TV working properly when we had a small problem. We will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that your family enjoyed staying in one of our spacious and comfortable family suites. Our property offers a great view of Disney's firework display from our pool located on the 4th floor. Thank you for leaving your positive review. We look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: Our room (432) was ready upon arrival. The room faced the street with the ability to view the nightly fireworks. The street noise was not an issue for us but if you are a light sleeper, another room location may be best. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. This hotel was perfect for our needs and I have no complaints about the stay, staff or the rooms. I would 100% recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here again if in the Anaheim area. Thank you to the Camelot Inn for a wonderful stay!
Manager Response: Dear sumrflwer72,  We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and enjoyed the view of the fireworks from one of our front property guest rooms.  The majority of our guest rooms face north away from the street and offer a view of the fireworks from the outside corridor.  Another great location to view the fireworks is from our pool area located on the 4th level.  Thank you for your positive feedback and look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit.

Summary: It was my second time visiting Disneyland with my family of 4. Last time we stayed at a different hotel which was bit far and inconvenient, so this time I booked this hotel in advance to stay right opposite the main entrance of the two Disneyland parks. From photos, the hotel seemed old and I wasn't sure if the rooms would be dated. I am happy to mention that the rooms are well maintained, the cleanliness is superb and the amenities are same as what I expect out of a good hotel.We did not have to call front-desk for anything during our 3 nights stay here. Housekeeping is excellent too - looking at well made up room after a tiring day at Disneyland gave such a wonderful feeling.  Our flight to LA was quite early in the day and reached hotel around 11am. Luckily the hotel had room
Manager Response: Dear Rahul_4319,  We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your positive feedback during your time with us. Thank you for sharing the convenience of our location to the parks and local restaurants. It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and your family and hope to see you again on your next visuit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: 1st time staying here, our suite was huge, room was clean, valet/bell staff was friendly when we left and returned, the one time I used the valet to pick up my car, he sprinted for it! Location is very convenient to Disneyland's main entrance, lots of restaurants also very close.
Manager Response: Dear Keith U,  Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience during your most recent visit to the Disneyland area.  We enjoyed having the opportunity extending our hospitality to you,  and hope to have the privilege again on your next stay.

Summary: I work as a Travel Agent and we booked three rooms June 11-16 for our family vacation. the staff at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. our rooms were side by side and near the stairs as requested. The rooms and pool were very clean. I have no complaints.  I will recommend this hotel to any clients going to Disneyland and wanting to stay close but not at the parks.
Manager Response: It is wonderful to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks. We truly appreciate your recommendation and we thank you for your review!

Summary: We started out by being checked in by the front desk personnel which was very welcoming and gave us a lot of great information as this was our first trip to California.  Every time we left the hotel or returned to the hotel, the gentlemen that were parking cars always said hello, enjoy your day and welcome back.  This was a nice touch.  The cleaning crew also did a nice job and we were never disappointed with how our room looked when we returned.  They have a great location and the pool viewing of the fireworks was a definite plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for highlighting our close proximity to Disneyland. We're delighted that our friendly front desk, housekeeping, and valet team members helped make your stay a memorable one. Your comments are appreciated and we hope to welcome your family back again soon.

Summary: We stayed here with our 2 children age 3 and 6. We opted for a family suite and it was perfect. There was a separate room with 2 queen beds so in the evenings we were able to put the kids too bed and we could unwind and watch tv in our room. There was also a small kitchen/dining area that was great for breakfast. The hotel is getting older and the decor is dated but it was clean. We did find a lot of noise in the evenings from the room above as well as people walking by our room.
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you found the Family Suite to be comfortable and spacious. Your feedback regarding your stay is important to us and we're excited to share that renovations are expected to begin next year. Stay tuned!

Summary Heading: Location Awesome but hotel needs some TLC
Summary: This is our 3rd stay at Camelot Inn. I booked in advance and requested a quiet room with NO adjoining room. They did state that they can't guarantee special requests which is understandable. Checked in at 9 pm and I specifically asked the man checking us in if our room had an adjoining room. I had read reviews that with adjoining rooms you could hear the people next door just like they were in your room. The man continued to tell us that he had no access to that kind of information and that he could not tell if the room was adjoining or not.  When we got to our room it did have an adjoining room door. I confirmed upon checkout that he did have access to this info it is right in the computer. He just didn't want to deal with me requesting another room. I just don't appreciate
Manager Response: Hi Lana B,  Thank you so much for your detailed review.  We apologize for the oversight with housekeeping in replenishing the amenities in the room and for the low water pressure.  Theses issues will be addressed with our housekeeping and maintenance team.  We are delighted that you enjoy the ideal location of the property to the parks and had the opportunity to enjoy the fireworks from outside of your room or at the 4th-floor pool and gazebo area on evenings you may have arrived back to the hotel early.  We are excited to share with you that our rooms will begin renovations and will be like new in 2018.  We sincerely hope you will reconsider giving the Camelot Inn & Suites another try on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: This is our second stay at Camelot.  It is close to the Disneyland entrance and there are plenty of eating choices and convenience stores.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The swimming pool was a nice way to cool off in the afternoon.  There were two wonderful men who worked on the front desk who were so helpful to us (sorry, I can't remember your names) . They couldn't do enough to make our stay memorable.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us. We're happy to hear that you consistently enjoy staying at our property for your family's visits to Anaheim. Our terrace level pool is the perfect place to cool off during the day or watch Disney's famous firework display at night.

Summary: Clean rooms. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Great location in terms of visiting Disneyland.  Rooms are dated but clean. Probably time for some upgrades. Pool is salt water which is nicely the pool side is in need of some TLC. Paint on pool deck is peeling. Pool is smaller and only 3.5 ft. deep. Also, the pool-side furniture is very old and a few peices are broken. Need definite upgrades there for sure.  Clean+friendly staff+good location=WORTH THE STAY!!!  *As of writing, not sure of room rate as was booked as part of package deal through agent.
Manager Response: We're delighted that you enjoyed your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. Your comments are appreciated and we are excited to share that we plan on renovating next year. We  hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future.

Summary Heading: large two bedroom suite was nice
Summary: We booked this online and ended up with some confusion when we checked in. They called while we were in Salt Lake and told us they had overbooked and had moved us to the tropicana which was only two doors down but when I got there they only had one room for me instead of the two I had reserved at the camelot. so they ended up putting us up in one of their 2 bedroom suites with 3 beds and a couch. nice room but not to convinent with only one bathroom. great location just down the street from Disneyland's front gate.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We apologize for the confusion that occurred at check in and we hope your family created many magical memories while visiting the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: Camelot Inn is located approx. 500 steps to the main entrance to Disneyland. Awesome! We got upgraded to a family suite with a balcony view of Disney, thank you very much! The rooms were large and clean with a kitchenette which was helpful since there is no restaurant  on site. We frequented the Market up the street & Mimi's Cafe both days during our stay. And we were allowed to park on-site till around 4:00 pm after our check out. Very helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us. We're delighted that you enjoyed our spacious Family Suite and Disney view. We hope to see you again next time!

Summary: We booked a family suite facing the park for 6 nights. We were surprised at the spaciousness of the suite. Even with four adults and four kids we never felt cramped. There was plenty of space even with all the luggage and groceries we brought with us for a week. We enjoyed seeing the fireworks from our room on the night we arrived. Even though the room faced the street the noise was minimal. We never heard noise from other rooms. The area felt safe even at night and the room was secure. There was always a parking lot attendant on duty monitoring who came in and out of the property. Housekeeping did an excellent job every day that we were there. The towels and linens were actually higher quality than I would have expected for this level of hotel. The towels seemed brand new. The
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that our ideal location and spacious family suite stood out to you during your visit. Your comments regarding your room are appreciated and we hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: This hotel is amazing convenient an extremely short walk to the cross walk to Disneyland. The room size are pretty good. All cars must be checked in, $57 for 3 night to park your car at the hotel you paid for. Like the title says the rooms are clean but very dated this place looks like a well preserved 80's hotel. Except for the lobby which looks great small but nice. The pool and hot tub are small and both needed another foot of water put in to them super shallow. Hot tub water doesn't even go to your chest. Check in is fast and staff are friendly. While I would look at other hotels with in walking distance I wouldn't hesitate to spent 3 more days at this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to the main entrance of both Disney parks. And we are excited to share that we are planning to renovate all guest rooms in 2018. Stay tuned!

Summary Heading: Still the best Harbor Blvd option
Summary: This was our third stay in the past 3.5 years.  And though we have stayed at a few other Harbor Blvd (and non-Harbor Blvd) hotels, I can say assuredly that Camelot is our favorite.  It's the simplicity and cleanliness of this place that appeals to me.    First off is the proximity; Its as close as you can get for a reasonable walk with small children.  Secondly it's less expensive, less crowded and has bigger rooms than the Fairfield Inn next door.  To me it really blends the feel of a larger more comfortable chain, with the friendliness and approachability of a family run operation.  We had no problems parking, we got there early but lucked into an early check in, though on a lower floor and we were able to leave our car there the day of our check out while we took in some last
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting the Camelot Inn & Suites as your home away from home when visiting the Disney Parks. We pride ourselves in providing our guests with excellence in customer service and we really appreciate your feedback. We look forward to seeing you again next time.

Summary: The hotel staff is friendly and helpful.  The hotel location is amazing, a 5 minute walk to the Disney entrance. It was a good size, nice and clean and had a small microwave, coffee pot, a refrigerator and free wifi.  The pool and jacuzzi are small, but perfect for a midday dip to cool off.  As a bonus, there is a McDonalds and Panera right next door for quick breakfasts-you never have to move your car. Great value-we will stay here again.
Manager Response: We're happy that your family enjoyed your accommodations and that you found our property to be of great value. Your review is very much appreciated and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great location, perfect choice for your Disneyland vacation!
Summary: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and is a great hotel for your family Disneyland vacation.  The location is absolutely perfect, I timed our walk from the main gate at Disneyland to our door on the 5th floor and it was exactly 7 minutes.  I gave it 4/5 because the rooms are showing their age and the pool is still on the small side (salt water pool).  If you have a large family, get the 1 bedroom king suite.  It has 2 queen beds, a pull out and 1 king bed; you could comfortably sleep 7.  Overall pretty good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. It is great to hear that your family thoroughly enjoyed your 2nd stay with us. We appreciate your feedback regarding the rooms and we hope your family created many magical memories during your visit.

Summary: Clean and comfortable room. With walking  distance to main gate. However was charged for my daughter's car (even though she had her own reservation) that did not belong me and I had to call to request my receipt. It took them several days to straighten it was. Still not sure if it was properly done. With that exception of was a great hotel which is why I gave it a  very good rating
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments regarding your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. It great to hear that your family was satisfied with your accommodations and our close proximity to Disneyland. We apologize for the incorrect parking charge. Please feel free to give us a call in Sales Dept at 714-635-7275 if we can be of further assistance.

Summary: I travelled to Disney with my immediate family and had booked 2 rooms. I called the day before and asked to get checked in early if possible because we had very early reservations in the park. We arrived @ noon, and got our rooms at 1:30 (2 1/2 hours before check in). Big shout out for that since we drove 6 1/2 hours and needed to freshen up before our excursion. The room was clean and serviced promptly by staff. The location of the hotel was awesome as it was a 5 minute walk to the security gate at the park. You wait longer for the light to cross the street than what the walk is. The staff was friendly and helpful. Now the negatives.....there is not a restaurant in the hotel and the Mcdonalds next door is OK. but not to eat everyday. There are other options close by however. On
Manager Response: Thanks for the great feedback. We're delighted that you enjoyed your stay and we hope your family created many "magical" memories at the Happiest Place on Earth. See you next time!

Summary: Usually we like to stay at a Disneyland Hotel, but thought we would try the Camelot this time.  It's location, right across from the main entrance, was very convenient .. as close as the Paradise Pier .. and the rooms were totally acceptable.  Much cheaper than a Disneyland Hotel, without all of the features of course (we did miss the Magic Mornings) we would stay here again on a future visit and recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback. We value your comments and are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Magic Mornings are included with the purchase of a 3, 4, or 5-Day Disney ticket from our Front Desk. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: STAY HERE AS A GREAT ALTERNATIVE TO THE MORE EXPENSIVE RESORTS.
Summary: I booked this hotel as a alternative to paying the higher prices at the Disneyland resort hotels.  Even though I love the Disney hotels for a special occasion, this hotel is clean and super convenient.  Just a short walk across the street from Disneyland. I am not sure, but it may be just as far to walk to the Disney Hotels from the park.  It is a great alternative to the higher prices if you go for the weekend with friends, not kids.  But even with kids it would be fine.  Especially in a pinch, when you need a quick, clean, affordable and quiet place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience. We're glad you enjoyed the short 6-minute walk to Disneyland. In fact, we're actually closer than the Disney hotels to Main Entrance of both parks. We hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future.

Summary: This place is right across the street from Disney! No fighting traffic, just walk across right in! The rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. You can see the Disney fireworks show right from your balcony! Next time you go to Disney, give Camelot a shot!!
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that our ideal location and comfortable rooms stood out to you during your visit. Thank you so much for your review. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary Heading: Perfect location, directly across the street to Disneyland
Summary: As others have mentioned, Camelot Inn is in perfect location directly across the street fro Disneyland.  I've stayed at several hotels in Anaheim over the years, and this trip to Disneyland, it's the first time I stayed within such close proximity.  This is a great property for folks with families and for you big kids who need a quick cat nap in the middle of the day. It's so easy to go back to the hotel to get rejuvenated.   That being said, Camelot Inn is simple but provides the necessities of your stay.  Our room was cleaned in a timely manner, as it was always done by the time we got back mid-day.  Beds were comfortable enough.  I liked that there is still a mini-fridge and microwave.   Water pressure in the shower was a big loop-sided and and not strong enough.  My
Manager Response: Hi Cassandra J,  We are happy to hear that once you were able to check into your room all went smoothly.  Thank you for providing us with some excellent recommendations.  We value your opinion and will bring your input to the attention of our Housekeeping and Maintenance team members.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights over Spring break. When we arrived at the hotel we were able to check in early,  which was nice after our long drive. We stayed in a family suite which had more than enough room for the 5 of us without feeling cramped. The roof top pool and hot tub were nice,  and not overly crowed considering it was Spring Break. Check in/out was a very simple easy process and the staff always greeted us when we returned to the hotel each night. The only down side was the Wifi was spotty. Overall we were happy with our stay and would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Ms J,  Thank you for taking the time to share your review of the Camelot Inn & Suites.  We hope you were able to enjoy the fireworks from the corridor of your room and the pool area if you were back earlier in the evening.  We appreciate you bringing the WiFi issue to our attention and apologize that it was spotty.  This issue has been brought to the attention of the proper department and has been since resolved.  Thank you again for your input as we value your comments. Hope to see  you again soon!

Summary: Was a very pleasant stay! The receptionists were great, the room was spacious and the beds were sooo comfortable! Very close to Disneyland, took me about 6-10 min to walk from the hotel to the gates! We had the 5th floor which was the top floor. Room was close to the highway end of the hotel but it didn't bother us! Would definitely stay again.
