Manager Response: Dear Hey_DW,  We are delighted to read your positive review and thank you for taking the time to share your experience when staying with us.  We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area.

Summary Heading: The SECOND Happiest Place On Earth
Summary: After spending a long and tiring day at "The Happiest Place On Earth", returning to this relaxing hotel was a godsend. ‚Äé With Disneyland being just the short walk across the street, the hotel's proximity to the Park is superb.  The Front Desk attendants were kind and accommodating. They had our reservation on-hand and we were checked-in expeditiously. Very important when attempting to corral young children. Although we did not use the hotel's Valet Service, we were well-wished ("Have a good one") and greeted ("Welcome back") by these friendly folks everyday. It meant a lot to us - thank you. ‚ÄéThe Housekeeping staff were AMAZING!! Upon returning to our room each day we found the beds made and the entire room clean and tidy. They were hospitable and attentive  to our needs.
Manager Response: Dear WaywardTraveller604,  It is great to hear that you enjoyed the Camelot Inn & Suites.  We pride ourselves in providing our guests with excellence in customer service and appreciate your feedback. Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience and we hope you will come back to visit us again soon.

Summary: I just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel with my best friend and her daughter and it was such a great stay. The location of the hotel is perfect. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go, and only a 5-10 minute walk to the park gates. Our room was 432 which was the perfect location. We were able to watch the fireworks from our window every night that they had them, we never heard any noise at all from other rooms or hotel guests, and we were on the same floor as the pool. The room was plenty big enough for the 3 of us.   The staff was always super friendly. We were lucky to be able to get checked in a couple of hours early and the front desk gave us lots of information about nearby restaurants and activities. Every time we returned to the hotel we were greeted
Manager Response: Dear saura m,  Thank you for taking the time to share your positive feedback.  We value your comments and are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Please accept our apologies for the issues you had with the WiFi.  The information provided helps us to improve in the areas where it is needed.  We will make sure the complimentary WiFi is working properly in room 432.     We hope you created "magical" memories to last a lifetime and look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: Not only the location of the hotel, but the location of your room also, is KING! Loved that we were so close to Disney, that leaving the park during the day to retreat at the hotel was easy and convenient. Hotel lobby is really nicely done, the rep that helped me, was amazing, he was super friendly and very accommodating, never had an issue with staff at the hotel. Room location - we got room #430, top floor, corner room, located on the front wing of the property. The hotel is old, they may have done some updates, but those updates are pretty outdated too. The room had the thinnest walls, we could hear everything next door, although we did have a connecting door in our room, so that probably added to the sound level. One of the best parts of having this room located at the front
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. It is great to hear that your family was satisfied with the in-room amenities provided and the convenience of our location. Exciting news: we are in the preliminary stages of planning renovations in all guest rooms.  We are thrilled to have been a part of the magical memories your family created, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Very convenient for the Disney's Theme Parks
Summary: This hotel is the perfect spot to sleep while visiting the Disney's Theme Parks. It very close to the entrance (you reach it by food in a few minutes). The staff is friendly, helpful and straightforward. The rooms are ok, rather old but clean. As a matter of fact, you don't spend that much time in the room so it's a very good option. Furthermore you see the fireworks from the balcony - what do you want more?
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're glad your family enjoyed the Disney fireworks view from your room. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Location and walk across the street
Summary: First time at this property and very Happy. Walking across the street was very convenient with a Grand child age 3. No breakfast but McDonalds is right next door if you eat there. Fireworks can be seen right from your room, a little loud but is only 15-20 minutes or so. Staff are All friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was wonderful. Clean and the beds are very comfortable. Does have a pay laundry area.
Manager Response: It is great to hear that you and your granddaughter enjoyed your recent stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites. We really appreciate you taking the time to write your review.

Summary Heading: Convenient motel minutes walk to Disneyland
Summary: I traveled to Anaheim for runDisney's Star Wars Dark Side Half Marathon weekend in January. I chose this motel due to it's close walking proximity to Disneyland Parks as well as the decently priced per night cost. This is a basic, older motel with no frills that suited my needs. My assigned room was clean, spaciaous and well maintained by housekeeping staff during my weekend stay. I did not take the time to enjoy the rooftop swimming pool, which I'll do on my next stay.
Manager Response: Your comments are important to us, and we are happy to learn that you were satisfied with your accommodations and close proximity to the Disney Parks. We hope you enjoy the fireworks view from our terrace pool during your next visit.

Summary: I was pleasantly impressed with the location and the size of our room. We stayed here for the Avenger's half marathon. The only issue was that it was on the wrong side of security so every time we wanted to go to Downtown Disney or packet pickup, we had to have our bags checked which added extra time. The staff was friendly and I would recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Camelot Inn & Suites for your recent visit to Anaheim. We're glad that you had a pleasant stay and we hope you enjoyed the Avengers Half Marathon Weekend.

Summary: First of all, this hotel is ran by a bunch of kids!!!! very very disrespectful!! i have NEVER had an experience like this in my life!! the rooms were ok, nothing special!!! very very loud area!! but my concern was the staff!!!! I would recommend staying at another one thats very close by!! the PARKING is ridiculous AND they charge YOU A outrageous amount!!!! I DONT RECOMMEND!!
Manager Response: As seen from the many positive reviews we have received throughout the years regarding customer satisfaction,  it is surprising to read your review.  We are deeply sorry that you were unhappy with our front office team members, however, without a detailed account of your concerns,  it is difficult to assess the issues if any, pertaining to our staff.  Parking in this area has become increasingly demanding over the past few years and in order to provide parking for each and every guest, we hired a parking company to ensure that parking spots would be available.  Although parking is 15.00 plus tax per day, our guests have the leisure of utilizing valet parking at no additional cost.

Summary: We usually stay next door and love it there‚Ä¶however the Camelot offered a price we could not pass up and so we spent our 11 nights enjoying the Camelot!  Everything was as expected.  We arrived at 9am (after arriving from a flight from Australia) but couldn‚Äôt check in until nearly 4pm. (we were aware that this was the check in time so we were prepared for the wait.) We left our luggage at the hotel and went for a walk / lunch etc‚Ä¶.  Room was clean and there was plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 teenage girls - and all of our luggage! Room had a mini fridge, microwave, safe, a small table and 2 chairs. Everything we need for our stay.  Two minor complaints‚Ä¶. No water pressure at all in shower‚Ä¶.I mean NO water pressure‚Ä¶.it was like a trickle of water‚Ä¶.this wasn‚Äôt a one off‚Ä¶it was
Manager Response: We apologize for the poor water pressure in your room. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will alert maintenance to check the water pressure in our guest rooms. During your next stay please feel free to request early housekeeping service with one of our team members. We appreciate your feedback and it's great to hear you'll be returning at the end of the year.

Summary: Very nice place...not too fancy but if you are going to Disneyland who needs fancy? I will be back..I go to Disney every year..I am a California native but like to stay at Disney for several days..The Camelot was nice but not too costly so I could enjoy my vacation
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad that you found our property to be of good value and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: I have stayed at several motels at Disneyland and this may be my new favorite. Not because it is the nicest or fanciest but for overall convenience and value this is a winner. The location is perfect, just across the street and a few doors down from the main entrance. There are several good restaurants nearby: Panera, Mimi's, and Pizza Press to name a few. One of the best things about the Camelot is the family suite. You get two rooms; one with two queen beds and one with a king bed and pull out sofa. There is a dining table with 4 chairs, a desk and chair, 2 small mini fridges and a microwave. This was great for breakfast in the room a couple of days and for eating take out pizza from the Pizza Press next door. We really enjoyed having the extra space. The swimming pool and
Manager Response: We are delighted to be your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland, and we thank you for providing great feedback. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Overall great hotel. Location was great. 15 minute walk from the hotel to the main Disney gates. That's with the crosswalk, bag check and metal detectors.   As stated before the hotel is older, but it is clean. We stayed in family suite which was great for a family with little kids. Kids had their own room while the adults had their space as well.  Beds were comfy after a long day at the park. Suite had a safe, fridge, microwave, and coffee maker.   Unfortunately the weather was not great in order to use the pool. The sister hotel Tropicana has a nicer pool which you also have access too.   Located next door is a McDonald's and a Pizza Press. Close by is a little store that has water, milk, cereals and snacks. There is also an IHOP near the crosswalk to the parks, *kids eat for
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write your review. Thank you for highlighting our spacious Family Suite, various hotel amenities, and convenient location. We hope to extend our hospitality to your family again in the future.

Summary: We stayed in the family suite while visiting Disneyland. The room was large and comfortable although the bathroom was a bit small. The staff was helpful and stored our bags until our room was ready so that we could get to the park. The coffee was terrible so recommend getting your own. There was a frig in the room which was convenient. The hotel is right across from the park so no need to pay for a shuttle. Would definitely stay here again if we had a large group (we had 5 sharing the room with a King bed in one room and two Queens in the adjoining room).
Manager Response: It is great to hear that you enjoyed your accommodations and our property's convenient location. Thank you for your thoughtful review.

Summary: This hotel is literally across for Disneyland.  We saved on parking in the park by walking over each day.  The staff was friendly and the room was nice.  We watch fireworks at Disneyland from the pool too.  My only complaint is that I had to pay to park here.
Manager Response: We're so glad your family enjoyed the view of Disney's fireworks show from our terrace level pool. Thank you for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: Walk cross street to DL, very comfortable beds for 'bad back' people, clean, well kept, updated, professional and helpful people, next door to McD's, quiet, spacious, no complaints! Denny's a few doors away. Microwave, fridge, pool + hot tub we didn't have chance to use. Sayed 4th floor, #425, 'Return guest price $99., 1st week Feb 2017. Kids happy the street side looked like a castle.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It is great to learn that you were satisfied with your room, hotel amenities, and the convenience of our location.  We hope your family created many magical memories during your stay!

Summary: The room: We stayed in the two room family room. It's HUGE! When u walk in, there is a pull out couch and coffee table , then a king bed, with a tv in front of it. Then the little kitchen area has a decent sized table with four chairs and behind that is a sink, a fridge and a microwave. Theres a small cloaet dresser to the left of that. Then you open the door to the next room and there's two queen beds to the left and a chair in the corner and a tv and dresser in front of the beds. To the right of that a closet and iron and ironing board. Then a long counter with one sink and a huge mirror. To the corner is the bathroom with a toilet and bath tub. This is a tiny area and very cramped. The shower pressure was low and the towels were pretty rough and we didn't have soap or shampoo
Manager Response: We very much appreciate your detailed review and we hope your family created many magical memories during your stay. Looking forward to your next visit!

Summary: Great location.  Room was clean and well maintained.  Was not fancy but the price was reasonable for what we got.  Walked to Disneyland.  The short walk was really nice both to and from the park.  Would stay there again.
Manager Response: It is great to hear that your family enjoyed your accommodations and close proximity to the Disney Parks. We are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, which allows our guests to return to the hotel for a nap, a dip in the pool, or meal time before going back to the parks in the evening. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Just got back from Camelot and had a wonderful stay there. We were in a family suite room 331. The windows face Disneyland. We were told you can see fireworks from here, unfortunately there were none during our stay. There is an elevator and exterior entrance doors. You are allotted 1 parking space per room. The suite is quite spacious. There is a king size bed, sofa that opens to a double, sizable table w 4 chairs,  kitchenette area w small microwave, refrigerator, sink, coffee pot, and tv in the main room. The bedroom has 2 queen beds, tv, and small refrigerator. There is a small safe in the room. The beds were super comfy. The furniture and room appeared to have been recently rehabbed. There is not a separate sink/vanity area outside the bathroom, but that is also very roomy.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you very much for your thorough review. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: My daughters and I got a 2 room suite. First off there is no landscaping. It just is a parking lot. A negative for me. You can't park your own car and you have to rely on valet service. The reason being is that being across the street from Disneyland, they sell the parking spots on the motel lot for Disneyland visitors. Did not like this at all and the valet ended up scrapping the rental car and tried to hide it. Eventually their insurance paid for it. The best part of it was that it is an easy walk to Disneyland. The room was ok but don't think would stay there again
Manager Response: Our English tutor-style property features landscaping at the front of the hotel, including charming window boxes with a colorful array flowers. Both self-parking and valet parking are offered at $15.00 plus tax per day. Occasionally when the hotel‚Äôs occupancy reaches 100%, it becomes necessary to valet all cars to ensure each hotel guest‚Äôs vehicle can be accommodated in our lot. Day parking for non-hotel guests is not offered during these times. Our valet manager informed us that there have been no incident reports or insurance claims. If you would like to discuss this in more detail, feel free to contact us.  We hope you and your daughters enjoyed your spacious Family Suite and we thank you for comments regarding your stay.

Summary: Could not fault location but very old property in old style inn arrangement. Shower water strength excellent, beds comfy, and pillows ok. TV very local. WiFi quite slow, dated service. Room wasn't cleaned day two, so not impressed. Long narrow rooms. Main issue is the noise as every foot fall from room above is transferred, very poor. Even the vacuum cleaning above sounds like it is in your own room. Make sure you ask for highest rooms.
Manager Response: We are glad to hear that you found our beds to be comfortable as a good night‚Äôs rest is important when spending long days at the Disney Parks. Our complimentary high-speed Wi-Fi service is powered by AT&T. Guest rooms are cleaned daily unless a ‚ÄúDo Not Disturb‚Äù sign is left on the door. Exciting news: we are in the preliminary stages of planning room renovations. Stay tuned!

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable, Basic, and so close to Disneyland // A thumbs up from me
Summary: We for our Disneyland mini stay decided to pick one of the Harbor Drive basic motels that are a super close to Disneyland for walking over.  For me, comfy beds were of upmost importance, so I narrowed choices down to properties that had reviews emphasizing this and from there I let DS 21 look at pictures and pick.  He picked this one, and we both were very happy with our choice.  I'm picky on beds, and these worked just fine for me.  DS I believe picked this property over other choices I gave him for the cute little pool area and hot tub.  And this area was nice I thought. Do note that the pool is smaller than it looks in the photos and only three feet deep.  I actually think that if you have little ones, that is a positive, not a negative.  One night too, DS met some other 20
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your thorough review. We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary Heading: Good or bad experience depending on your room
Summary: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary by going to Disneyland. We stayed at Camelot for 2 nights. Within the short 2 nights, we experience both worst and the best this place had to offer.  THE WORST: THE FIRST NIGHT: We checked in on Sunday afternoon around 6pm. The lady at the front desk who checked us in was very cold. No smile, no "welcome", barely a "hello". She was very curt with us, saying just the bare minimum. We did not feel welcome at all. Then we get up to our room #320, which was toward the middle of the property, pass the pool. The room was small (we expected this), typical 3-star hotel room, nothing fancy. Immediately we could hear the family in the room above us.The ceiling was very thin. The family above us apparently has small children, because we
Manager Response: We would like to wish you and your husband a very Happy Anniversary and we thank you for selecting the Camelot Inn & Suites for your trip to Disneyland. We appreciate you taking the time to share your detailed review. Our Front Office Manager has been made aware of your check in experience and has discussed your feedback with the desk clerk. She apologizes for her unwelcoming attitude and thanks you for bringing this to our attention as this allows us the opportunity to improve.  We are delighted that our front desk attendants were able to provide you with a complimentary upgrade to a room facing Disneyland the following morning. It is nice to hear that you enjoyed a quiet and comfortable night‚Äôs sleep after watching the fireworks from your balcony. Thank you again for sharing your experience; we hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future.

Summary: They have a family suite that is very comfortable for a big family. The big draw for this hotel is that it is just a short walk to the crosswalk to Disneyland. It was spacious, more so than the average hotel room, especially near Disneyland. There was lots of closet space, dressers, drawers, counters, table and coffee table. The pull out sofa bed was already made. They had lots of channels on the tv as well as input access for our portable dvd player. No room service and the in-room coffee was awful. BUT, there is a McDonald's a quick 5 minute walk away. The fridge was cold and ready for us, a microwave, a small cabinet to keep food items, and a good size counter with sink. The sink was poorly executed with the wrong type of faucet installed at the wrong distance to the edge of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Our family Suite is designed to comfortably accommodate up to 8 guests with the inclusion of an optional rollaway bed. It is great to hear that your family was satisfied with the in-room amenities provided and the convenience of our location. We are thrilled to have been a part of the magical memories your family created, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Great location, right opposite the entry to Disneyland. Budget hotel, we had a family suite which was very spacious with two rooms. We were near the back of the hotel so no street noise. Very quiet with heaters in both rooms.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed our spacious Family Suite. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Pros Very close to Disneyland. Enough eating of options nearby. Fantastic viewing of nightly fireworks. On site scooter hire and cheaper than park. Clean rooms comfortable beds.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Laundry available  Cons Can be very noisey from people passing along  balcony, 4th floor not ideal near the pool or elevators. Bathrooms dated and require better showers as water goes everywhere.  Overall it us a 3star hotel that gave us what we required which was a place yo sleep each night after visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. Thank you for highlighting the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites offers, such as Disney fireworks view, on-site scooter rental, and laundry facilities. Good news: we are in the preliminary stages of planning renovations in all guest rooms. Stay tuned!

Summary: We really enjoyed staying at the camelot. We visited Disneyland during the busy summer time, it was extremely helpful to be close enough to walk to the parks. We were up early each day to visit disneyland and were able to walk back for the kids naptime. The location made our trip much less stressful and helped me enjoy the trip as much as my little ones did!
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks. Thanks so much for your review!

Summary: As Disneyland pass holders we've stayed at many hotels near the park and the Camelot is hands down the best place to stay in our opinion. Two things stand out, its location and the quality of the rooms vs the amount you will spend. The location is hard to beat, 5 minutes to the gates and really easy to walk for any family. The rooms are great, we have a family of 6 and stay in the family suite. It's spacious, comfortable, and a great value. This is and always will be our go to hotel, our only complaint is they book out too fast so you have to plan ahead during peak time periods. What a great place filled with great associates, stay here if you can you won't be disappointed!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on your most recent visit to the Camelot Inn & Suites. It sounds like our spacious family Suite was the perfect option for your family of 6. We are delighted to be your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland. See you next time!

Summary Heading: Good place for a Disney vacation.
Summary: Pros  Walking distance to Disneyland  Stroller and Scooter rental on site  24 hr valet/parking lot security  Friendly staff Clean rooms  Great toiletries  Fridge and micro in room  Cons  Parking is not free Beds are very hard  No breakfast options  Coffee in room was very bitter  Many fees, credit card charged multiple times instead of once.
Manager Response: Thank you for your input. We would like to point out that there are several breakfast options next door to us such as Panera, McDonald‚Äôs and the Cove on Harbor Coffee House. We are one of the few properties on Harbor that do not charge resort fees. Upon check in, we only charge room & tax and parking fees. In regards to the extra charges mentioned, additional vehicles and a room upgrade were charged separately to your account. Thank you again for your review. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We stayed here for two nights in november.  The service was very good, nice and friendly staff at the reception.  The room was big, clean, the bed was comfortable. There are lots of restaurants near the hotel and disneyland is only a short walk away. There is also free parking, which is great if you have a car. We had such a great stay!!!
Manager Response: Dear Giuiliana D,  We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us on your most recent visit to the Camelot Inn & Suites.  Parking is $12.00 plus tax per night and Valet parking is not additional charge.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and we look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary Heading: Excellent location, great value for money
Summary: Our family visited Disneyland resort and stayed at Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites. We stayed for four nights. We found the location very convenient, there is a Mc Donald's next door that is open 24hrs, and a convenience store (Cove Bar) less than 100 m away. Crossing the road at the traffic light nearby brings you to the Disneyland resort bus station and the entrance of the two resorts in less than 5 mins walk.  The only hotel closer to the traffic light is their Sister resort Tropicana Inn and Suites and a Best Western.  Amenities wise, there is parking at the hotel and a service staff on at all hours of the day keeping an eye on your cars. A very clean laundry room with an arcade machine. Do bring one dollar notes though to change for quarters. One can even rent an automated
Manager Response: It is great to hear that your family enjoyed the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites provides. Thank you for highlighting our ideal location, 24 hour front desk, laundry and scooter rental services. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback and we hope to see you again in 2017!

Summary: We have stayed at many Anaheim hotels but this is definitely our hotel of choice every time we come to Disneyland. The family suites are great for large parties, the front desk is helpful with additional ticket purchases and setting us up with transportation. There are close restaurants but we really miss Millie's and when the hotel had continental breakfast. Coming back in March 2017 with the whole family, hopefully we'll get a Harbor Blvd front family unit with a balcony this time! We love this place!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. We‚Äôre happy to hear that your family is consistently satisfied with the accommodations and services provided by the Camelot Inn & Suites, and we truly appreciate being your hotel of choice when visiting the Disneyland area. Please call the hotel directly and ask for the Sales Dept to ensure your room request is notated on your reservation. We look forward to seeing you in March!

Summary: We have stayed at several motels across the street from Disneyland.  This was the first time at the Camelot Inn. We stayed for 5 nights and the trip was absolutely amazing. Everyone was so nice and friendly...from the front desk staff to the valet. We were greeted every single day when we left and came back. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: We're glad to hear that our friendly staff helped make your family's trip memorable. Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. Looking forward to your next visit!

Summary: Camelot inn was perfectly located to access disneyland resort.  It was clean, quiet and comfortable - and the balcony offers the perfect view of the Disney fireworks if you're not at the park.  With a pizza & ihop pretty close food wasn't an issue.  About a 10 minute walk to the Disney entrance - and about 15 minute walk to downtown Disney.  Pricing was good too.  Recommend this one if you're going to Disney.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. It is great to hear that you enjoyed the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites offers, and we are delighted your family took advantage of the fantastic view of Disney's firework display form your balcony.

Summary: Nice hotel.  Room style and decor are outdated.  However, room was clean and comfortable.  Several cheap food options near by.  Staff was nice and helpful.  The pool was of good size for kids. One could see Disney fireworks from the room. Free internet but there was a fee to park. Decent value given the location. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback. It is nice to learn that your family appreciated the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites provides. We are just 600 steps away from Disney‚Äôs Main Entrance and we offer a fantastic view of the famous firework display from our terrace level pool. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We love staying at the Camelot Inn. It is across the street from Disneyland which makes it easy to get to. The beds are comfortable and if your lucky you will get a room facing the park so you can see the fireworks. The staff is very friendly. The parking fills up quick and valet takes a bit but its a great place to stay if you don't want to spend big money at the Disney resorts
Manager Response: Thank you for being one of our valued returning guests. We appreciate your comments and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: If you're planning to spend most of your time in Disneyland, this hotel is perfect. 2 minutes walking distance! Everything is simple but sufficient. There's a little swimming pool and spa, fridges and microwaves in the rooms, and decent hot water! The people who work here are just lovely too, greeting us so nicely and always offering to help. They made our stay perfect.
Manager Response: We're very happy to hear that our close proximity to Disneyland and our helpful staff made your family's stay special and memorable. Thank you so much for your review.

Summary: Great location across the road from the entrance to the Disney parks. Lots of food places either side of hotel. Very friendly and obliging staff!!! Great view of fireworks from pool deck. The hotel is not a new shiny glittery place but it is very clean and great value for where it is located. I would definitely recommend
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write your review. Thank you for highlighting our convenient location, friendly staff, and fireworks view from our property. We hope to extend our hospitality to your family again in the future.

Summary: Stayed at the Camelot for 4 nights and would be more than happy to stay there again. Good size room with very comfortable king bed and separate couch / divan. Coffee table, writing desk and a couple of chairs.  Bathroom included spa bath. Polite staff greeted you each day. Wifi internet in the room, good tv and tea / coffee making facilities including fridge and microwave.   Highly recommended.
Manager Response: We are delighted to learn that your family enjoyed your accommodations and in-room   amenities. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary: Stayed at the Anaheim Camelot Inn and suites for 7 nights. Firstly I will say the location of this hotel is unbeatable. It is right across the street from Disneyland and about a 5 min walk to the main gate. There are also quite a few restaurants nearby the hotel and Pizza press is right next door also very convenient.  Our room was located on the fourth floor which is the pool level and you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the pool area which was fantastic. The room is basic, but clean and very roomy for two adults and two children, the room consisted of a mini fridge a flat screen TV, a safe and 2 queen beds, the vanity area is outside of the bathroom which is great, however the bathroom itself is a little on the smallish side.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and
Manager Response: It is great to learn that you were satisfied with your room, hotel amenities, and the convenience of our location. Thank you for writing your review. We hope your family created many magical memories during your stay and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Disneyland visit!
Summary: I frequently visit Anaheim often for my son's doctor and during this particular visit we decided to go to Disneyland.  I brought my mother along, who couldn't recall the last time she visited.  She's disabled and we were able to rent a electric scooter for her directly at the hotel!   With my husband, mother, my two sons and myself we went with the family suite.  First off, it is very hard to find a room in Anaheim that offers what this room does.  The Family suite had two queen beds in one room, and in the common area a king bed!  The couch I believe was a pullout but the 3 beds were enough for us.  The room was clean and there were 2 mini fridges and a tv in each room.  One thing I wish the room had was an extra bathroom.  We also had an issue with the cable not working one
Manager Response: We‚Äôre glad to hear that your mother was happy with our electric scooter rental service. It sounds like our Family Suite was the perfect choice for your party and we appreciate your mention of the amenities included. We hope to extend our hospitality to your family again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: Only bad point room wasn't ready till 4 think they forgot us but we left our luggage and went to Disneyland anyway , room was clean ,comfortable  , quiet , amenities good ,staff were helpful and friendly gift shop had milk on hand in the shop , overall if you want something close to Disneyland a good place to stay
Manager Response: Hotel check in time is 4:00 p.m. and complimentary luggage storage is provided so our guests may begin enjoying Disneyland right away. It is great to learn that you were satisfied with your room and the convenience of our gift shop and mini market. Thank you for writing your review. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The room was very clean and in good condition, the pool area and hot tub was nice. Great view of Disneyland. Everyone was very nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience. It is great to hear that you were happy with your accommodations and enjoyed spending time at our tranquil pool after a fun-filled day at the Disney Parks. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Older but clean and adequate. Reasonably sized room. A/C nosier but I could still sleep. Pool clean and easily accessible. Reception helpful. Close to food outlets (Ihops, Pizza). See the firewords from Disneyland every night. Easy walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are glad that our friendly staff, spacious rooms, and close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip a memorable one.

Summary Heading: Great place to enjoy the park
Summary: We spent 3 nights while having fun at Disneyland. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The only negative comment I could make is that the gift shop on-site is not very well stocked and the people in it are not very friendly. They are the only employees we found, however, that were not extremely friendly and helpful. It made us wonder if they contract the store and are maybe not Camelot employees.  It is an easy walk from the main gate to the room. I watched the fireworks from just outside the door one night. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! It is great to hear you took advantage of the Disney fireworks view from your room. We are thrilled to have been a part of the magical memories your family created and hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Camelot Inn and Suites - Clean Rooms, Close Proximity, and Honest Staff!!
Summary: I cannot write enough how much we like the Camelot Inn and Suites. We‚Äôve stayed here at least 5 times now and always have a great stay, but this last time really deserves a mention.   We arrived at the hotel early (much earlier than check-in time) and were pleasantly surprised when a room would be available a mere 15 minutes after arriving. Both guys at the front desk were very friendly and asked how our flight was, etc. They offered to hold our luggage while we went over to McDonald‚Äôs (right next door) to grab a soda after the long flight. Came back, checked-in, and went to the room. We were greeted with a clean and spacious room, with very comfortable beds and nice feather pillows.  We had a planned room change during our stay from a standard room to a king family suite. They
Manager Response: Wow it is always a pleasure to receive such positive reviews from our guests! We are delighted that our Front Desk, Housekeeping, and Valet staff helped make your most recent stay special and memorable. Thank you for selecting the Camelot Inn & Suites as your home away from home when visiting the Disney Resort.

Summary: We are currently here, and have been for a few days. I cannot think of anything negative to say. The beds are comfy more than enough room for our party of 8, the distance from park to hotel is fabulous (timed- 4 minutes from 4th floor to bag check at Disney)  The staff is friendly, valet parking is included with your daily parking fees, wifi connection is strong, pool is 3 1/2 feet and perfect for littles.  The view of the fireworks nightly can't be beat.  If we come back to Disney in the future would absolutely be our first choice in hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for the great review! We truly appreciate being your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland.

Summary: We stayed 2 nights.  Really close walk to Disney land.  Staff friendly.  Rooms clean & tidy. We were on the 5th floor & could see fireworks over Disneyland from the balcony. A few decent choices of places to eat close by (recommend the pizza place next door). Car parking available & valets helpful. Had a great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience. It is great to hear that you were happy with our hospitality and enjoyed the convenience our location. We are thrilled to have been a part of the magical memories your family created.

Summary: Clean motel. Swimming pool on 2nd floor. Laundry,valet, gift shop with atm not always open kind of expensive for a motel.could see fireworks from second floor. next to McDonald's. Friendly staff stayed late June 2016
Manager Response: Thank you for your input. We are glad you took advantage of the great view of Disney's famous firework display from our property. Hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: No complaints.  It's nothing special. But there is nothing wrong with it either.  Staff is super friendly from the check in to the parking attendant.  Our room was clean.  Staff did a great job daily.  Air conditioning worked well.  Supplies were great.  Really it was a place to rest our heads before out daily trek to Disneyland.   I was a little concerned with the noise, only to the room next door with a joining door, but it was only one morning.  We were on the upper floor close to the pool so we never heard any roof noise.  Ice maker on the top floor didn't work, but a short walk to the 4th level was fine.  The best thing is location -- just a hop skip and a jump.  Excellent....
Manager Response: We are so happy that our helpful staff and close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip memorable. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary: I arrived on Friday 14 th Oct at 3.20pm and was able to check in straight away . I was greeted with a smile. I had forgotten I had requested (when I booked)a room near the front of the hotel as I was a solo female traveller. Well Wow - Room 430!! A room with a balcony facing the park- thank you so much :) .   I had a double queen room which was all avail when I booked but worked out great as I used the second bed for my heavy suitcase ( I'd been LA for the week so lots of shopping was done ).   The walk to the park was easy , there was a McDonald's next door which I didn't need and a drink and ice machine in the corridor.  I wasn't bothered by any noise for other guests or the passing traffic .   On checkout day the friendly staff stored my 4 bags and then the vallet helped me
Manager Response: We are so happy you chose to stay with us and we are glad you enjoyed the Disney view from your room's balcony. Our valet was happy to of be assistance with your luggage. Thank you for your positive and detailed review; we look forward to meeting your family next year!

Summary Heading: Everyone wants to stay in the castle hotel!
Summary: The location is fantastic, less than a block to Disney. We stayed in the suite with 1 King, 2 Queens and a pull out couch. It slept 5 of us (adult women) very comfortably with plenty of room to spread out. The bathroom was located in the 2 queen room. Shower and toilet are separate with the sink being on the outside. For a room that sleeps up to 7, I think there should be at least 1.5 baths. There is a wet-bar type sink in the other room that helped with being able to brush teeth and whatnot. Microwave, mini-fridge (<- very mini, didn't fit restaurant leftover boxes very well, but kept our drinks nice and cold) and coffee pot were all in the room. Plenty of pillows and everything was clean. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: It is good to hear that you were satisfied with the cleanliness of our property and the convenience of our location. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Excellent location and very pleased with our choice.
Summary: Arrived from the airport and all tired on the 10/142016 and was given a family sized room that we asked for in the top floor and quiet and so very pleased. We are staying for a week and so it had to be a good choice. Ideal location for Disney parks just a few minutes walk there so able to return to the hotel for a break and return to Disney. All towels cleaned every day, replacements always done and very clean.staff all very friendly and helpful and the sister hotel is just up the block the tropical but we prefer this one. McDonald's next door and other eateries very close by.
Manager Response: We are very happy to learn that your room requests were met and that you are satisfied with your accommodations. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from Disney's main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and very close to Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed in a family suite. We were pleasantly surprised by the very spacious rooms, comfortable beds and quiet surrounds. The pool area is great for young children and fabulous to watch the Disneyland fireworks from. The pool is very basic but it was a refreshing change from the heat of Disneyland. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your most recent experience while staying at the Camelot Inn & Suites. We are delighted that you enjoyed your Family Suite and took advantage of the fantastic view of the fireworks from our 4th floor pool. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Clean, spacious and perfectly located. The room suited us well as we were there only to sleep after a massive day at DISNEYLAND. It's location was perfect as it was close enough (10 mins) to walk to the parks and within minutes of eateries. Would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: It is lovely to hear that your family was satisfied with the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites provides. We thank you for your review and hope you created magical memories at the "Happiest Place on Earth". Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: You get exactly what you expect at the Camelot.  You can't beat the location - it is right across the road from the Disneyland front gate. This is the third time that we have stayed here -mainly due to its location.  The hotel is basically a 1960s motor inn with some cheesy faux Medieval decoration.  The rooms are what you would expect from this but have been updated. The rooms are impeccably clean and comfortable enough.  The hotel has a basic pool and other facilities that help if you are travelling with a family or for an extended period.  The guest laundry and small grocery store are great to have.   The staff can be inconsistent and service is a lottery of the person you strike at the time.  We encountered both wonderful service - Crystal is an asset to the place - and
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing a detailed account of your most recent stay. As this was your 3rd visit, we are delighted to be your hotel of choice when visiting the Disneyland area. We are happy to learn that you are consistently satisfied with our property‚Äôs cleanliness, comfortable rooms, and convenient location.   Please accept our apologies for your disappointing check in experience. Unfriendly behavior is unusual and we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. Per the hotel‚Äôs security policy, Lobby doors are to be locked at midnight. Guests that arrive after this time are helped from the night window. We value your comments regarding the late check in procedure and it will be brought up to management for discussion.

Summary: We lucked out that they had one clean suite (which is what we booked) clean and ready for check in at noon when we arrived. The room was HUGE. You walk in to a king bed, a fold out couch with coffee table, a dresser with a nice sized tv, and then there is a large kitchen table, with four chairs. there is a sink with a counter with a mini fridge, and a very mini microwave and a coffee maker. There is a large wardrobe closet as well and plenty of space if you needed to add one or even two ore beds. Then the second room, that is separated by a door, had two double beds and a chair and a tv stand with dresser another wardrobe closet and a large bathroom counter with sink, the toilet and shower were separated by a door for privacy to the bathroom. The beds were super comfy and the
Manager Response: It sounds like our spacious family Suite was the perfect choice for your family. During your next stay, we hope you'll be able to take advantage of the fireworks view from the terrace level pool. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your detailed review!

Summary: Great place to stay with family. Hotel may not have it all but staff goes out of its way to accommodate you. We stayed week in family suite two rooms three beds. We had problems with bathroom light and backed up sink. They fixed all right away no questions asked. Prices are normal for area so it's not cheep but I have no complaints with that place what so ever. Great view of park at night and close to all food and park gates. I even tipped gal that cleans rooms. They use vallet for parking and he's their 24 hrs. Makes you feel safer knowing he's there.
Manager Response: We are delighted that our helpful staff and close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip memorable. Your generosity is appreciated by the Housekeeping staff. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary Heading: Dirty Rooms and not very Friendly Staff!
Summary: We just came home from out Trip to Disneyland, and stayed at the Camelot Inn.  When we arrived the lady at the front desk told us we had to pay for the hotel room up front along with the deposit. We explained we wanted to pay cash, she then proceeded to tell us you can, but right now we will charge your card for the full amount and then you can pay cash at the end. We asked why would be pay 2x for the room, and she said you just have too. We asked for a manager and she said he was not in, again we asked for the manager and asked her to then call him, come to find out he was there the whole time. The manager (gentleman), really was no help but finally were able and paid Cash for our room, with only having to place the deposit on the CC.  We get to out room, I do the normal look
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing the housekeeping issues to our attention.   We apologize for any inconvenience you encountered.  Rest assured the bath mat has been replaced and we have found the room to be insect free. We were very much  aware of your concerns.  Our two Supervisors, Assistant General Manager and Front Office Manager tried their utmost to be of assistance.   Our Front Office Manager did speak with your sister regarding your concerns, as you were unavailable.  She offered to move you to another room.  She also let your sister know that after careful review of the security footage in our parking lot, we did not see any speeding or inappropriate handling of your vehicle.   We do ask for payment in full upon check in.  We understand that you preferred to pay cash, however, we require the cash payment upon check in.  We provided an option to pay with your credit card upon check in and then if you still preferred to pay cash at check out we would credit your card.  We apologize for any miscommunication. Again, we thank you for your feedback and will miss not having the opportunity to extend our hospitality to you in December.

Summary: We just returned from another stay at this hotel. It again was a wonderful time. This hotel is very clean, close to Disneyland and close to food outlets. The staff is outstanding and are so so helpful. We purchased our tickets to disney from their front desk and there is no waiting in lines to but tickets.  I know I put my holiday plans at risk by telling you once again about the hotel. But it does for sure offer it all.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for the great review! We truly appreciate being your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland. We're thrilled to have been a part of the magical memories your family created during your most recent visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: We just returned from a week at Camelot and there is little other that "near perfect" to say.  We had a family suite.  Both rooms had great wheelchair access.  We had two wheelchairs and a scooter in our party. All three easily fit into the suite!    Only issue we faced was the whining of pipes when rooms above us took showers. Otherwise it was perfect!  While it didn't have a breakfast, McDonalds is right next door
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your positive experience! It is nice to hear that our spacious Family Suite was the perfect option for your party. We look forward to seeing you again next time :)

Summary: We've stayed here on 2 of our 3 trips to Disneyland and we don't see a need to stay anywhere else. Clean, Friendly staff, short walk to the parks and Downtown Disney, great fireworks views from the pool, Convenience store on property and a bigger one next door, No issues at all in 2 stays. A++++
Manager Response: We are thrilled to be your hotel of choice when visiting the Disneyland area! It is great to hear that your family enjoys the convenience of our location, friendly staff members, and the fireworks view from our property. Thank you so very much for taking the time to write your review.

Summary: My son and I just returned from a four night stay at the Anaheim Camelot Inn. The hotel is nothing fancy, but our room was clean, we had a great view of the fireworks from the balcony right outside, and the location is great. The room was fairly spacious. We had two queen beds, a table with two chairs, refrigerator, microwave and a in room safe. The main wall separating the room from the walkway seems to be very thin. The noise traveled big time. As well as loud neighbors directly above us. We didn't however hear anything from the neighbors to either side of us. The staff was friendly and overall it was a good choice for our trip.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. It is great to hear that you enjoyed the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites offers, and we are delighted your family took advantage of the fantastic view of Disney's firework display from your room.

Summary: If you stay here and housekeeping throws out your items, you are in for it. They either threw out or flushed away an expensive orthodontic item. After 4 trips to front desk and leaving a cell phone number 3 of those times, I was never offered any kind of compensation. I received an email now 3 days after our 7 night stay after I complained again, to be told that I never left contact information and that they were not at fault.  The lack of compassion and dismissal of accountability is astounding. This would have been an okay place if not for this experience. It's easy to dismiss a bad review until it happens to you, just remember that. Therefore we will never recommend this hotel. I can overlook the need of updating, the small pool, the outrageous parking, the very thin walls
Manager Response: Dear Doddfamilyfun,  Thank you for your feedback.  As soon as you reported this issue to our front office team member he acted promptly by contacting our head housekeeper.  Every trash bag was searched as well as a thorough inspection of your room.  When you spoke with our Front Office Manager she did explain to you that if  the item does appear she would contact you.  Rest assured, we were and have been very much aware of this issue and exhausted every means possible to locate your misplaced item.  A few years ago, we found it necessary to hire a parking company to guarantee a parking spot for each and every guest.  Our parking attendants work hard to make sure that the lot accommodates every vehicle. Our 4th - floor wading pool offers a fantastic view of the fireworks on warm summer evenings.  We hope you had the opportunity to enjoy the extravaganza while relaxing in the heated pool and/or jacuzzi.  We receive many compliments on our rooms especially the comfortable beds.  We would have been happy to move you to another location if you were distracted by sounds of guests above or next to you.  There are times when the excitement of  guests walking on the corridor to get to the elevators on their way  to Disneyland can sometimes be noisy, however, this is usually during the morning hours when most all guests are up and getting ready to enjoy their time at the "Happiest Place on Earth".  Thank you once again for sharing your concerns and we are sorry that you feel the Camelot Inn & Suites is not the right fit for you.  We hope you will reconsider and give us another try on your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights.  Nothing spectacular, however......clean and very close to Disneyland !!!!!  Would definately stay again.  Unfortunately way too many people (kids) in the pool, so unable to swim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We hope your family created many magical memories while visiting the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: Great stay! Clean, comfortable and very friendly staff. 5 min walk to the park. Great when u need a little break. We would often go for 2 hours and come back. Would stay here again and recommend to any families. 2 queen room on 5th floor. Used the laundry room once and lots of food options close by. In room safe, coffee maker small fridge and microwave were all great amnenities.
Manager Response: Your positive feedback is greatly appreciated. Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from the main gates, many of our guests take advantage of returning to the hotel to relax before enjoying the evening fun at the parks.   We look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: We checked in on September 1st at 12 noon and were able to get our room right away. We were there for the Disneyland half marathon and we were so close to the park, expo and the run. Only a 5 minute walk to the park. Room was good sized. Had a refrigerator and microwave. Was great watching the fireworks every night from the hotel. Many restaurants nearby. We went to Downtown Disney, Anaheim Gardenwalk, McDonalds, Panera's, Denny's and IHOP. All within walking distance. We did not have a car and were able to walk everywhere. Rented a car one day to do the beaches and San Diego. Car rental was right around the corner and we were able to walk there and get it. The valet guys at the hotel were great and let us pick up our stuff at the hotel to load into the car at no charge! The Mi
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We appreciate that you mentioned our spacious rooms, friendly customer service, and of course our proximity to Disneyland. Please accept our apologies for the unwelcome wake-up call. We hope to extend our hospitality to you again for the next RunDisney Marathon.

Summary Heading: Perfect for our family trip to Disneyland.
Summary: We booked the king suite at the Camelot Inn and Suites for our trip to Disneyland. it was perfect for our visit to Disney with myself, my husband, my 3yr old, and my in-laws. The two-room king suite was the perfect size for the five of us, and you can't beat the price! Although the property does not have some of the amenities of nearby properties like a splash water park, etc. we did not miss them. And there is a great view of the park fireworks from many of the rooms!  It is an easy walk (6 minutes) to the park entrance and Downtown Disney, which are just across the street. This allows you to access all of the Disney attractions without a car or shuttle. And when your kid starts getting overwhelmed and freaking out you can make a quick exit right back to your room for some down
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on your most recent visit to the Camelot Inn & Suites. It sounds like our spacious family Suite was the perfect choice for your family of 5. We are delighted that you took advantage of our location and superb fireworks view form the terrace level pool. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Best view of the Disneyland fireworks!
Summary: Wow! We were blown away by this hotel. Location, location, location!!!  It is right across the road from Disneyland. It is so important to stay close! We watched so many poor people leaving Disneyland at 11pm to have to then get on a shuttle to get back to our hotel, where we just walked across the road, bought some food and went to the hotel. Please don't underestimate the size of US 'blocks' a hotel that is just '1 block away' is a very very long block, 10 mins each block! This hotel had the perfect view of the fireworks! We were on level 5 (the top level) and had the best view. Only maybe 3 hotels have a view of the fireworks. Our hotel actually blocked the other behind it from the view so only the two in front might have a view. The rooms were clean and we witnessed the
Manager Response: It is always such a pleasure to receive feedback like yours. We are so happy that our helpful staff and close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip memorable. Thank you very much for choosing the Camelot Inn & Suites. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area! :)

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel many times over the years.  It is just across the street and slightly down the block from the walkway entrance to Disneyland.  Just a few minutes walk to the security gate.  Also helpful for kids and the budget, it's right next door to McDonalds.    Only the outward, street-facing decor is in a chalet (Camelot) style, and the rest is hotel standard (like a really nice Motel).  We've enjoyed staying here.  The rooms are large, fit two queen beds reasonably well, and have a long in-room vanity and mirror, and a separate toilet shower/bath.  The rooms are fairly quiet, but you can hear people moving about outside on the walkway.  Don't leave your curtains open at night with the lights on, or people can see right into the room.  Kids always tend to run,
Manager Response: We are delighted to be your hotel of choice when visiting the Disney Resort.  Because we are only a 7-minute walk to and from the main gates, many of our guests take advantage of coming back to the hotel for a quick meal break, relax in our pool or Jacuzzi , or take a quick nap before enjoying the evening fun at the parks.   Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot for a family vacation based on reviews. It was easy to get to the Disney parks and was only a 5-10 minute walk. We had no problems walking back after spending all day in the parks with our kids, ages 6 and 9. We stayed in a basic room with 2 double beds. Liked the sink outside of the bathroom. My only complaint is that the water pressure was really weak. They don't have free breakfast or parking, but you can't beat the location and price. We would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: We are so happy that our close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip memorable. Please accept our apologies for the water pressure. The front desk would have been happy to move you to another room. Our maintenance staff routinely monitors the plumbing, and we you for bringing this to our attention.   We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary: The amenities were basic, and so was the room. It was a great location, and very convenient. It seemed overpriced for the basic accommodation, but I know it's all about the location, location, location. Parking, like most of the hotels in the area, is limited and fills up quickly. There was always a space, but sometimes next to someone who had taken up part of another space.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the convenience of our location. When we are running at 100% occupancy, parking can be tight; however, complimentary on-site valet is included in the daily parking fee.

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a Disney vacation!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Camelot Inn & Suites very much.  We stayed in the Family King Suite and it was perfect, not long after we checked in the first night we could see the fireworks from our windows.  It is located close to many economical and good eating places; McDonald's, Mimi's Caf√©, IHOP, Cold Stone Creamery, plus others.  It's only about 5 - 10 minutes to the Parks or Downtown Disney.  Check-in was great and so were the guys in valet parking!  Thanks for a great stay!!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. It is great to hear that you enjoyed the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites provides, and we are delighted your family took advantage of the fantastic view of Disney's firework display from your room. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I stayed in a family suite, it is close to Disney. The room is seperated between a king and two queens. It also has two bathrooms they were clean and comfortable. No jazz to them. Also had a microwave and refrigerator. With a k-cup machine. Restaurants are all nearby.
Manager Response: Your positive review is very much appreciated. We hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary Heading: Great location, convenient to walk to Disney parks!
Summary: We stayed in the family suite and while ti only had one bathroom, it was spacious enough for 4 adults and 4 kids. It was a short walk to the front gates of both parks. I would stay here again for the location alone.
Manager Response: It is great to hear that you were happy with your accommodations in our spacious and comfortable Family Suite. We are delighted that you appreciated our proximity to the Disney Parks. In fact, we are just 600 steps away from the Main Entrance and we offer a fantastic view of Disney's famous firework display from our terrace level pool.

Summary Heading: Easy, clean, close place for Disneyland Visit
Summary: Don't expect the Ritz, and you won't be disappointed!  Stayed for, 4 nights, 6 adults in 2 room suite. Sufficient room if you work out bathroom schedule.  Nice to have bar sink for brushing teeth and washing face.  McDonalds and Panera right there and Pizza Press is yummy and cheap!  Hotel staff fine - no issues.  Didn't park car but valets always nice.  Pool useless but there.  Nice to be on 5th floor.  Would go again.
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites provides. We hope you enjoyed the view of Disney's nightly firework display from our terrace level pool. Your review is very much appreciated, and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This hotel was perfect in every way. well situated for Disneyland, friendly, clean and excellent amenities. would highly recommend. if I was to return to Anaheim in the future would book this hotel above all others
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for the great review. We're thrilled to have been a part of the magical memories your family created at the Happiest Place on Earth. See you next time!

Summary: We had a great three night stay here! We stayed in a Deluxe King Mini Suite, and it worked well for our three adults and one child. We were literally a 10 minute walk from the entrance to the parks. The only reasons for not giving it five stars is that we were either freezing with the AC on or warm with it off. Also, the electrical outlets were not particularly convenient. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our close proximity to Disneyland can't be beat! We are delighted that you had a pleasant stay, and we are excited to share that we are in the preliminary stage of renovating all of our guest rooms. Stay tuned!

Summary: Great location and clean rooms. Disneyland is right across the street. Lots of restaurants along the way. Decent price on rooms but they do charge for parking per car each night. Even still it was worth it. Very friendly staff. You can see the fireworks from the swimming pool perfectly.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing your positive feedback. We are delighted that you appreciated our proximity to the Disney Parks. In fact, we are just 600 steps away from the Main Entrance and we offer a fantastic view of Disney's famous firework display from our terrace level pool.

Summary: Stayed here for six nights in July. We were a family of 7 and got a suite. There was only 1 bathroom but we made it work. Beds were extremely comfortable and there was a safe and 2 mini-fridges. Location was right across the street so it was nice and close to the park. No breakfast but we bought groceries for that. MacDonald's was right next door and many other eateries were a stones throw away. I would stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites offers. We hope you enjoyed the view of Disney's nightly firework display from our terrace level pool. Your review is very much appreciated, and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The hotel was right across from Disneyland. We could watch the fireworks from our room. The pool is a bit small, but the staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. We arrived early and they sowed our luggage. My son lost his flip flops and they recovered them for him. Nice people!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your positive review. We are glad you took advantage of the great view of Disney's famous firework display from our property. Hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: We were greeted by parking attendants as soon ad we drove up. Staff were friendly and accommodating.  Our room had two double beds which had to be the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on in a hotel. Convenient location because it was walking distance to the Disneyland parks! A lot of restaurants within walking distance. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We appreciate that you mentioned our spacious rooms, friendly customer service, and of course our proximity to Disneyland. We're very happy you found our beds comfortable. A good night's sleep can make all the difference when spending several hours a day enjoying the Disney Parks. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit!

Summary: Great customer service.   We were first greeted by the parking attendant that went over the parking lot regulations.  We had arrived a couple hours before check in and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready.  This place does charge a parking fee but they all do in California, no way around it.  The parking lot was nice and able to accommodate larger cars.  The rooms are standard and very comparable to other neighboring hotels near by.  Rooms were clean and comfy with all the basic amenities including a full length mirror. They location is great, directly across from the main entrance to Disneyland.   This place does not offer breakfast but there are plenty of places around such as Panera Bread, McDonalds, IHop & Dennys.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience. It is great to hear that you were happy with our hospitality and enjoyed the convenience our location. We hope that you created long lasting memories to cherish for years to come while visiting the "Happiest Place on Earth!"

Summary: Stayed here two nights to go to Disneyland, and the location was brilliant, just a short walk from the park entrance. A bit dated, but clean and spacious rooms. Price is high, but I guess that's because it's so close to Disney. Pool was disappointing, ridiculously small and shallow. On-site site parking is charged 10 bucks a day, but after having gone out to get some supplies on our first night we were lucky to secure a spot when we came back, so the lesson is that once you manage to get parked, don't give up that spot until you're leaving.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our close proximity to Disneyland can't be beat! We are delighted that you had a pleasant stay, and we are excited to share that we are in the preliminary stage of renovating all of our guest rooms. For future reference, valet service is included in the daily parking fee.   We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Excellent location, a short walk to both theme parks
Summary: This hotel is in an excellent location for walking to both Disney theme parks - practically across the road from the entrance, which is great for tired feet at the end of the day. Had an excellent view of the fireworks in the main park by standing on the balcony outside the room, or from the small swimming pool on the 4th floor. The room was very clean and housekeeping visited daily. We stayed for a total of 5 nights and had a wonderful time, staying on the 3rd floor. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Parking was not a problem for us (once parked we didn't move the car again for the 5 days!) Close to lots of restaurants along the main harbor blvd, down at gardenwalk, or downtown Disney.  Definitely recommended and would stay here again
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. It is great to hear that you enjoyed the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites offers, and we are delighted your family took advantage of the fantastic view of Disney's firework display from our 4th floor pool. Hope to see you again soon :)

Summary: we are Disney Annual Passholder, and live about 2 hours away from Anaheim, so we often get a hotel for one night so we're not completely beat after 12 hours at the parks and 4 hours of roudtrip drive-time.  We've stayed at two of the three Disney hotels, and enjoy them immensely, but they are about 3 times the cost of other hotels that are almost as close to Disneyland and California Adventure Parks.  The Camelot is an easy 4-minute walk to Disney plaza and affords some of the best accomodations on Harbor Blvd.  We paid $199 + tax for a family of four for a Saturday night stay.  We walked to dinner - Mimi's Cafe - and to get coffee at McDonalds in the morning. Both were within 5 minutes as well. The check-in staff and valet were EXTREMELY pleasant, and when you factor in the
Manager Response: We are so happy that our helpful staff and close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip memorable. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary: Stayed two times here,  for approx 2 weeks eachtime, awesome room sizes although they are getting dated, comfortable beds and sofa bed, good air conditioning too. Plenty of parking all though it was free the first time, but the second time it cost to park there,  pool to small and shallow but a nice area to have it. Over all good location being close to disneyland and convenient bus routes nearby  friendly staff and awesome breakfast service.   Cheers
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We appreciate that you mentioned our spacious rooms, friendly customer service, and of course our proximity to Disneyland. We are excited to announce that we are planning to renovate our rooms next year...stay tuned!

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights as a family to visit Disneyland. Staff were super friendly and helpful. We had a comfortable room on the second floor which was clean and had everything we needed. Kids loved the pool and also the fireworks that you could see from the room. Super convenient to walk to Disney and local shops and restaurants . Car parinkg available but we did not use it.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for taking the time to write your review. We are happy that your family enjoyed the convenience of our location, our attention to detail, and the fireworks view from our property. Your feedback is much appreciated and we look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: Stayed here with 2 friends for a birthday trip to Disneyland and we were surprised at how clean and updated the rooms were! King bed with a pullout couch was comfortable for the 3 of us! Don't forget to inquire about the message on the back of your key card for a 10% off coupon for your next stay! Makes it very attractive to stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive feedback. We hope you and your friends created many magical birthday memories at the Happiest Place on Earth. We look very much forward to your next visit! :)

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland, but disorganized staff
Summary: It would be hard to find a hotel more conveniently located near Disneyland without paying an arm and leg.  There are some moderately priced hotels that appear to be across the street from Disneyland or California Adventure, but that are nowhere near an actual entrance.  Camelot Inn, however, is easy walking distance from the entrances to the parks (a half mile or less) and right next door to a good restaurant option in the Pizza Press.  The positives of Camelot are its location without having to pay luxury prices, the rooftop pool (technically on the fourth floor not the roof) with hot tub, and decent rooms with good amenities (fridge, microwave, cable TV).  The negatives causing the three star review have to do with the front desk staff.  First of all, they charged the card
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your detailed account during your recent stay. Aside from the miscommunication at check out, we are delighted that you enjoyed your visit and created great memories at the Happiest Place on Earth. The check for the security deposit was mailed out on July 1. Please feel free to call us with any questions. We sincerely hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future.

Summary: Our family of four stayed for a week last July and it was a great experience. Being able to walk 5 min across the street to the parks was wonderful! Staff were all friendly and helpful, you can see the fireworks from most balconies as well as the pool, and there's a McDonald's next door that's open 24 hours which was nice to grab something quick and inexpensive for breakfast. Only drawbacks were the small pool and the noise at times, but would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: It is great to hear that your family was satisfied with the many conveniences the Camelot Inn & Suites provides. We thank you for your review and hope you created "magical" memories at the "Happiest Place on Earth". We hope to see you again very soon!

Summary: Not only is this amazing hotel literally right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland, it has one of the most helpful staff we have run into. We got to the hotel way too early for check in for the day. The staff was very accommodating with our vehicle and our luggage so we could go enjoy the park! Definitely will be staying here again.
Manager Response: We are so happy that our helpful staff and close proximity to Disneyland made your family's trip memorable. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary: Had an awesome experience with our stay here. Directly across the street from Disneyland. Walk wasn't bad at all considering we had a little one in a stroller. Staff was awesome with us and extremely helpful. Granddaughter loved the fact that she could run all over and not be cramped or stumble over furniture.
