We are sorry that one of your refrigerators wasn‚Äôt cool enough; our Maintenance staff would have been happy to resolve the issue during your stay. Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Camelot. We hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary Heading: Used to be good, but no more.
Summary: I have stayed many times in the Anaheim Camelot Inn and I'm saddened to say that I will never stay here again. On top of eliminating their continental breakfast and having TERRIBLE WiFi,  their staff has become completely untrustworthy. Don't plan on bringing anything of value in to your room or you will never see it again. The very first day I was here, my ipod was stolen right out of my jacket pocket when the housekeepers cleaned the room. A few days later, they attempted to steal my father's prescription heart medication but returned it when he told them he would need to contact the authorities. My iPod, unfortunately, remains in one of their pockets. They use the disclaimer to lock up your valuables as free reign to go shopping in their customer's belongings with a five
Manager Response: It is a disappointment to receive a review in which accusatory comments are made about our housekeeping staff.  Hopefully you located your misplaced Ipod as you did your father's heart medication.  Anaheim Camelot is indeed a "Good Neighbor" property and  we pride ourselves on honest and caring team members as proven by our Trip Advisor ratings.  We do appreciate feedback and use it as a constructive tool to improve in customer satisfaction and therefore,  will make sure that the WiFi signal is working in every guest room.

Summary: Nice hotel, clean with big rooms and good beds. People were nice and love the proximity of the park. Wish they could offer breakfast otherwise no complain. Nice and pleasant stay. Very convenient location when you have to run very early in the morning
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting the Anaheim Camelot for your visit during the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend! We are pleased to hear that our convenient location and spacious rooms met your needs!   Next time for breakfast, try the Cove on Harbor located at our sister property two doors down, the Tropicana Inn & Suites. This quaint coffee house and mini market offers gourmet coffee and quick, healthy breakfast options to grab on your way to the Parks.

Summary: We have just returned for an amazingly great hotel right across the street from the bus entrance to Diineyland. We were a family of 8 and stayed in a Family Suite. It was comprised of 2 rooms, one with a king bed and queen bed chesterfield. The other room had 2queen beds and the bathroom. There was a table and 4chairs also 2 fridges and a microwave. The cleanliness of the whole hotel was beyond anything I have experienced in hotels like the Fairmont. All the walkways were cleaned everyday and the pool deck also. Staff was friendly and helpful even on the night shifts. I would stay there again with out even thinking twice. Loved it. If we came home early from Disneyland we could see the fireworks from the deck outside our room. If you have mobility issues there are scooter rental
Manager Response: It is always such a pleasure to receive such positive feedback. We are delighted that your family enjoyed our close proximity to Disneyland and an excellent fireworks view. Hope to see you again next year!

Summary: Obviously the big reason to stay here is the proximity to Disneyland. It is within walking distance which is huge, especially with kids. Its also next to a McDonald's which is nice to help the food budget. The hotel itself was very good. Nice big rooms. Comfortable beds and overall pretty quiet at nighttime.  This is our hotel of choice when we go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and your family. We are delighted to hear that you had a pleasant stay and enjoyed a peaceful night's rest each evening. Thank you so very much for selecting the Anaheim Camelot as your choice hotel when visiting the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: When you think about how big the Disneyland park is, Camelot Inn and Suites is pretty much right across from the entrance to Disneyland. Nice big spacious comfortable rooms. I was travelling with a friend and we had the king family suite and we were given two rooms with an adjoining door which was very handy. The bathroom set out was a little strange, the toilet and and bath/shower were in one room but the basin sink was in an area just outside of the bathroom. The same counter had the coffee making amenities. However this meant that there was a lot of counter space, and being a girl, this is always a bonus!  There was free wifi and a small souvenirs store near the reception. There aren't many food options closeby but there is a McDonalds next door and an iHop restaurant a few
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! Separating the vanity with sink from the shower room allows 1 guest to shower in private while another uses the sink area to brush teeth, apply makeup, etc. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the ample counter space with this setup.   In addition to the nearby restaurants you mentioned, the Pizza Press next door is fantastic and a Panera is being built a few doors down, which will provide our guests with healthier options.

Summary: Wow location location - couldn't have been happier with the location stroll into Disneyland. Food options all around. Rooms where a good size. Laundry room and spa both came in handy. Don't worry about paying extra for Disney rooms only ones would be the front suites.  Staff friendly but sadly have no local knowledge they just read brochures as I could of done for info.
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to the Disney Parks and restaurants. Since we are just a 6-7 minute walk from Disneyland's Main Entrance, our guests have the convenience of walking back to their rooms for a break from all the fun at the Parks. This is especially helpful for families with young children. Your positive feedback is much appreciated and we hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future!

Summary: This was our base for our time at Disneyland. It really is next door to the park which is handy if you want to take a break from the park for an hour or two. We had a family suite which turned out to have two separate rooms and was actually quite big. It was also on the same floor as the pool which was ideal for the kids! The hotel seemed quite noisy through the night, but we were probably just unlucky with our neighbours, you can't blame the hotel for that. This hotel is a great option for Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you taking the time to share your feedback! We are very happy to hear that in addition to our ideal location, our Family Suite and hotel amenities met your family's needs. During your next visit to the Disneyland Resort, we hope to be your hotel of choice. Have a wonderful day!

Summary: This hotel is super close to Disneylands Main gate, and quite convenient to the freeway, and there's even a McDonalds next door.   There was a cool rooftop pool with a gazebo and a hot tub. The rooms were clean and comfortable with  a mini-fridge, a microwaves, etc.   Extra charge for parking but cheaper than other hotels. Free wifi, no breakfast.  Over all, a very good but not great choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us and for mentioning the many conveniences we offer! We hope you and your family made many magical memories during your visit.

Summary: The hotel is practically just across of the Disneyland parks, the fireworks even clearly visible from in front of the rooms or even better, from the pool area. The room is quite big, clean, although bathroom is just about enough size. The sink is outside of the room which is a good thing. The room has a fridge (which is empty, none of those usual overpriced beverages), security locker, and even a microwave. The hotel also has coin operated laundry.  Free wifi is quite good and stable.  We would stay here again when visiting Disneyland parks again.
Manager Response: We are glad you were satisfied with our convenient in-room amenities such as complimentary Wi-Fi, mini-refrigerator and microwave. Thank you for mentioning the fabulous Disney fireworks view from our pool deck; it's one of our favorite spots. Your review is much appreciated and we hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future!

Summary: The room was  fine-junior suite.  Slept 2 kids, 2 adults and an infant comfortably.  The only negative was that the air conditioner unit blew cold air right onto the king bed which made it a little chilly.
Manager Response: We are happy that our spacious Family Suite was a comfortable choice for your family of 5 during your Disney vacation. We apologize that the A/C was too cold and we will take your feedback into consideration.

Summary Heading: Clean Comfortable and Close to Disney Resort
Summary: The hotel was clean and comfortable.  Very close to Disney Resort Main Gate.  This property is next door to McD's and IHOP.  Rooftop pool was very relaxing!  The staff had our room ready and the option to have my car valeted was a nice change of pace.  The beds were a welcome retreat after walking nearly 12 miles through each park for the 3 days straight!  Even the pullout couch got my daughters' approval.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing your positive experience with us. We are glad to hear you took advantage of our terrace level pool and Jacuzzi, a perfect way to unwind after a fun-filled day at the Parks. Plus, you can't beat the Disney fireworks view. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: not bad, not good, just a place to sleep
Summary: So, to be fair, no hotel on Harbor Blvd has to care at all. Even if every hotel had 1 star they would still sell out nightly. Location is key. and sadly with that location and comfort comes a complacency that would never survive anywhere else. One thing I will say about here is the staff was very very friendly, and helpful. I definitely give them props for hiring good people.   Pros:  Location. very very close to maingate, about 4 hotels down from the crosswalk, so less than a ten minute walk from room to gate. Clean room pleasant staff easy check in and check out  cons: -room outdated -airconditioning on coldest setting could not get the room to even a "mildly cold" setting, it did however leak like crazy on the entry floor. (had to leave a towel down)  -Air conditioning was
Manager Response: Thank you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to the Disney Parks. In fact, we are less than 600 steps away from the Main Entrance!   We apologize for your malfunctioning air conditioner. Maintenance would have been happy to address this during your stay. Coincidentally, all air conditioning units are currently being serviced as part of our end-of-summer protocol.

Summary: Great stay. Disappointed that they stopped the free breakfast. Also disappointed the now charge for parking. We love the family suites on the 5th floor. We watched the fireworks from our room!! Location is THE BEST EVER! So close to great dining and to the parks. Staff were wonderful!
Manager Response: We are happy to learn that you enjoyed the 5th floor room and experienced the fireworks from the corridor or balcony.  Yes, we did discontinue the complimentary continental breakfast, however, our sister property just two doors down and on your short walk to Disneyland offers reasonably priced "grab and go" items i.e., breakfast bars, yogurt parfaits, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, etc.  Thank you for your feedback, we really appreciate you and hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: 8 mins walk to Disneyland. Large , quiet rooms with helpful staff. Great roof pool that gives excellent views of the fireworks. Stayed here with family in early August. Highly recommended. Restaurants and convenience stores nearby.
Manager Response: It is always a pleasure to receive such positive feedback. We are delighted that your family enjoyed our close proximity to Disneyland and an excellent fireworks view. Hope to see you again next year!

Summary: I seriously didn't expect that a hotel prices as low as it was and being so close to the park would be decent. But let me tell you, my stay was excellent. There are no bells and whistles here, but who cares. You're going to Disneyland all day. You just need a clean and comfortable place to relax when you're done. And you get that here. The rooms were great and the staff helpful. The pool was great and we could even see the firework show from our room at night (our little kids never lasted until the show).   The only complaint I have is about the parking situation. It was hard to find parking.   Overall, an excellent value.
Manager Response: Thank you for highlighting our close proximity to Disneyland, friendly service, and clean, comfortable rooms. We are happy to hear you took advantage of the great fireworks view from our terrace level pool.   We apologize for the parking difficulties. For future reference, our 24/7 valet service would be happy to valet your vehicle on property at no additional charge. We hope you and your family made many magical memories during your visit!

Summary: Anaheim Camelot Inn and Suites  We had planned a trip to Disneyland for 4 nights and 5 days. On our last trip we paid extra to stay in a Disney hotel, but still had to cross the street and walk quite a long way to enter the parks. This time our goal was to be as close to the entrance as possible. After talking to our travel agent, we decided on the Anaheim Camelot Inn and Suites. It had cute theming on the outside which definitely influenced our decision since this was a "Disney" trip.   We took a shuttle from the airport and they dropped us off not far from the hotel. We walked a very short distance before arriving at the hotel and went directly into the office. The front desk staff was friendly.... AND our room was ready which was very surprising since it was 12:30pm. We went
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We appreciate your feedback and management has been notified of your suggestions. All in all, we are happy to hear that your family enjoyed your stay and that you created magical memories during your visit. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: This is a good mid range hotel situated right opposite the entrance to Disneyland. This made it so easy to enjoy the park, as you could come back to rest in the afternoon and then go back for more in the evening. The rooms were spacious, clean and the beds very comfortable. There was a fridge and microwave if you needed it. No restaurant but that was not an issue as you have loads of places nearby. We had breakfast in Denny's every day! Parking is by valet, the guys were nice and helpful. Unlike a lot of reviewers on here we felt that $8 a day is not expensive as we are used to London prices for parking! Also we thought that noise was not a problem at all, and we were not disturbed at all at night. I thought it was a pretty good place to stay for 3 nights and we were happy with
Manager Response: Thank you for writing your positive review and mentioning the many conveniences the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites has to offer. In addition to the close proximity to both Disneyland and California Adventure, we offer a great view of the firework display from our 4th level pool. We are delighted that your family had a pleasant stay and we hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth!"

Summary: The location is perfect - we walked everywhere!  The staff is wonderful!  WiFi was great!  Our room was amazing!  Comfortable beds with GREAT pillows! Slept like babies!   The pool and hot tub allowed us to cool off and soak tired feet and bodies anytime we wanted too - during pool hours.  The area was never "maxed out" so it was great!  Watching the fireworks from the pool is highly recommended!  Thanks so much!!!!  Karmel shuttle was amazing!  (Paulino was our fav!)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive feedback! We are delighted that your family enjoyed the amenities we offer in addition to our convenient location. We hope your family created many magical memories during your visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth."

Summary Heading: Good base for Disney - great value.
Summary: This hotel is a good value choice for Disney. It is opposite the entrance. Our family suite had 3 doubles and a sofa bed - comfortable enough for a family of 5 with 3 teenagers. There's a kitchen if you want to self cater but no kettle. There's a nice cafe nearby ( Mimis) for breakfast and a takeaway pizza place next door that's open til late. We were out all day so didn't use the pool but it was a good base for us - quiet for a city hotel. The decor isn't themed.
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning the convenience of our location, especially our close proximity to the Disney Parks and restaurants. Our Family Suite sounds like it was the right fit for your family and we hope next time you are able to take advantage of our heated terrace-level pool with Disney fireworks view. Have a wonderful day!

Summary: Staff is great. Omar with parking was super cool. Family suite was gigantic. Maids were very friendly they went above and beyond for my mom.Our family had a great time watching the fireworks from our balcony. Absolutely brilliant. We will be back
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you had a pleasant stay in your Family Suite with Disney fireworks view. Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We look forward to extending our hospitality to you again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for location and a Disney stay.. Could use a few changes though
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel twice for our Disney stays. We loved getting the family suite because they are HUGE! The rooms themselves and the hotel was very clean! The bathrooms being clean was my main concern and they were spotless. The first time we stayed a couple years ago they had a nice continental breakfast and the second time we went back they got rid of it! I was very disappointed because even though it wasn't the biggest breakfast it still was good and tied us over until lunch. The cons of the hotel would be the price for parking and if you are on a floor with anyone above you then you are guaranteed to hear then running around above you all the time. So I would suggest the top floor rooms. The pros of the hotel would be their cleanliness for sure, we also never had
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We are delighted that your family took advantage of our spacious Family Suite and enjoyed our close proximity to the Disney Parks entrance.   We are sorry you were disappointed that the continental breakfast was discontinued January 2014. Hopefully you were able to stop by our coffee house and mini market located at our sister property, the Tropicana Inn & Suites. The Cove offers gourmet coffee, yogurt, fresh fruit, hard-boiled eggs, and artisan pastries from a popular local bakery.   In regards to parking, the $9.75 fee helps ensure that our hotel guests are able to park on site. Plus, valet parking is offered at no additional charge.   We truly appreciate your feedback. Hope to see you again during your next visit to the Disneyland Resort!

Summary: After reading some recent reviews, I was almost going to cancel my reservations, but I am glad that I didn't.  At first, I thought noise was going to be a big problem because I was on the 5th floor and just above the pool that was on the fourth floor.  The pool, I believe, is above the parking stalls and was visible from my window.  At first, I thought, this isn't going to be good with the noise, but being so close to the pool wasn't a problem at all.  There were guests in the pool, but I hardly heard them.    I read another review about the car alarms going off and the beeping of cars from the valet service.  The only beeping I heard was from me when I put something into my car and locked it.  It was quiet for the most part and I slept peacefully.  This might not be a 5 star
Manager Response: We are grateful that you chose the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites and that you were pleased with our level of service, amenities, and location. At times, the Disney fireworks display can set off car alarms, but luckily, it is rare occurrence. Plus, our pool area located on the 4th level offers a great view of the show. Thank you so very much for sharing your experience with us. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The hotel was in a perfect location a block or so from entrance to the Disney parks.  It was close enough to return for a mid afternoon rest break, which was a big plus.   The rooms were clean, spacious and reasonably quiet even with a large number of families present with small children. A refrigerator and microwave were available for snacks.  The reception staff was friendly, but had some difficulty with check in. I had reserved three rooms for various family members who arrived at various times.  I had called to ensure that I would handle all charges.  One of the party was charged for a room and one was not.  We couldn't sort it out so I reimbursed the party that was charged.  A negative for the room was the large temperature swings as the a/c cycled:  73 to 77 degrees F.  A
Manager Response: We are delighted that your family enjoyed the fireworks view from your balcony. Since guest rooms are just a short walk away from the Parks, our close proximity to Disneyland is especially convenient for families interested in taking breaks during the day.   We apologize for the credit card oversight that occurred at check in and we appreciate your understanding. Our maintenance staff would have been happy to adjust the water temperature during your stay. However, since receiving your review, they have conducted a routine check in all the rooms. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We hope to see you again during your next visit to the ‚ÄúHappiest Place on Earth!‚Äù

Summary: We stayed as a family group of 9 in 3 different rooms and had a wonderful time here.  This has all the cleanliness and comfort you would hope for, and you can walk a block to Disneyland!  They don't mention the laundry room in the hotel details, but there is one and it has 3 washers and 3 dryers that take $2 in quarters each (As at July 2015).  Efficient, clean and over with in over an hour!   I didn't like the room coffee, so McDonalds next door was fine.  I eventually worked out my timing - if you go at 7 no problem, any later than 7:30 and there's a big line!  The gift store is a bonus if you need to pick up something. The front desk staff were super happy to serve us and print out boarding passes for us. The valet parking was great as we had a big van to transport the family
Manager Response: It is always a pleasure to hear such favorable feedback. Thank you for mentioning the many conveniences the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites has to offer. We are glad the short walk to and from the Disney Parks allowed you to easily return to your room to rest or take a dip in our refreshing pool. We hope your family made magical memories during your time here and we hope to see you again!

Summary: I was very pleasantly surprised by our stay at this hotel. I was a little worried it might be run down but the rooms were nice and clean and seemed to be updated/nicely maintained. The outside theme goes along nicely with Disneyland. We stayed in family suite. There was plenty of room for the seven of us. The staff were courteous. We ended up staying a second night and they arranged it so we could stay in our same room. Parking is ridiculous but they valet park you for free if you can't find a spot. The best part of this is the location, of course. It is right across the street from the main entrance of the parks. It literally takes 5 minutes to get there and is easy to get back if you need a break during the day. It is a bummer to not have a free breakfast but a lot of hotels
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear that your family of 7 enjoyed our location and took advantage of our spacious Family Suite. In addition to our close proximity to both Disney Parks, we offer a fantastic view of the fireworks show from our terrace level pool. We appreciate your recommendation and we hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth!"

Summary: I will start off by mentioning the amazing staff.  Checking in was great and when I called down to see if we could change rooms was very courteous.  The location was also really great.  About a 5 minute walk to the park. The bed was also glorious.   Now as to why we were unhappy with our stay.  We made the mistake thinking that we just needed a place to sleep at night.  We were wrong.  It was the noisiest motel that we have ever stayed at.  I'm way more picky than my husband, but even he said that it was hard to relax at this motel.    The car alarms going off all day and night was horrible.  We began to wonder if this was how the valet found the cars....  It also did not help that the parking lot was open to the other parking lot next door.  There are a lot of cars which equals
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback...We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your most recent visit.  The appliances in our guest rooms do require maintenance from time to time.  We assure you that our maintenance team inspects our air conditioners and refrigerators on a regular basis.  During our peak season it is indeed possible that an appliance has been inadvertently missed for repair.  We would have been happy to send maintenance up to your room to make the necessary adjustments.    Regarding  the car alarms.  The firework extravaganza at Disneyland can sometimes set off the car alarms do to our very close proximity to the parks.  We apologize for the sound factor.  We are delighted that you were happy with the beds and overall customer service and value your comments.

Summary Heading: Closer to the park than the Disney hotel!
Summary: Our family of three (my wife and I in our 30‚Äôs and our 7yo son) stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in June. With mostly positive reviews, a very competitive rate (we saved 20% booking direct, which we typically don‚Äôt do) and the proximity to the Disney gates ‚Äì this hotel was an easy choice for us.  We‚Äôve stayed nearly a dozen times in the Disney area at various hotels and rental houses; this hotel is definitely one of our favorites.  I‚Äôll start with the CONS, which really aren‚Äôt all that bad.  There is no breakfast option (as some have pointed out, there is instead a disabled scooter rental area), but McDonalds is adjacent and works for a quick meal.  The parking is very lacking, but there is free valet to help with finding a parking spot (though I was concerned with the
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your detailed review. Thank you for highlighting our  friendly service, clean, comfortable rooms and of course our close proximity to Disneyland and restaurants. We're delighted that your family had a positive experience and we look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: Forget the mixed reviews.  Camelot Inn has ideal location and more than adequate facilities.  Rooms are neat and clean, well serviced and comfortable.  Just 15 minute walk to Disney gates.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.  Karmel shuttle from LAX was very good.  Pool is fine for the little ones.  Checking in and out was painless.  We did not drive, but parking could be issue if you plan to go in and out often.  Overall good value.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your review. We are happy to hear that your family enjoyed your stay and took advantage of the fantastic Disney view from our pool area. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I was a little nervous staying here, it seemed to get such mixed reviews. I decided the key is understanding what you are paying for. You are paying for LOCATION. On previous trips to DL, we have stayed a mile or so down Harbor Blvd at big name suite hotels. They are fancier, to be sure, but the convenience of being able to walk to DL in minutes cannot be underestimated. Shuttles take up a good 20-30mins each trip.  We loved being close so much that from now on, we will stay at a Main gate hotel. We'd be happy to stay here again. It is so nice to be able to go early, play in the parks for a couple hours, walk back to rest, then go back later. It is basic, and it's clear that the hotel has been around a while, but our room was very clean, and the beds comfortable. The wifi was
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your input. We're happy that you had a positive experience and we look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot Inn & Suites during the 2015 24 hour day at Disneyland. The resort is within easy walking distance to the resort transportation drop off area, and very convenient. We had a suite, which was quite large and clean, with a small kitchenette. The price is reasonable. They only provide valet parking for around $10 which is a drag, but definitely better than paying or dealing with the parking in the Disneyland Mickey and Friend's parking structure. We already booked future reservations and will definitely continue to stay here when we can.
Manager Response: There are times on certain busy days when valet parking is the only option; however, usually guests may self-park or valet. We appreciate your feedback and we'd like to thank you for selecting us as your home away from home during your Disney visits. We look very much forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: A "Bare Bones" Motel that is very pricey, noisy and not the cleanest.
Summary: Check in is 4 pm at this motel.  The latest that I have ever seen.  The staff never offered to hold our luggage so we could go to Disney so we lost almost a day at the park because we didn't want to leave all of our belongings and electronics for a 9 day stay in the car to be stolen.    Upon check in, we did have some cleaning issues with our room.  There was a huge wad of dark, nasty, hair in the toilet when we lifted the lid that the housekeeper forgot to flush.  It was not very welcoming to see.  There were several other dark, nasty, hairs in the floor, on the side of the tub and encrusted the rubber mat that was provided, which also appeared to be a little gross and dirty or stained.  The bathroom just didn't feel clean.  Housekeeping put brand new towels and washcloths in
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed at the camelot inn for 7 days.We had the family suite (which is large) . We watched the fireworks from right outside our room door. You could veiw it from pretty much anywhere on this property not just the pool area. It is located about a 100 yds from the main intersection that goes to disneyland. Only downside is you walk past a bus stop that has some homeless people and people sleeping on the benches, or asking you for change on the way to and from (but you still feel safe)  . Lots of places to eat nearby. Rented a stroller from down stairs . It was way cheaper than the parks and you could take it back to your room. Pool is small and shallow but you are not there for the pool. rooms are clean and kid friendly. So close to the parks that if you got tired
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you took advantage of our spacious Family Suite for your 7-night stay and that it was the right fit for your family. Thank you for mentioning the convenience of our close proximity to the Disney Parks, restaurants, and fireworks view.   Thank you so very much for sharing your experience with us. Please come back soon!

Summary: We were extremely happy with our 2 day stay here. Located almost directly across the road from Disneyland and a couple of minutes walk from IHOP and Dennys (both open 24 hours) and the shuttle bus to LAX ($30 per person), Anaheim Camelot is the perfect family hotel for Disneyland visits.  Very friendly staff, cute little gift shop, on site Laundromat and super comfy beds make this place a winner.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your review. It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and your family. We hope to be your hotel of choice during your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth." Take care.

Summary: Initially intended to stay at a Disney hotel this trip but on looking at prices and Trip Advisor reviews, chose to stay here instead. Basic but convenient. A very short walk to Downtown Disney, Disneyland and California Adventure. A few places to eat nearby - iHop, McDonalds, et al plus the restaurants in Downtown Disney. Room itself was quite large - good size bed, lounge, coffee table, fridge, coffee/tea making facilities; reasonable bathroom. Probably needs a revamp but it suited our needs. Staff were friendly. Room was cleaned well each day. No problems getting a car park. Would stay again. 10 years ago, stayed at The Tropicana - very similar.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that our close proximity to the Disneyland Resort and restaurants in the area suited your needs. It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and we hope to see you again!

Summary: I stayed here because I had friends staying here. I had my own room which was really roomy with a king bed and my friends shared adjoining rooms as they had kids. This place is great and a short walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. I would highly recommend. It was easy to check in and out and I got a good rate.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you and your group made magical memories during your time here and we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: Clean, comfortable room for Disneyland stay. Can't beat the location in relation to Disneyland. Staff was nice and helpful. We checked into our room at about 10pm on a Sunday night. Initially received room that had sewage back-up in the shower.  Front desk employees moved us quickly and without any argument.   Parking lot is a complete disaster. I'd estimate about 150 parking spots for well over 200 rooms. And 1/3 of parking spots are marked reserved, I assume for employeesand valet.  Valet service double parks the entire length of parking lot every morning. Highly recommend that if you get a parking spot you don't leave until you check out.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Walk across the street to the Disneyland entrance!
Summary: Our family of 7 stayed here for two nights. The hotel itself is really cute and charming on the outside. The interior is pretty basic, but suited our needs just fine. We had a larger room. Upon entering, there was a king bed, table and chairs, TV, etc. There was also a door separating a second bedroom with two queen beds and a bathroom.   It was SO great to be able to just walk across the street to get to California Adventure, Disneyland, and Downtown Disney. With smaller children, we were able to split up and return to the hotel when needed... for naps or just a break from the heat and crowds. We thought the price was pretty reasonable, and the staff was very kind.   We were able to park at the hotel (they do charge an extra fee) and go to California Adventure for the day...
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Camelot as your home away from home during your visit to the Disneyland Resort. We are happy to hear that our spacious Family Suite and the convenience of our location were the right fit for your family.  We appreciate your feedback and we hope you and your family created "magical" memories to cherish for years to come.

Summary Heading: Great hotel just a few minute walk from the Disneyland Resort
Summary: We decided to stay at a good neighbor hotel this trip to Disneyland since prices for on property hotels were ridiculous! I remember staying at Camelot Inn & Suites as a kid, but don't remember much except I loved that it looked like we were staying in a castle! Now that I'm an adult, I can appreciate the very short walk to the main entrances of Disneyland & California Adventure! Seriously, I think it may even be a shorter walk than staying at the Disneyland Hotel! It was also very clean & the bed was very comfy. Every encounter we had with staff they were very friendly & hospitable. I have no complaints for this hotel & would highly recommend it to any friends traveling to the Disneyland resort!
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you've made magical memories with us as a child and have discovered a new appreciation for the convenience of our location as an adult. And you are correct - we are just 600 steps from the Main Entrance to both Parks, which is closer most Disney properties. It was pleasure extending our hospitality to you and your family.  Please come back soon!

Summary: My family and I recently enjoyed a 6 night stay at The Camelot. We've always stayed at Disney hotels so I was a little reluctant to stay at an off site hotel but I was pleasantly surprised.  The hotel looks older in person than it does in photos but it is very clean and well kept. We stayed in a 2 room suite with 1 king sized bed and 2 queen sized beds in the kids room. The kids room had its own TV, closet, refrigerator and sitting area so it worked out great. It also had its own a/c unit. The suite was huge which gave us plenty of room to stretch out and stay out each others way. The main room had a sofa bed, a kitchenette with a small sink plus a full sized dining table so we actually had place to sit down and eat. The room itself had little in the way of decor and was a
Manager Response: We are happy to hear the you enjoyed your suite and that is was the right fit for your family.  Thank you for your comments regarding the decor and issues with the bathroom.  We greatly appreciate guest feedback as it helps us to improve in all areas of the hotel, from accommodations to customer service.  Again, thank you so much for your review and we hope you and your family created  "magical" memories to cherish for years to come.

Summary Heading: Ideal for budget-conscious Disney family trip
Summary: Our famiy of four, along with our friends who also have two boys, traveled here and had a great experience. We had adjacent rooms on the 4th floor, just steps from the pool. The pool and hot tub are small, but ample. We were disappointed that the hot tub closes at 10, as we had stayed at Disney late and had tired feet when arriving at the hotel at 9:55. However, the nice pool caretaker gave us a few more minutes and our bodies were grateful! The rooms were clean and sufficient. We made full use of the fridge and its tiny freezer for our breakfast supplies and park snacks.  One of the best features of this place is the ability to see the Disneyland fireworks from the balcony.  The staff were all friendly and accomodating, and the gift hut has convenient late hours to grab any
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that you took advantage of the 4th floor pool.  It is an ideal location to view the fireworks while soaking in the Spa.  Thank you so much for sharing your review and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We checked in the Camelot Inn & Suites for a 7 night stay & was greeted by very friendly staff. Our rooms were very nice, clean & pleasantly decorated. The hotel is so close to the main gate which was nice after a day of Disneyland just to walk across the street and relax. The swimming pool was clean, the laundry room was clean and you can watch the fireworks from any balcony or the swimming pool deck. The hotel is one we'd recommend and go back too.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive review.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and experienced the fireworks from our 4th floor pool.  We hope you created life long "magical" memories to cherish for years to come.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: If all you need is a bed really closed to DL, this is the place. Definitely nothing fancy outside of the Alps decor' on the front. The rooms are smallish and dated. It does have the Disney channel for the kids. The pool is very small, but the kids thought it was cool because it was on the 4th floor. Service was prompt if we needed towels. Parking was rough. The first time we parked, we got a spot. The next time, there was no space so we used valet. What that means is that my car is being started up multiple times and moved around to get to vehicles. Not great. The biggest plus and only reason to come back is that the price was below $100/night (before fees) and it's a really short walk to the parks. Shorter than the HoJo anyway.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review.  We are glad to hear that the children enjoyed the 4th floor pool.  It is an ideal location for our guests to relax and  enjoy the fireworks when arriving back from the parks early.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth"!

Summary: I recently spent four nights at the Camelot for a trip to Anaheim and was greatly impressed by this hotel. Yes, it is a more moderately priced, family oriented hotel but the rooms were spotless, the beds were very comfortable, and the location couldn't be any better! I found the staff very helpful and friendly as well. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you for sharing your positive experience and we hope to see you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary Heading: Family of 4 first trip to Disneyland
Summary: This was our family of 4's first time to Disneyland.  I chose this hotel because a friend who visits Disney once a year recommended it.  It was in our price range I prepaid months in advance.  The family suite had a bedroom for our 2 children where they could each have their own bed and tv apart from our bedroom with the king size bed and dining table etc.  There was one bathroom to share but thankfully the vanity is outside so we could still be getting ready while it was in use.  We appreciated the early check in.  After flying all nite we arrived very early in the morning and the gentleman at the desk let us check in well before the normal check in time.  I cant express enough what this meant to my weary travelers as we went right to bed for a few hours before hitting the park
Manager Response: Our Housekeeping staff and Front Desk do their very best to honor early check in requests. In this case, we are delighted that your request was met and we are happy to hear that our spacious and comfortable Family Suite was the perfect choice for your family. Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us. We hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland. Clean and very spacious family suites. It sleeps 3 adults and 2 kids perfectly. There is also a delicious pizza place next door. I have stayed here twice and will definitely stay here again. The only downfall  is there is no continental breakfast and it is a little pricey to stay here.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that our spacious Family Suite was a great fit for your family. Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us; we are delighted to be your hotel of choice when visiting the Disneyland Resort!

Summary Heading: Good location, extremely poor front desk help. A double parking circus.
Summary: We stayed June 6 - June 13. When we checked in they asked for credit card and identification and everything went smoothly. The following day in the afternoon we received a message saying that our credit card was no good and the hotel needed another form of payment or they would lock us out of our room. I called the credit card company to see what was going on. I was informed that the amount for the total stay was pending approval from the 6th when we checked in and that there was no problem, except for the fact that the Camelot inn & suites tried to charge the card for the total stay again on the 7th and the credit card company denied the duplicate charge. I went down to the front desk to find out why they tried to charge the card twice for the same stay, and the lady at the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Per your conversation with the Front Desk and Management during your stay, we apologize for any inconvenience the glitch in our system may have may have caused. In regards to the parking lot, we do not accommodate public parking on high occupancy days as guest parking is priority. The back of the lot is controlled by valet and they would have been more than happy to assist you at no additional charge if the self-park was full.

Summary Heading: I don't consider it √† Good Neighbor Hotel
Summary: We stayed there last May 29 - June 4. Poor service. No information in the room about the hotel services. No park map! A lamp wasn't working. They never fixed it. No guide for the tv. I must say though that it was clean. Nothing to say about that. But compared to the Fairfield nextdoor, well no comparaison to make. The Fairfield is way above. Not staying there again. It's no more than a 1 star to me.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your concerns with us. In order to maintain a clean, clutter-free environment, we choose not to inundate rooms with information pamphlets. We apologize for any inconvenience this caused, especially since upon your request, our helpful and friendly Front Desk staff would have gladly provided you with a TV guide, Park map, and recommendations in the area.   Thank you so much for bringing the broken lamp to our attention. Maintenance has since checked your room and repaired the lamp. Again, we appreciate your feedback. Have a nice day.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location if going to Disneyland but beware the parking fees.
Summary: The property is showing its age but you couldn't get a more convenient location if going to Disneyland. It is literally right across the road from the entrance. The rooms, whilst not overly large, are clean and tidy and depending on where you are, you can get a good view of the nightly Disney fireworks. Been a "family hotel" it can be quite noisy at times. There are also no breakfast or restaurant facilities but this is not really a problem as there are many eating places within close proximity.(Just be aware there are also a large number of loons around at times as it is the policy of the California Health Department to release as many people as possible back onto society with the hope they can manage their own medication). But what really got on my goat was they charged guests
Manager Response: We appreciate your input.  Parking has been a challenge over the past few years as we found that many of our guests are bringing in more than one vehicle.  To guarantee that every guest has a parking spot we found it necessary to hire a Parking company.  Valet and Self parking is available at the same parking fee.  We hope you enjoyed our newly renovated lobby.  Our guest rooms are approx 400 sq ft  and our 35 Family Suites offer approx 800 square feet.

Summary Heading: Clean and tidy in a good location
Summary: We weren't expecting much for the price we paid for the Camelot Inn, but the room was very clean, tidy and the beds were comfy. While its not a 5 star resort, it's all you need when visiting Disneyland- the entrance to which is right across the road. Good service, a great location and value for money will have me visiting again and recommending to anyone who wants somewhere to stay when visiting the theme parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy that our helpful staff, prime location and comfortable, clean rooms met your expectations. We hope to see you again during your family's next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: I'm giving this hotel a "five star" rating not because it's an actual five star hotel (probably 3.0 in the traditional rating system) but because they so completely met my needs. We have four adult children and we try to do a family trip at least once per year.   All of our children have spouses or significant others and one has child of his own. Part of the fun of traveling together, particularly to Disneyland, is spending that time before bed together (sitting on each othes beds while having a nightcap and gossiping or playing cards/games, etc.).  This hotel has a family suite (two rooms) that sleeps eight.  Because our son and his wife booked a single room for his family, we were able to fit the rest of our group into the family suite.   It was clean, nice linens,
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us! We are delighted that our Family Suite met your needs and helped your family create fond memories at the end of each fun-filled day at the Parks. In addition to our great location and helpful staff, it's wonderful guests like you that make our jobs a breeze!

Summary: Ok hotel - nothing fancy but you can't beat the price or location. So close to disney we came back for lunch and naps everyday! The hotel itself is pretty run down and the pool/hot tub arent nice but they have an amazing view of the fireworks show!!!
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and our close proximity to the Park! Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Our stay was very pleasant, The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a two queen bed room. It was very spacious and comfortable. There was a nice work desk, but no power outlet near the desk. They do NOT have a breakfast, but we really didn't miss it. There are several places nearby to eat. We would stay here again if in the area.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your birthday celebration and we appreciate you choosing the Anaheim Camelot! Your feedback is important to us and we hope to see you again during your next trip to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: My sister & I stayed here for 10 days. It was excellent. Very clean and the staff were GREAT.  It is right across the street for disneyland. Walking to Disney & Ca. Adventure & Downtown Disney was wonderful. We even saw the fireworks from our room. I would recommend staying here. I plan to stay here the next time I travel to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting us as your home away from home during your Disney vacation! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to the Park and fireworks views. See you next time!

Summary: I contacted the hotel on March 16, 2015, for information regarding shuttle service to San Pedro Pier. The front desk suggested a taxi which they estimated would cost $50-$60+tip for the 40 minute trip. On May 2nd when we checked out the "taxi" arrived quickly, but it was a van operated by KLS Transportation. After we were in the van the driver said the fare would be $110 (not including tip). We came to find out the hotel is connected to KLS Transportation. Bait and switch. Not cool.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are happy you enjoyed your stay.  Rest assured we are not "connected" to any Transportation Service, however we apologize if you were given an incorrect estimated quote on your first inquiry as the going rate is over $100.00 to San Pedro.    Again, thank you so much for your input and we hope to see you again on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: We decided on Camelot Inn and Suites on our last visit to Disneyland because it was a short distance to the park. We stayed two nights and had a good experience. The young man at the front desk gave us a very good room on the 5th floor and away from the road. The room was clean and big enough for our family of four. It did have a microwave, a mini fridge and a small coffee maker. We had a great view of the fireworks. There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance and I would recommend the pizza press right next door.   The swimming pool at the Inn was just okay. It's nice that it's on the 3rd floor but it just isn't very big and felt a little dirty. The jacuzzi is very small! Maybe just for 2 people. They could make it nicer by adding some nice plants and a few
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear your family enjoyed your 5th floor room and fireworks view. Your input is appreciated and will take your suggestions into consideration. Take care!

Summary Heading: Beautiful suite, and Housekeeping staff that can't be beat
Summary: If you're planning to go to Disneyland, and would like to have a very short walk to get there, I highly recommend this hotel.  I spent a lot of time online, checking out all the hotels within a short distance of the parks, and finally decided on this one. Since there would be three adults staying, I booked a family suite, which has one room with a king bed, sofa, table and chairs, TV, small refrigerator and microwave, and a small sink, and a second room with two queen beds, two comfortable chairs, refrigerator, TV, safe, and bathroom, with vanity sink outside. Each room had closet space, iron and ironing board. We stayed two nights, and for a small fee were allowed to leave our car until nighttime while we visited the park.  After arriving home, we heard a phone message saying
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your most recent stay at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.    We were more than happy to assist you with your left behind items and delighted that they were returned to you.  Again, thank you so much for the positive review. We sincerely hope you created "Magical" life long memories to cherish. Looking forward in extending our hospitality to you on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: My sister and I stayed here for one night this past weekend when we visited Disneyland and California Adventure. Here are a few items of note on our stay: We were disappointed that the hotel did not have premium cable channels or movies on demand; the hotel said they don't offer either because they are a family hotel. The ice machine on the third floor didn't work. There are not a lot of blankets on the bed; I get cold easily and didn't feel the blankets kept me warm at all. The water pressure in the shower was terrible. I found a silverfish bug in my bed; it was only one, but still made me feel dirty. I wouldn't stay here again based on those items.
Manager Response: Hi Victoria,  We are disappointed to hear that you were not satisfied with your stay.  Our Housekeeping staff would have arranged more blankets for you and our Front Desk Staff would have been happy to move you to another room if you were unhappy.  Nonetheless, we hope you had a wonderful time at the "Happiest Place on Earth" and created some fond memories.

Summary Heading: Another great stay did not disappoint
Summary: We have just spent 10 nights at the Camelot Inn at Anaheim and like our past stays here we loved it. Our room was one of the family suites and was very clean and comfortable. Right from the person at the front desk to  the service staff all were helpful and friendly. Our request for more tea bags was done straight away. There is no free breakfast any more however this is made up for with microwaves in the rooms and a great wifi connection. and of course an excellent place to view the nightly Disney fireworks.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our spacious Family Suite during your stay with us. Thank you for selecting the Anaheim Camelot as your home away from during your Disneyland visits. We greatly appreciate it and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We have stayed at several hotels in the Anaheim area and thought we would give the Camelot Inn a try this time and were very pleasantly surprised with everything about the place. I guess we were not expecting too much given the hotel type and price but there isn't really anything I can complain about. The room was on 4th floor out the back and was large, good quality furniture and amenities, clean and was handy to check out the fireworks one night from right outside our door.  All the staff we had dealings with were very good particularly the front desk people. I would definitely recommend the hotel .
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review! We are delighted that you enjoyed our comfortable rooms and convenient location. Hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: Friends and I booked a family suite at the Camelot Inn for a 2 week stay, March 2015. This was booked 8 months in advance. Told we could pay at any time. Great. But when we went to pay, we were told we could not pay unless it was by cashiers cheque.As we are from Australia, in the southern hemisphere. Where would they cash it.We offered credit card, western union. Told No. By having to wait to pay till we got there. The AUS/USD dollar exchange rate had dropped. , therefore by costing us nearly $400 dollars more. I explained this to them prior and on checking in. But this did not seem to worry them. I am sure they have many patrons who are from overseas. Not just the US, where they can send a cashiers cheque. They need to make other payment options for people from overseas. They
Manager Response: none

Summary: (date we traveled is not correct, wouldn't let me say "October 2012" :I  We went to southern California 3 years ago. But I remember it like it was yesterday!  We decided to stay at this hotel, ignoring the mediocre 2.5 stars we saw on the vacation booking website we used. I'm glad we did. The rooms weren't the nicest I've seen, (may need updating soon,) but they weren't bad. Just not the most modern design. It was still clean and large and didn't bug me though. I enjoyed the free breakfast each morning, it, once again wasn't the best I've seen but it wasn't bad. Apparently I've heard they removed that or something. Guess I'll have to see when I'm back later this year.  The price to stay here is relatively cheap compared to other locations, almost 4x less than Grand Californian
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I last stayed at this hotel when it was an above average experience and was called by another name.  It has since changed names (and I'm guessing ownership).  It is now an average place to stay but only because of the location. There is no longer a free breakfast offered--that space is now a rental location for scooters.  The first 5-10 parking spots are all reserved or blocked with cones. I'm guessing this is for the scooter business or employee parking.  Most businesses cater to their guests with parking, but not this one.  In addition, the parking used to be included but now costs about $11 per day.  The drapes  in the room all had holes and rips.   I guess the moral is you can't go home again. What used to be a little gem across the street from Disneyland is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Across from Disney, but needs work
Summary: We picked this hotel bc it was listed as across from Disney. It IS closer than the more expensive Fairfield Inn, but it wasn't great.  They spent money to redo the lobby, which looks great, and makes you think the rooms will be equally nice. The rooms were large, but the rugs and furnishings are worn. The hotel needs refurbishment. The bathroom wasn't great, either. It is really a motel. You walk through the carpark to get to your room. Walls are thin so you can hear everyone walking past. Also, the pool is very small, as is the jacuzzi.   The hotel serves no breakfast, so you really just need to bring your own food or eat at the restaurants nearby (or McDonald's). I don't really understand these places that don't serve breakfast at a kid-heavy place like Disney bc we really
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel right across from Disney
Summary: The rooms were clean and spacious.  Front desk people were nice and helpful when asking questions. Perfect location for disney. Short walk to the entrance. Parking was an issue,  not enough spaces if you return late but they do have free valet so it was not too much of a problem
Manager Response: The rooms were clean and spacious. Front desk people were nice and helpful when asking questions. Perfect location for disney. Short walk to the entrance. Parking was an issue, not enough spaces if you return late but they do have free valet so it was not too much of a problem   We are glad to hear that your family had a pleasant stay. Thank you for choosing us for your trip to the Happiest Place on Earth! We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We had a two room suite that had a king, 2 queens, and a sleeper sofa plus two fridges and microwaves.  Plenty of room. Very nice staff. Across the street from Disneyland and a great view of the fireworks.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We are happy that your family found our Family Suite to be spacious and comfortable. Have a wonderful day.

Summary: Recently stayed for 4 nights in a family suite, which was great!  One room had a small couch, coffee table, king bed, small dining table/chairs, and wet bar area with small fridge and microwave. Adjoining room had two queen beds, two arm chairs and end table, and the bathroom and large vanity area with sink.  Perfect for our family of 4, including a teen and pre-teen who like to have their own beds.  The room was clean and updated.  Pool is not big, but it was fine.  Great view of the fireworks from the pool deck.  Close and convenient to Disneyland/CA Adventure/Downtown Disney as well as other restaurants. Staff was helpful.
Manager Response: We are delighted that your family had a pleasant stay and took advantage of the fireworks view! Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.

Summary: I stayed here from 3/28/15 - 3/31/15  I absolutely loved it! The room was a family suite on the 3rd floor , the place is right across the street from disneyland very convenient when traveling with small children my room was very clean and nice up to date furnishings .....only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the suite had only 1 bathroom and I just feel a suite that sleeps that many people should have at least 2 bathrooms, other than that great stay ! This is my 3rd motel stay in the anaheim disney area....and this is by far my fav! This will be my go to choice from now on!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review! We are glad you gave us a try and we hope to be your home away from home during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth. Take care.

Summary: This hotel was clean, quiet and our suite was very spacious. We were on the 5th floor and could watch the fireworks every night from right outside our front door. The greatest advantage to this hotel is the location.  A short walk to the park so if you need to return to your room for a break (which is what we did), it is not a big deal.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that our convenient location worked well for your family's trip to Disneyland. Thank you for choosing us and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: My family and I stayed for 4 nights while we were at disneyland. It was Nice that it was so close, it's closer to the disneyland entrance than the Grand Californian (we have stayed there too!). The rooms are very clean and neat and the pillows ( I love the pillows!) The bed is firm but who cares after a long day of walking. My favorite part was sitting in the hot tub after the long day at Disneyland. Mc Donald's and I hop are right next door so Don't worry about breakfast. My ONLY complaint is the one time parking fee. Oh and they have a gift shop at the entrance where they sell, Tylenol, Advil, tums, sunscreen and all those little things you didn't pack but might need. :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We love our close proximity to Disneyland and we are glad that your family found it to be easy and convenient. We hope to extend our hospitality to you again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is one of the older places, but the location is perfect! It is very clean and well kept and best of all, its about a 10 minute walk across the street to Disney. We went on our honeymoon and was booked in at a 2 double bed room and they were able to upgrade us to a king suite on the spot. Wonderful experience and we will be back!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience with us! We are glad that we could help make your Disney honeymoon one to remember.

Summary Heading: One of the better accommodating across from Disneyland
Summary: Spent 12 nights in a two queen bed room with my two daughters and granddaughter in early March.  The beds were ultra comfortable, the amenities included a microwave, bar fridge, room safe and Free WiFi as well as complementary local phone calls (which made reservation confirmations easy). They have recently updated the rooms and the decor was pleasant and the furniture was in reasonable condition. The room was large enough for our six pieces of luggage as well as all the paraphernalia that four girls need! Housekeeping was efficient and came early each day, so we never had to worry about being bothered in mid afternoon if we returned for a small rest. The only issues we had was the toilet backed up and it took a couple of visits to the reception to sort it out. It was remedied
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent 2 nights here for our visit to Disneyland. Cool castle theme exterior which was one of the reasons why I chose Anaheim Camelot. Certain areas of the hotel may look a little worn and tired but the rooms were definitely given a makeover recently. My room was in excellent condition, clean and with new furniture.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient, clean and Very Friendly and Helpful Staff
Summary: If you are coming to Anaheim, CA with the intention of spending most of your time actually out of your room taking in all the sights and adventures at Disneyland and California Adventure Land and everything else in the area, this is the place...  The first thing I need to mention is the very helpful and friendly staff at the front desk, who went out of their way (making phone calls while driving into work) to make sure our holiday plans worked out. None of the "attitude" you tend to get at more trendy establishments.  This hotel is actually located across from the main entrance road to the Disneyland complex area, so it is extremely convenient. No long walks or shuttles required. Four of us (2 adults and 2 young adults) rented a 2 bedroom king suite for 5 nights and spent very
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very comfortable bed. Close to Disneyland. McDonald's next door, my 5 year old loved that. Pool is small,but we were the only people in it every time we went in. King Mini suite has plenty of room to move around. Front desk very friendly. We did not park there, but valet friendly and waved every time we walked by. Clean room and housekeeping always prompt and all smiles. I would stay there again next month, but they are booked up on my dates so I am trying their sister property down the street, the Tropicana. Hope it is to the same standards.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland but nothing special
Summary: We arrived late at night. The guy at the front desk completely ignored us for a good 5 minutes. When he finally looked at us, all he said was "last name?" There was no "how may I help you" or "thank you for waiting." Thought that was a little strange.  The room was on the 5th floor. It was nice, but nothing special.  The beds certainly were not pillowtopped as described.  The shower had good water pressure.  It was AMAZING that we could see the fireworks from the pool deck, saved us lots of time and headaches of dealing with those crowds. However, that being said, everything else was just average.  I wish the guy at check in was a bit more customer service oriented, however, perhaps I read too much into things like that, since I've been a customer service manager for many years.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We looked at several hotels prior to booking this hotel.  The price was right for the amount of days that we were going to be there.  However when we got there, we were not told about the price for parking which is nine dollars per day.  The staff was not very friendly which is fine as we did not interact with them except upon check in and check out.  The location was across the street from Disneyland.  That was the best part.  We booked the family suite and it was pretty huge.  It was not what we were expecting.  That was a nice surprise.  In the past we like to book hotels that offer breakfast and this place did not.  That will prevent us from from booking here in the future.  If you are looking for a location that is super close to Disneyland without having to pay the extra
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Short walk to Parks, clean and comfortable rooms
Summary: For us, there's no substitute for being close enough to walk into the parks.  Alas, the Grand Californian is beyond our means.  Relying on ART or hotel shuttles can be a pain, especially when the parks are closing.  We chose the Camelot because of positive Tripadvisor reviews and can now reinforce those.    It's one of a set of updated motels with exterior entrances fronting Harbor Drive directly across the park.  It's literally one room deep at the front (except for the rooms above the office) and seemingly a half mile long extending perpendicularly back from the front.  Consequently, rooms toward the back are a long walk - but the tradeoff is that the farther back you are, the less traffic past your door and window.  We had a fifth floor room that was perfectly quiet.  From
Manager Response: none

Summary: For the fact that it is a five minute walk to Disney from this Motel is the Best thing about this  Motel the room was clean the staff were mostly  friendly  but it is a motel and dated I and  because it is close they choose to charge you approximately  ten dollars a day to park when I asked the lady behind the counter why this wasn't presented to you when you booked she  stated the owners  would to tell you to read thee fine print before you book next time was surprised by the response and for that alone I would not return
Manager Response: We have been charging for parking for the past 3 years.  We were one of the last properties to make this decision as we found it necessary to hire a parking company to assist our guests as we wanted to insure that every guest had a parking spot especially when the parking was full.  Our proiessional parking attendants are available to valet park when self parking is not available.  We charge 9.75 per day and all online sites including our website specifies the parking cost.  We apologize for the less than satisfactory response you received when you made your inquiry.

Summary: We go to Disneyland once or twice a year.  Our experience with Camelot was one of the best.  The room was clean with the amenities we enjoy - microwave, refrigerator, coffee wi fi, etc.  There was also a snackish breakfast which was perfect to start the day.  Above and beyond that was the service.  We have some special needs and these were met with efficiency and a smile.  Good job.  Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay while visiting the "Happiest Place on Earth".    Although we have discontinued the complimentary continental breakfast, the Cove on Harbor Coffee House, just two doors toward the Pedestrian Walkway to Disneyland, offers reasonably priced Grab and Go breakfast items i.e., yogurt parfaits, breakfast bars, hard boiled eggs, artisan pastries, and much more.

Summary: Great location, and the hotel was excellent for the price we paid.  It's a deal that can't be beat.  Sure, there are fancier hotels in the area, but the place was clean.  You spend most of the day in Disneyland anyway, which is literally across the street.  It is right beside McDonald's for those quick and cheap breakfast runs.  If you are looking for a place just to sleep at night and take a quick shower before spending all day in Disneyland, this is the place.  Great deal, decent rooms.
Manager Response: Yes we agree!  The Anaheim Camelot is in a perfect location within walking distance to the parks and local restaurants.  Thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review.  We hope to see you again soon as the 60th is just around the corner!!!

Summary: Our family of four stayed at this hotel for the first time last week for four nights.  We rented the Deluxe Family Suite, our teenagers were so happy to have their own large separate bedroom with two queen beds, flat screen TV and mini refrigerator.  My husband and I were happy to have a comfortable king sized bed also with a flat screen TV, kitchenette with mini refrigerator and microwave, dining table with four chairs, sofa and desk.  The bathroom was clean, with a separate vanity/dressing area outside.  We were pleasantly surprised that the noise level between rooms was at a minimum.  Wished we wouldn't have been charged for parking but this is now the norm across the local hotels.  The swimming pool was shallow and could use an update.  We have stayed at five of the
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our Family Suite.  We have 35 Family Suites and the two separate rooms are a perfect fit for families with children.    Looking forward to seeing you on your next visit to the Disneyland area!

Summary: We stayed here for  2 nights. The room is large and the beds comfortable. Having the sink separate from the bath is great. Fireworks are easily seen from the pool area.  We didn't use the pool but did use the hot tub which was only warm.  Housekeeping left us a dirty facecloth and no bath mat but overall we would stay here again as the location is perfect.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit and we apologize for the housekeeping oversight.  On your next visit we encourage you to sit out at the pool area one evening to view the fireworks!  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Right next to the Park - Disneyland of course
Summary: Nice castle style in appearance.  My kids checked out the pool, it was tiny, but given we spend all our time at Disneyland, this didn't make a difference.  Staff very helpful, placed all our luggage in storage on the last day ,and the shuttle bus is almost out side,. thus easy to get back to LAX.  End of our road trip 35/35, over 6800 miles / 11000Km, across numerous states, and what a place to end up at - Disneyland and a clean room !!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  The 4th floor pool also has a great view of the fireworks too! We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area...

Summary: We needed a hotel for our whirlwind 2 day trip to Disney. We chose Camelot because of its proximity to Disney and it's solid reviews. This hotel was perfect for us. We stayed in a 2 queen room for our family of 4. It was clean and quiet and big enough for us all our stuff. There is a small fridge and a microwave. Our room was 521 which was high enough we may have seen fireworks if there had been any. There is a small pool and hot tub which we didn't have time to use but appeared clean. We were able to check in early and park our car so by 10 am we were on Disneyland grounds without having to disrupt our day half way through. We checked out the next morning and had to pay a day rate for parking. It's unfortunate that they can't extend the parking rate for hotel guests on the day
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites to be your home away from home during your visit to Disneyland! We strive to create magical memories for our guests. Take care!

Summary: We got this room to be close to Disneyland. It was within walking distance. About 5 minutes.. We came back and forth so that was really nice. We had a giant bathtub in the room which was really nice after walking around Disney all day! The room was really clean. Beds are great. The staff was fast and friendly. Didnt use the pool but looked nice. Very basic and good for the price.
Manager Response: We are delighted that your family found our location to be ideal and our rooms comfortable. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney and value for money
Summary: Our family of four (two 12 yr old kids) stayed 3 nights in a grand suite. The room layout suited us perfectly with two separate rooms, tons of space and enough beds that our kids could have a queen bed each without having to share (plus their own TV!) We chose this property based on the availability of these larger size suites at very reasonable rates compared to other Anaheim hotels. The location right across the road from the Disney entrance is a real bonus. An easy 5 minute walk from the hotel room and you are at the ticket entry for either theme park. Restaurants and convenience stores are also located in walking distance with a mcdonalds right next door and IHOP about 50m down the street. The room facilities were a bit dated and the bathroom layout a bit quirky but the
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us to be your home away from home during your visit to the Happiest Place on Earth. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Camelot Inn is in walking distance to disneyland. If your room isn't ready they will send you a text when your room is ready. Reception area has a nice charm about it.  The room was nice - in all honestly we didn't spend very much time in there. Bed was great after a long day in disneyland. The bathroom configuration is a little odd - the sink was outside of the bathroom, but the shower still worked well.    Mcdonalds is right next door for a quick breakfast and Ihop isn't far down the road either.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience with us! We are happy that our convenient location suited your needs during your visit to Disneyland. Take care!

Summary: Nice rooms, average amenities.  Heated pool & hot tub.  Walk to Disneyland in 5 mins towing kids & great place to watch fireworks from!  Next to McDonalds, IHOP & Denny's.  Good value for families.  We will stay again.
Manager Response: We are delighted that our close proximity to Disneyland worked well for your family‚Äôs trip to the Happiest Place on Earth. Thank you for sharing your experience with us. Take care!

Summary: Just across the street from the Disneyland plaza.  Nice family suite, though there is only one bathroom.  However, there are two sink areas.  There is a refrigerator, but not a kitchenette.  Rooms are basic, but location is the main benefit.  We just used the rooms to sleep while visiting the parks.  Great view of fireworks from the pool area.
