Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us! We are happy to hear you enjoyed the view of Disney‚Äôs firework display from our pool, and we hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: This hotel is located right across the street from Disneyland's transit center and very close to the entrances to Disneyland and California Adventure. That's its main selling point and if you're going to be spending several days at the park it's a major one because you get exhausted just walking around the parks and waiting in lines all day. Staying just outside the place gives you a quick place to rest up if you need it and you'll be glad of it at the end of a long day. The rooms were very basic and that's what I expected for the price. You do have to pay for parking in the lot but it's basically Disneyland parking because it's so close. This hotel also has services like a coin-op laundry and scooter rentals (strollers too, maybe?) downstairs but we didn't use any of those
Manager Response: We hope you had a great time New Years Eve at the parks.  Thank you for sharing the convenience of our location and reasonable priced accommodations.  Please come back and visit soon.

Summary: Stayed here back in August and had a group of 5. The suites are amazing! Spacious and everyone had their own bed. Only downside was there was only one bathroom for all of us to share (and were all adults) but wasn't a problem as we seemed to have made it work! We travel to Disneyland about once a month and will be returning to this hotel when we have a big group!
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay.  Our Family Suites are indeed spacious and offers ample bedding for a family 6.  We hope you enjoyed the 4th floor pool area on one of the warm evening during your stay soaking in the pool while experiencing the  Disneyland  famous Firework Display!  Please remember to visit our website for "specials" on your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary: My family and I were here for Halloween 2014 and we stayed in the 'family suite' and it was more than I expected.  The rooms were large, clean and the staff is exceptionally accommodating.  Will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback. We are delighted you enjoyed stay and hope to be your home away from home on you next visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel; Quick Walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Camelot Inn during the week after Christmas when the Disneyland area was at its busiest. Our room was a King Family Suite which consisted of two bedrooms. The main room had a king bed, a sofa sleeper, a dining table with four chairs, and a kitchen area with a wet bar, refrigerator and microwave. The second bedroom had two queen beds and the bathroom. The size of the room was perfect for our family, as my husband and I took the king room and our two teen boys got their own beds in the other room. This room sleeps up to eight, so it would be nice if it had an additional bathroom. But, there were only four of us so it worked out well enough. The room was clean when we arrived, and was straightened up nicely each day while we were enjoying the parks. We always had
Manager Response: Hi Terri! Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are happy our spacious Family Suite suited your family well and provided all the comforts of home. Our rooms have been updated to a triple sheet with bed runner for a more modern look. The Front Desk would have been happy to provide you with additional blankets as it was quite chilly last week.   We hope to accommodate your family again on your next trip to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: First off let me saying, the location couldn't be better.  So convenient to pop over to your hotel for a few minutes, and then back to Disney without having a long walk or to take a shuttle.  I don't have much interaction with the employees at this hotel since were mostly gone.  What little I have ran into the housekeeping staff, they are always friendly and say hello.  Check in was smooth, and the counter gal was very courteous.  Rooms were clean, and updated.  I would recommend this hotel to others that don't want to spend a fortune at the Disneyland Hotel, and want to be close.  This hotel is across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  One little tip, I would bring ear plugs.  All the little kids running around early in the am for early magic mornings is a bit noisy.
Manager Response: Hi Erik! We are glad our convenient location and comfortable rooms met your needs. Your positive feedback is appreciated and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Stayed here with family of five. Room was good size but bathroom tiny. Absolutely no crockery or cutlery in room even though has microwave and small fridge. No kettle. staff ok but not particularly friendly.very noisy in room. Great view of nightly fireworks.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and sharing your experience at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.  While we do not offer cutlery in our guest rooms we do provide a mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and coffee along with a hair dryer and "I Love Mango" soap, shampoo/conditioner, and lotion.    We are happy you enjoyed the fireworks as all four floors offers a spectacular view from right outside each guest room.

Summary: As got noisy and they got it fixed same day. Front desk crew efficient and friendly. Surprised by a $40 damage deposit though. Good wifi. Right by stairwell and elevator. Only noise was kids screaming in the stairwell and elephants in the room upstairs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Most properties if not all here in Anaheim require a refundable security deposit.  In most cases hotels requires a "Per Day" deposit whereas we only ask for  a minimal $40.00 refundable deposit for your entire stay.  We are happy you enjoyed your stay with us.

Summary: Our family of four spent four nights at the Camelot and were quite satisfied with the hotel's cleanliness, comfort, and location.  Our rooms were on the fifth floor, which afforded us an excellent view of Disneyland's fireworks.  We simply stepped out our door to the walkway and enjoyed the show.  Others watched from the fourth floor pool area.  The airport shuttle dropped us off and picked us up at the hotel door.  We frequented nearby restaurants for meals and used the microwave and fridge in the rooms for leftovers and snacks.  I recommend Mimi's and the Pizza Press for meals.  For other needs such as beer, make the walk to CVHS, about three blocks away.  Although the hotel is not fancy, it's safe, comfortable, and definitely affordable.  You walk a block to the signal, cross
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  After a long day at the Disneyland Resort,  our goal is to insure that each guest is satisfied with their stay.  You said it all.  It's all about comfort and convenience and we are delighted that your experience was precisely this.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".  Happy Holidays!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Wonderful Rooms, Clean Property, AMAZING Pillows!
Summary: We love this hotel. We stayed here in October and December of this year. Perfect location! The room was clean and had lots of room. The pillows in the room were made of goose down, and were sooooooo comfortable!! Housekeeping was awesome! The two ladies at the front desk when we checked in were very friendly. It was great being right next to McDonald's for a quick breakfast to go. We will be back in the spring, and will be staying here once again!   Thanks for everything!
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read reviews such as yours and value you as a return guest.  Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience and on behalf of the team members at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites, we wish you and your family a very joyous holiday season.

Summary Heading: Great location, nice property, friendly staff
Summary: We were taking a short trip to Disneyland with our two children, one night in a hotel and one day at the park.  Our plan was to stay at one of the Disney on-property hotels but they were booked. I was initially disappointed to be staying "off property" but we had a very good experience at the Camelot Inn & Suites and I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Disneyland.  The location is unbeatable, the rooms were a good size, clean, and fit our needs.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  And the price was great, we saved a good deal from what we'd have spent at one of the Disney hotels.
Manager Response: We are so delighted that you enjoyed your stay at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites and appreciate your positive review.   With being so close to both parks, only a 5-10 minute walk, many of our guests come back from the parks early enough to enjoy the fireworks from outside of their room.  The 4th floor pool also offers a great view!  Wishing you and yours a very happy holiday season.

Summary: This was our first vacation with just ourselves and let me tell you this hotel is fantastic! It's location is amazing and the price was inbeatable. The only problem I had was parking my big truck. Other than that we LOVED this hotel. The staff was very helpful in holding the packages we had shipped there. We are definitely staying here again when we go next year.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay.  It was a pleasure extending our hospitality to you and look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the Disneyland area.  We just completed the renovation on our lobby and excited to show you the new look!!!  Happy Holidays to you and yours!!!!

Summary Heading: Very clean and close to disneyland
Summary: This hotel was Convenient for us. We are a family of 6 all of us had our own beds to sleep in, so roomy. Parking was easy. It was right across the street from disneyland entrance. Housekeeping did a very good job. Definitely staying there again.
Manager Response: Hi Dianna! We are delighted that our comfortable and spacious Family Suite was the perfect choice for your family of 6. Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Having stayed here 14 years ago, we decided that when we came back this year, we would stay there again and see if it was still the same. It is a cheaper alternative to staying at one of the Disney hotels. Valet is charged automatically to your bill, but, our car was parked too far away from our actual room. It is very close to Disneyland itself, as well as downtown Disney. McDonalds is right next door and is great for a cheap yet filling breakfast before you start your day. Also comes in handy for late night snacks! We did stay at a couple of the Disney hotels and of course they are better, but if you want a cheaper option, without the bells and whistles, then this hotel will give you somewhere to sleep and recoup for the next day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. We are happy to hear our convenient location met your needs. Quick note regarding the room tip: our guest rooms are located on the second floor through the fifth floor with elevator access and Disney views. We hope to see you again during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: what more can you ask for, Excellent rooms very clean, Got to see fireworks from our balcony at night, staff were excellent. Location was across the road from Disneyland, so if you wanted to take kids back for a sleep it worked well, Highly Recommend this hotel,
Manager Response: We are delighted that you experienced the fireworks from your balcony.  Every guest room does offer a great view from either a balcony room right outside their room on the outside corridor.  The 4th floor pool area is the best area to view the fireworks while soaking in our Jacuzzi Spa!!!  Thank you so much for your positive review and we hope to see you again sooner than later!!!

Summary: Fairly clean rooms, but very old and outdated.  The pictures on the Internet are not accurate. Not enough outlets in the room for anything electronic. Our smart phones are not by our bed. There is a computer desk but no outlet for a power cord. We haven't slept here yet but it was a military deal. We'll see how it goes.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  The reason why the pictures are out dated is because we recently  replaced the old out dated bedding with a fresher triple sheeted combo and bed runner.  We do plan on renovating our guest rooms soon.  Our lobby is the first to receive a complete make over and is presently under construction and is set to  re-open in a few weeks.   We apologize for the inconvenience with your power cord.  There is an outlet near the desk as there is a phone and lamp on the desk that is plugged into it.  We will offer more outlets when our rooms undergo renovation. We are glad that you took advantageous of our great Military Discount. Enjoy your stay!

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel was nice, room was large.  It is right across the street from Disneyland. We loved being able to walk to the park. Only complaint is that there was not enough self-parking so I had to valet and pay the higher parking rate. I think if the lot is full then valet shouldn't cost more. Overall we had a great trip and would stay here again.
Manager Response: We are happy that you were satisfied with the location of our property.  Most guests tell us that it only takes 7 minutes to walk to the main gates of both parks.  Regarding our parking.  We charge $9.00 plus tax per vehicle per day for self parking or Valet.  There is no additional cost for Valet Parking.  There are times when the parking does get crowded and the parking attendants will find it necessary to valet park, but again, there is no additional charge for this service.  Kind regards,

Summary Heading: Great sleeping after a loooong Disneyland day!
Summary: We stayed two nights at Camelot and had great nights of sleep after long days at Disneyland.  About a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  It is great to park the car and relax, not having to drive to the park and try to find parking, especially when you have a limited amount of time.  Camelot helped make our vacation memorable and priceless!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay and that you slept well each night.  It's all about comfort and convenience when visiting the parks and we are happy to hear that our ideal location worked  for you as well.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Its just across the street and 5 min walk from the front gates its not 4 star but clean and well taken care of. Our housekeeping was efficient and thorough. The room was large for two people especially after a long day in the park when all you want to do is sleep. which brings me to the mattress which is so soft feels like sleeping on a cloud. There is no breakfast on the premise but there is a McDonald's on one side and a little ways down the street right in front of the gates is an I- hop.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your accommodation, especially the mattress.  There's nothing better than a good nights sleep so you are wide awake to enjoy all there is to see at  the "Happiest Place on Earth".  We hope you took advantage of the Cove on Harbor Coffee House for reasonably priced  "Grab and Go" breakfast items on your way to the Pedestrian Crossing over to the parks.   Thank you for your positive review and we hope to see you again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary: I love this hotel. Rooms are clean, staff helpful and so close to Disneyland.   Had a room on the 3rd floor (306) and could fault it.  Two beds were super comfy, water pressure good and there was plenty of room for the two of us and four large suitcases. Pool was clean and pool area was tidy. Nice to return to after a long hot day at the parks. Will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review.  We are happy to hear that you took advantage of the 4th floor pool and jacuzzi after a long day at the parks.  It's fun  to watch the fireworks while relaxing in the Jacuzzi too!!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and are so happy with the entire experience.  The staff was friendly , the rooms clean and modern and the price was great....and did I mention the location? The hotel is across the street from the front entrance of Disneyland. We were able to see the fireworks from the hotel.  The room was spacious, it had an in room safe, clean bedding, and a very large counter for getting ready in the morning and with 3 people in our room having the counter top outside of the shower/toilet area was very helpful!  There is a McDonalds, Cold Stone Creamery, Pizza press and IHOP within walking distance.  Once again, the location cannot be beat.  I am so glad we chose the Camelot for our trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: It is always such a pleasure to hear from out guests and their positive experience at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.  Yes, the hotel is just an 8 minute walk to the main gates of Disneyland and California Adventure! It's all about cleanliness, comfort, and convenience and we offer all three!!!  Thank you again for your comments and we hope you will come back soon!!!

Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. Big rooms at a reasonable rate, enough space for myself, hubby, and our 4 kids, and even Grandma! Breakfast included that the kids enjoyed, and coffee that I was thankful for, especially on the "Magic Morning" day.  Nice and close to the park, and lots of family type restaurants near by. Staff were friendly and everyone enjoyed the animals that they made out of the facecloths. We try to get to Disneyland once every year or so, and this is by far the best value in the area.   I liked it so much there that I booked another stay for the first week of December this year, and I am looking forward to the same positive experience we had the first time. (and hoping to get lucky and stay on the same floor as the pool again :)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about our property.  We are happy that you stayed in one of the family suites as they are ideal for larger families.   Enjoy your holidays and we look forward to seeing you again!!

Summary: We stayed here for six nights last week.  I had originally booked another hotel for my family's long awaited Disneyland trip.  After researching all the hotels in the area further, I decided to switch to this hotel in order to give my family of five more space and to have a table to eat at.  We booked the family suite with one king size bed in one room and two queen size beds in the second room.  My wife thanked me several times during our trip for switching hotels and booking the family suite at this hotel!   For the length of time we stayed and after spending long days with our kids in the park, it was nice to have a separate room for the kids to go to with their own TV to watch, giving us parents some quiet time in a kid free zone.  We were grateful for the amount of space
Manager Response: We are delighted that you and your family enjoyed your stay in one of our Family Suites and that you took advantage of the great view of the fireworks from the corridor.     The Anaheim Camelot offers a view of the fireworks from outside every guest room and also from the 4th floor Pool and Gazebo area!  Thank you so much for your positive review and we look very much forward to extending our hospitality to you and your family on your next trip to the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: We travelled as a family with two pre-teen kids and wanted to be within easy walking distance to the theme parks. This property ticked the boxes and we were happy we paid the extra for a One Bedroom Family Suite which gave us a king bed in the living area and two queens in a second room. Also two TVs, a small kitchen and a dining table. After long days of togetherness at the Disney parks it was nice to have the extra space and bed. Wasn't thrilled that my trusty sheathed travel knife which was left in the sink during the rush to be at Disneyland before the park opened was either thrown away or removed by housekeeping. They kindly left the blade cover on the kitchen bench-top but there was no sign of the knife, our reusable plastic plates and reusable plastic cutlery, on our
Manager Response: Thank you  for your positive review in regards to our location and services. We apologize that housekeeping discarded your reusable plastic ware and knife but happy to hear that housekeeping did locate your daughters stuffed toy and returned it to it's rightful owner.    There are many times when items are in the bedding and inadvertently taken to the laundry.  We are sorry that this happened.  We hope you were able to create magical moments to cherish at the "Happiest Place on Earth" and enjoyed your vacation.

Summary: This place was not very good.  Our room was big, but just missed on the amenities.  Bugs in the bathroom, shower didn't seem very clean, the staff was not very friendly and the pillows were terrible.  The only perk for me was it was directly across the street from the Disneyland park so we could just walk and you could walk out of your room and see the fireworks from the park.  I will pay for a better hotel in the future.
Manager Response: We are sorry that your family was dissatisfied with your room and pillows but thank you for taking the time to write your concerns.  We hope you were able to enjoy the fireworks from our 4th floor terrace pool area as well as the conveniently short walk to the main gates.  Sincerely,

Summary: I would never stay here again. We had ants all over the bathroom counter even after housekeeping came in. The front desk attendants were not very friendly and not clear on what to do with our car. They have five floors with 29 rooms on the upper three floors and parking for only about twenty cars. Our kids a very picky eaters and we were worried if we left (to find a restaurant) that we would not have a parking spot when we got back. Our son had gotten sick and we had to ask for them to change the sheets and they seemed rather rude about it. The pillows were terrible making it hard for any of us to sleep. The couch in the room felt very itching so no one sat on it we did fold it out for an extra bed (which was a bit more comfortable than the king size bed. Which doesn't say
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to address your concerns.  We apologize that you were not completely satisfied with your room and if requested would have moved you to a different floor.   Parking attendants are available 24 hours a day and would have been happy to valet park your car if you had difficulty finding a parking spot at no extra charge.  We have over 100 parking spaces although when the hotel is traditional running at 100% occupancy the lot may appear smaller.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed the convenience of our location and  appreciate your input.  Regards,

Summary Heading: Great visit at the Camelot right across from Disney
Summary: It's been a few years since we used the Camelot and since then we have stayed at several other hotels including some in the Hilton chain but to be honest, this one really worked for us this time.  The beds were perfect, the room was large and very quiet on the third floor (we asked for something towards the back), and even though the temperature hit over 100 degrees, it was perfectly cool.  There was plenty of hot water for showering, great service at the desk, we checked in very early from our Southwest flight and we liked it so much we have rearranged our Christmas trip so that we can stay here rather than at another hotel, changing the dates to ones available at the Camelot.  It's not fancy, but we don't need fancy.  It was clean, comfortable, cool, courteous and close.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit at the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.  The convenience of the location of our property allows our guests to view the Fireworks outside every room of the hotel and the 4th floor terrace pool.    Thank you for your complimentary review and we hope you will once again allow us the opportunity to be of service to you on your next visit to the Disneyland area.  Best wishes,

Summary: Actully it went on in april/may. this is one of the best places i have ever been to!!! this Is amazing, salt water pool, across from disney land, and (yet tiny) a buffet!!! if you wanna place across from disneyland, the camelot in is just for you
Manager Response: We appreciate that you took the time to give us a positive review when you stayed with us last November.  We discontinued our complimentary continental breakfast in 2014 and offer healthier and reasonably priced "Grab and Go" items at our sister property just two doors down and on the way to the Disneyland Pedestrian Walkway.  Looking forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth".  Best regards,

Summary Heading: Location is key, staff were great.
Summary: We booked this 7 years ago and loved the location, this time was no exception. Being right across the street from Disney is a huge plus. We booked the family suite so had 2 doubles, one king and one double pull out which was amazing for our group of 6. There was only the one bathroom, but we were hardly in the room, so not an issue. We checked in early before our room was ready, but they offered to store our luggage, so didn't have to worry about it. Check in was quick and easy otherwise. The room was clean and pillows and bed were great after a busy day at disneyland! There isn't a restaurant, but there is McDonald's right next door, Pizza Press was amazing the opposite neighboring hotel, and IHOP 2 doors down. There is pick up from shuttles just 2 doors down as well, so if
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and that the Family Suite  was convenient for your family of 6.    Thank you for being a repeat customer and please come back soon!  Seven years is way too long to wait! :)  Most sincerely,

Summary: Right across the road from Disneyland and maccas for breakfast, mimmis for dinner or Tony Romas, all within a3 min walk. Rooms are basic beds are ok too. Its good affordable accomodation for your holiday adventures. Staff were helpful and polite. It was 100 degrees for the 4 days we were there. The room aircon coped ok ut it froze the bed nearest the a/c unit whereas the second double bed were HOT and there was nowhere to adjust the direction or angle of the airflow, im being picky here.
Manager Response: We apologize for the malfunction air conditioning unit.  Thank you for your constructive feedback as we take your comments very seriously and strive on making sure our guests are comfortable.    On your next trip to Disneyland we sincerely hope you will stay with us again.  Most sincerely,

Summary: We were looking for a three-bed suite across from Disney, and two things set the Camelot Inn apart:  the charming Mr. Toad exterior; and the dining table in the suite, which allowed us to eat as a family, not on the sofa or perched on beds.  The rooms were clean and spacious, with excellent A/C (we visited during a heatwave, but were cool and comfortable). The staff were terrific, especially George (and Bobby seemed very nice, too).  Our one issue, an uncooperative interior door handle, was immediately resolved by the friendly maintenance man.   The location came in very handy when I needed to run back to fetch a pair of glasses, about a six-minute walk from park to hotel.  Best of all, though, was the view.  After a long day, one of our sons immediately crashed upon returning
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your memorable experience during your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. Customer service is of utmost importance to our staff; we are glad you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us and had the opportunity to watch the Disneyland fireworks from your room! We hope to be of service to you again on your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: A quaint hotel almost directly across the road from Disneyland! We stayed here for a few nights while walking into Disneyland each day, booking tickets through the hotel.  It's so close we often got a pass-out and went back to the hotel at least one point every day.    The rooms are clean, in good condition and spacious.   The hotel has a guest laundry on the ground floor, and a small pool on level 3.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive and memorable experience during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your comments and hope we can be of service to you again next time!

Summary Heading: Never again - read before you book
Summary: We are a party of 4 reserved 2 double beds for 2 nights 6 months before arrival. The hotel gave us a one bed with one sofa while putting the blame on us for ordering the wrong room. Well, we have a copy of the reservation... When the front desk lies to you the only thing you have left is to warn others not to have the same experience.
Manager Response: We are sorry that you were dissatisfied with your accommodations.  We are happy to discuss your reservation in detail and give you a full explanation as to why you were reserved in a room with 1 king bed and a double sofabed.  Feel free to reach out through our email.  Respectfully,  Patricia Coomb

Summary Heading: Across from the Happiest Place on Earth!
Summary: We had a basic room with two queen sized beds, 'fridge and microwave. It was clean, neat and comfortable. The a/c worked like a charm and since we were there during the week, parking wasn't an issue. Also, right across the street from Disneyland-so perfect location. Pool is on the 4th floor, so pay attention where you get your room (more noise closer to pool). We were in 326 and it was a quiet location.  The staff was very helpful, and get your lanyards in their gift shop, half of what Disneyland charges. All in all, I would totally stay there again. As a side note-at midnight we ended up on the opposite side of the park and paid a taxi abt 9 bucks to get back to hotel-was worth it, we were tired after a fun day.
Manager Response: Customer service is of utmost importance to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites. Our staffs main goal is to ensure a positive experience for each one of our guests. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our hospitality to you and we hope to see you again on your next trip to The Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: Absolutely the best place to stay. Across the road from disneyland.  Best staff and very friendly and helpful service. Will be back. Lovely restaurants within walking distance.  McDonald's rigjt next door as well. Great balconies to watch the fir2.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your memorable and noteworthy experience regarding your recent stay with us here at the Tropicana Inn and Suites. We're glad to hear you enjoyed the opportunity to watch the Disneyland fireworks from your balcony. Hope to be of service to you again next time!

Summary: This location is right across from Disneyland Parks.  It's a great location!  But when we checked in and open the bathroom door.  There was a HUGE stench that rushed out.  We called the front desk and they sent the housekeeping dept.  The bathroom and room looked clean enough so not sure the problem.  When we returned a few hours later, looked like the shower curtain and toilet got replaced.  The problem got taken care of but did not make a good first impression
Manager Response: Thank you for your review...We agree that walking into a bathroom that has an odor isn't welcoming, however, we would like to thank you for immediately bringing the issue to our attention so that our maintenance department resolved the issue in a timely manner. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you will consider us again on your next visit to Disneyland.  Sincerely,

Summary: We stayed here on our last trip to Disneyland and enjoyed it very much.  We had been told they had breakfast and found out when we got there they didn't so I'm not sure what sanae78 is talking about, (unless the person we checked in with just told us no), but McDonalds is right next door.  Except for one night person at the front desk, everyone who worked there was very friendly and helpful ..(again, unless that one person told us no breakfast and there was).  The room was clean, and the kids enjoyed the pool and hot tub.   They even have a room to store your luggage if you arrive early ... and will call you when your room is ready, and if you have a later flight will store your luggage for you again. Fun little picture kiosk in the lobby where you can email a picture of
Manager Response: Customer service is extremely important to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and our staffs main objective is to ensure a positive experience for each one of our guests. Although we do not offer a breakfast, there is a coffee house and mini mart at our sister property, The Tropicana Inn and Suites, where you can purchase reasonably priced breakfast items. We are glad to hear you enjoyed taking pictures in the lobby with our iSnap machine and we hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: We've stayed here on our last 2 trips to Disneyland and will absolutely stay again.  For the price, you can't beat it.  The location is perfect walking distance to the parks.  Lots of food options within walking distance, including McDonald's right next door.  There's free breakfast, which isn't great (pastries, coffee, oatmeal, cereal) but better than nothing.  The room was clean and spacious.  Great value hotel.
Manager Response: We always appreciate guests such as yourself who take the time to comment about our property.  Thank you so much!  We have discontinued our Complimentary Continental Breakfast as of the beginning of 2014 for the very reason you mentioned.   On the way to the Disneyland pedestrian crosswalk and conveniently located at our sister property the Tropicana Inn & Suites guests the Cove on Harbor Coffee House now offers reasonably priced "Grab and Go" breakfast items along with flavored coffees.  Kind regards,

Summary: This hotel is situated a 5 mins walk from the main gate. A definite plus after a long day in the park. We had the first room on the 2nd floor. I was concerned about elevator and traffic noise,  but it was no problem. The room was a king bed suite - meaning an additional sofa bed beside the king bed. Pulled out, it still left plenty of room to move around. The bathroom had a bath and toilet in one room and a separate sink and vanity area - great idea if there are a few people sharing.  The room was spotlessly clean. Bedding was adequate and pillows were great. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker and safe. AC worked great.  Small pool on 4th floor. Did not use it so no comments.  Overall a great place to stay for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments regarding your recent stay. We value guest feedback and are we happy to hear you found the accommodations to be comfortable, clean, and convenient. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland Stay
Summary: This hotel was well priced for what it is. It is not luxurious but it is perfect if you are in Anaheim for Disneyland! It is very close to the entrance of the parks and is great if you just want to crash there at night. Simple but clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Hi Milly! Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent stay with us. We enjoyed extending our warm hospitality to you and hope to see you during your next visit to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary Heading: Great option for right outside the park! Location, location, location.
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed here 3 nights in the family suite.  We arrived quite early in the morning from a flight and knew our room would not be ready until the afternoon.  The front desk was friendly and accommodating by taking our bags and locking them up until our mid-afternoon check-in.  They also answered a few questions for us during our stay and let us print our boarding passes on the day we were leaving - the lobby computer was convenient for this purpose.  The suite had ample room for 5 adults (3 teens) and was away from busy street traffic. The convenience and location of this hotel in regards to the entrance of the park was perfect. No shuttles to wait for or excessive walking outside the park.  It was very convenient for our needs.  We have stayed in the 'disney
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your positive and memorable experience during your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We enjoyed extending our hospitality to you and we hope your family created life long memories to be cherished for years to come!

Summary: Hotel was convenient for a one night stay for a Disneyland trip, only a couple minutes to the gate which is the reason we booked this hotel.  It was a cheap room so we weren't expecting much, but it was fairly big and was clean and everything we needed. No complaints at all, was very quiet and had a good night sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. Glad we were able to be of service to you and hope to see you again on your next trip to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: Yay, another trip to Disneyland. We looked at several different hotel options and decided on returning to Camelot as we were not happy with other, previous hotels. We were certainly glad we did, just like last time a few years back, the hotel was clean, quiet and convenient to Disneyland, what else could you ask for! The room came with microwave and fridge which are always a bonus and having hotel staff that cared is a real bonus. Unfortunately no more continental breakfast but McDonalds is right next door with numerous options. Thank you for being our number one Disney hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again during your recent trip to Disneyland! We enjoyed extending our hospitality to you and hope we will be seeing you again next time.

Summary: The hotel was nice and the check in was easy. The part that we found was the best was the closeness to Disneyland. There were several days that we ended up leaving the park and going back to the hotel and it was in perfect walking distance! For the amount of time you spend at the hotel, this one was a little expensive (especially because we are broke students) but you are paying for the location and that was ideal.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive comments regarding your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. Hope to be of service to you again on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: Average for what you would expect for a family oriented hotel near Disneyland.  About a ten minute walk to the ticket gate so not bad at all, just right across the street from the park entrance.  If you have anyone needing assistance in your party, they have scooter rentals on site and the people are very helpful.  We took up a row of four rooms.  All of the beds were comfortable and the showers warm with good pressure, so my top two needs are met.  Friendly hotel staff.  No breakfast on site however there is a fridge in each room.  Each room had it's one "thing."  Our air conditioner was extra loud, another room in our party had a toilet that would flush all by itself.  The rooms were neat and clean and the pricing good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your comments and hope to be of service to you again the future.

Summary: Pros:   close to Disney Good view of the fireworks Near a lot of places to eat  Cons: Dirty Loud Problems not addressed during stay.  We had one of the big rooms - basically 2 rooms with only 1 entrance.  It was on the top floor, which was fine.  The rooms have a "kitchen".  However, neither mini fridge actually worked, the drain in the tub (only 1 bathroom) was so slow that taking a shower was disgusting, and you couldn't walk around barefoot at all unless you like black feet.  Also, none of the hotel employees were at all helpful when asked basic questions about the area (like, "how do we walk to the disneyland hotel?" Which we needed to know due to dinner reservations.  Map apps showed only how to walk around the entire disney park).  I checked out 2 days early due to how
Manager Response: We are disappointed to hear that you were unhappy with your room and services.  The Anaheim Camelot is well  known for our Family Suites and the convenience it provides for larger families.  We would have been happy to move you to a different room or send maintenance up to your room to replace the two mini refrigerators if we were notified.   Please except our apologies for the inconvenience and sincerely hope you enjoyed your Disneyland vacation.

Summary: The location to Disneyland is great.  You can see the fireworks from the pool.  The staff was not very friendly.  Our bags had to be delivered to the hotel from the airport and when we went down in the morning to pick them up the gentleman at the window was less than pleasant.  The room was clean but the shampoo's etc. were never replenished.  Plenty of restaurants nearby if you need them but beware that you will encounter homeless on the bus stop benches.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share you memorable experience during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your comments and feedback and hope to be of service to you again in the future!

Summary: We have stayed here every time we have been in LA and will not stay anywhere else. Fantastic location, great rooms and the fireworks show from the spa is spectacular. Close to shopping centres, angels stadium and of course the 5 minute walk to the main gate at Disneyland. McDonalds next door and spoilt for choice for other foods. Sad that you have to pay for parking now. Hoping to be back here for our third trip from Australia at Halloween! :)  Great value for money as well and I reccomend this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland   Adam D Australia
Manager Response: Customer service is extremely important to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and our staffs main objective is to ensure a positive and memorable experience for each and every guest. Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience during your recent stay and we look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: We arrived at the hotel at about 10am on our day of check-in. The car park was totally full save for one tiny space, and the back 1/4 was cordoned off for the valet area. However, the valet was not at his stand. Therefore, we had to squeeze our car into this tiny spot, and had a real struggle exiting the vehicle! The valet returned just as we had unpacked our things and gave us our parking pass, but just a simple note on the valet stand 'Back in 5 minutes' would've been useful! The parking remained an issue however - the lot simply isn't big enough - and it really put us off using our car incase we'd return and find no available spaces and no valet present.   Anyway, apart from the parking situation, the hotel was good. The receptionist wasn't the most friendly - especially
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  Two years ago we selected to hire a parking company to assist our guests with parking as our guests were bringing in more than one vehicle.  We apologize that our Valet Service was not available at the time you arrived.  Thank you for your suggestion regarding the sign.  I have forwarded this great idea to our Front Office Manager.  Other than the parking situation we are happy to hear that you did enjoy your accommodations. We hope you took advantage of the reasonably priced "Grab and Go"  Breakfast items at the Pizza Press or Cove on located next to the Anaheim Camelot Inn & Suites.

Summary Heading: Very nice and very close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is nice, clean and walking distance to Disneyland. The only negative is that they charge for the parking. I did not expect that! It is only $10 but still, did not expect to pay for parking. The staff was helpful and friendly the room was nice and clean. Overall I recommend this hotel, especially if you visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments and feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We're glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to be of service to you again during your next trip to the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary Heading: Great place to Stay for visit to Disneyland
Summary: the rooms where average and  very clean, service was prompt and professional. the location of this hotel to disney is in walking distance and i managed a three day trip with and four and seven year old walking every day from the hotel to disney. the pool is not very deep it is three ft all the way around and the firework shows can be seen from here as the pool is on the top of the hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. Glad you were able to enjoy watching the Disneyland fireworks from the pool! Hope to be of service to you and your family during your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed here for 1 night.   It is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  Our room had a jacuzzi tub which was very welcome after walking the parks all day.  We did not use the pool.   Parking is a huge problem.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your feedback and look forward to being of service to you again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for five days.  The hotel room was nice, beds were comfortable lots of pillows. The only issue we had is the website didn't say that they used duck feathers in their pillows and blankets and my mom is allergic.  She had to go buy a pillow at Walmart and just use the sheets on the bed.  Also the faucet on the sink is a little hard to turn on and is very loud when you use it. Also we were right by the elevator and ice machine so it was a little noisy throughout the night.  This was a great value for the area, its very convenient to just walk to Disney and there is a McDonalds right next to it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your comments and hope we will see you again on your next trip to the Happiest Place on Earth.

Summary Heading: Recommended, close to Disney land, few restaurants
Summary: Good breakfast, cereal, juice, tea coffee unlimited and of course the cakes, Happy to get cereals at this hotel. Wonderful hard working staff, fantastic location close to Disney Land. A wonderful surprise to have a lovely spa bath in the room!!!!
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read such complimentary comments. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and hope to be of service to you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here for 3 night on a trip in June 2014. The location is great and within walking distance to disneyland and California Adventure park. The room was real nice and very clean. The beds were comfortable and the staff is great. This is a very affordable hotel especially in the location so lose to Disneyland. I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there in the future!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive comments in regards to your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We are glad to hear you thoroughly enjoyed your visit and we will be happy to accommodate you again in the future!

Summary: We recently stayed here in May 2014 for 3 nights and thought the location was perfect.  The room was clean and a good size.  I liked that there was a refrigerator and safe in the room at no extra charge.  We were on the 2nd floor in the middle and you can hear noise when people are coming and going, but not to the point where it is disturbing.  It was too cold to use the pool, but we did go up and look and it seemed clean.  We arrived around 11:30am and they let us check right in, and we were able to buy our Disney tickets at the same time.  For the price I believe it is a fine place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your complimentary comments in regards to your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and we look forward to being of service to you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Excellent Location and Lovely Staff, Excellent value for Money and such close proximity to both Disney Parks.
Summary: My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights at the start of our 5 week holiday.  What a great start to the holiday.  The staff were very friendy and helpful with helping us to book tours of Hollywood.  Bus stops are across the road and within walking distance for the free shuttle bus to the factory outlets.  Disneyland and California Adventure Park directly across the road.  The fireworks on the Friday night could be seen from our room and were spectactular.  Our room was always clean, beds were comfortable as were the pillows.  Check-in and out was an easy process and quick.  Free Wi-Fi.  Breakfast at IHop and Dennys is a recommendation and they are just a short stroll to the Motel.  Would highly recommend this Motel, great Value for money.
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read such complimentary comments - we appreciate you taking the time to share your positive and memorable experience with us. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to be your home away from home during your Disneyland adventure and we look forward to being of service to you again next time!

Summary: We had a 7 night stay here...was terrible.  We got back from our 1st day at the park around 10 pm, and the room had been made up & the sheets were dirty. I called to get new sheets and was told they would send someone up to change them.  About 10 minutes later, they called and said there was nobody to change the sheets on site and they would have someone come over from their other property to change them, but it would be 20 minutes.  This time elapsed and another call from the front desk saying nobody could come until the next day. So since I refuse to sleep in dirty sheets, I asked them to send up clean sheets and I would make the beds myself. So, they send 4 top sheets and no fitted sheets. Asked for fitted sheets too, but had to call back to the front desk and request them.
Manager Response: Hi Karen,  We deeply apologize for the inconvenience you encountered on your most recent visit..  With the information you have provided it appears that your family stayed with us the night before and the linen on your second night was not changed when your room was made up. We are very sorry that you had to wait over 30 minutes for service. In reference to our free Continental Breakfast, we pro-actively emailed out new confirmations to our future guests with explanation of the discontinuation in 2014.     Again, we apologize that you did not receive this information and hope you enjoyed our reasonably priced "Grab and Go" breakfast items on the way to the parks just two doors down at our sister property the Tropicana Inn & Suites.  We regret that your experience with us was less than satisfactory and do hope that you and your family were still able to create fun filled and  life-time memories at the "Happiest Place on Earth".

Summary: If your on a budget and need a hotel close to Disney park entrance then this hotel is a good consideration. It was not the best or the worst place we have stayed at. Outside of hotel is nicer than the room we had. We were told no early check-in.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments regarding your recent stay at The Camelot Inn and Suites and are happy to hear you enjoyed our close proximity to Disneyland. Hope you had a magical time at The Happiest Place on Earth and we look forward to being of service to you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Looks Cute and Very Close to Entrance
Summary: I picked this hotel based on location, price and that I thought it looked very story book. It actually looks just like the picture. The room was generally spacious and it was great to have a safe, mini fridge and microwave. I would say the price wasn't bad either and it included free wifi. The parking is expensive and the check in time is horrible. I requested an early check in because we were driving in early so the hotel told me to leave my number and theyd call me. Around 1, I still hadn't received a call, so I called them and sure enough a room was available. Annoying but glad I decided to call myself. Our room was right across from the pool and the kids were super loud past 10pm but I was exhausted so it didnt matter. No concerige, seems like a stuck-up complaint, but when
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments and feedback regarding your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. Customer service is of utmost importance to our staff and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to see you again on your next Disneyland vacation!

Summary Heading: Great place for family of six
Summary: I will agree with so many reviews about what a great place this is. The five minute walk to Disneyland's entrance, seeing the fireworks from the pool and on the fifth floor, clean, and friendly service really helped enjoy our stay.  Only recommendation is if you want to avoid eating out all the time to locate a Von's. Target is great to get your waters and sunscreen.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to share your positive and memorable experience during your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We are glad to hear you enjoyed watching the Disneyland fireworks from our Jacuzzi and we hope to be of service to you and your family again next time!

Summary Heading: The price was right- as was the location.
Summary: If you are travelling to Disney Land (like 95% of visitors to Anaheim) then this is the perfect place to be. Right across from Disney Land park and WAY cheaper than staying at the Disneyland Hotels. They also offered a small pool and jacuzzi.  In addition, they are located next to a McDonald's and near a great pizza place (Pizza Press). If you need a clean place to sleep for cheap, this is it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments regarding your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We enjoyed extending our warm hospitality to you and we hope to see you again on your next visit to Disneyland!

Summary: Really more 3.5 star.  It is what it is - a nice clean hotel room across the street from Disneyland.  We had stayed at the Anabella prior, but the Camelot was much better; bigger, cleaner rooms.  No breakfast and car had to be valet parked, but for the price better than other places close by.  Would definitely stay here again if location was the main component (and with little kids it really was).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We were happy to accommodate you and your family and hope to be of service to you again next time!

Summary: Directly across the street from Disneyland, this is a great alternative to staying at the Disneyland Resort Hotels. Nice place and great amenities. Great stay during the Disneyland Half Marathon Weekends. Great breakfast options for runners.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to be of service to you again during your next marathon!

Summary Heading: Location is everything for this hotel and for my family.
Summary: My family had stayed at Camelot Inn a couple times for a number of years. The biggest advantage for this place is of course their location which is less than a 10 min walk to disneyland which is of great relief to us as we have a 2 year old who needs his nap during the afternoon and knowing we can always walk to our hotel and rest a couple hours to recharge for the evening.  Also, having the pool helps during the hot days when you just want to relax after a whole day of walking.The pool is located at the 4th floor and is located quite conveniently for viewing the fireworks.  We have the deluxe double queen bed and everything looks clean and was always cleaned in a timely manner.  Only a couple minor complaints. One is the hotel removed the complimentary breakfast I think
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments in regards to your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. Glad to hear you were able to view the Disneyland fireworks from the pool and we hope to see you again next time!

Summary: Very nice motel for the money. Excellent location, helpful staff. Right across from Disneyland and next door to McDonalds. They make you pay $10 extra for valay parking. Overall, a very nice experience.
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read such complimentary comments. Looking forward to accommodating you at the Camelot Inn and Suites again on your next Disneyland trip!

Summary: Three of us had milestone birthdays this year and spent a few days in Orange County. We spent a very enjoyable night at Camelot. It was the best place any of us ever stayed in. Our King suite was perfect in every way - beautiful, large, convenient, very clean, excellent service. Although we did not go to Disneyland, it is right across the street with great views in three directions. This hotel really made our trip special!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We're happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: We just returned from a trip to Disneyland and couldn't be happier with our hotel choice.  Camelot is one of the 5 closest good neighbor properties just across the street from the main entrance which is important for a midday nap or when you are dragging back after 16 hours in the park.Their pool is also on the 4th floor and overlooks the nightly fireworks show in case you just can't stay that late.   Staff was friendly and rooms were well appointed and clean. Our suite had a completely separate room that slept 4 in addition to a king bed. It had both 2 fridges and a microwave where the regular rooms just have a fridge. My only suggestion is that you bring a power strip because there are not enough plugs for everyone's devices. Also be aware of a $15/day parking charge
Manager Response: Glad to hear you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us here at the Tropicana Inn and Suites. Thank you for sharing your comments and feedback in regards to your recent visit and we hope to be of service to you and your family again next time!

Summary: We recently stayed here for three nights while we visited Disneyland.  Our family of 4 (two adults, a 3 year old and 8 month baby) stayed in a room with a king bed and sofa bed.  The room had plenty of space for our one suitcase, bags, and stroller which we did not have to close.  The room was clean and the staff were friendly.  Location was great - right at the main entrance to the park and near places to grab a quick breakfast (McDonalds, Ihop, etc).  But...  I would not recommend this hotel to a friend with a family because the window in our room which was on the 4th floor opened all the way without a screen or any other measures to prevent a child from falling out.  I was pretty shocked since I assume that a large number of their customers have children.  It would be so
Manager Response: We apologize for the delay in replying to your review.  Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Rest assured our rooms and windows are safe and meet with safety requirements.

Summary: This hotel has all you need for your stay just a block away from Disneyland main gates. Rooms are ample in size, have microwaves, fridge and in room safes. Upper floor pool and small hot tub with seating for approx. 20 people. Right beside McDonalds and close to other restaurants. We stayed 4 nights and found other guests not very respectful...partying on walkways until early morning, very loud returning to rooms. Needless to say, not great for over tired kids. Rooms are clean but took until 4-5:00 pm each day to get made up. Good place to watch fireworks off site from pool deck.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and comments during your recent stay at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and your family and are glad to have made your vacation special. Hope to see you again next time!

Summary: My husband, 2 year old, Mom and I stayed from Wed night to Sunday night in May at the hotel in one of the corner 5th floor suite rooms. My sister and nephew stayed with us in the middle of the trip also.  We felt there was plenty of room for all 6 of us. The room was clean and spacious. We ran out of towels a couple of times and were able to call down for them easy enough.  We did have an issue with getting a crib-it took several calls on check-in night to have one brought up. Crib was pretty rickety but did the job.  We also used the pool- keep in mind it's a salt water pool for those expecting chlorine. It was definitely a refreshing way to break up the day. It was also barely crowded the 2x we used it during our trip. Just a few families there at a time. The pool does offer
Manager Response: Customer service is extremely important to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and we are glad you and your family had a positive and memorable experience. Thank you for allowing us the privilege of extending our hospitality to you and we look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: This hotel is located across from Disneyland with a short walk to the main entrance. Our room was very clean and updated. The suite we stayed in had a fridge, microwave and a safe. It was nice having an actual table to sit at to eat our meals. We liked that they had complementary wi-fi access and free local calls. The staff were really friendly. The room rate was very affordable as well. We will definately be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive and memorable experience during your most recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We are happy to accommodate you and your family and look forward to being of service to you again next time!

Summary: This was exactly what we were looking for. Clean, close to DL, fireworks view and a family suite with a separate bedroom. For us it was just perfect. This was 3 adults and 1 child. We had requested the fifth floor but it wasn't an option when we checked in. I was worried about hearing footsteps and sure enough! After FOUR calls to the front desk it finally stopped. That was my only complaint about our stay. The staff who I phoned was polite but in the morning when I stopped in to the front desk to talk about it and ways in which to avoid it that night, I was met with a very rude woman who made me feel at fault.  Other than that the room was very comfortable especially the beds and the toiletries provided were yummy mango. We did swim in the pool one day, small but refreshing.
Manager Response: Customer service is our main priority here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and our staff focuses on ensuring a positive and memorable experience for every one of our guests. We value your comments and are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to be of service to you again in the future!

Summary Heading: clean hotel in a great location
Summary: i looked at a lot of hotels before finally choosing this one. i was very pleased with how clean it was and the great location. the hotel is a 5 min walk to disneyland, which is great if you want to come back to the room to rest during the day. the hotel room was very clean, no complaints. this is the only hotel i will be staying at for future visits to Disneyland!
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read such complimentary comments. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and your family and look forward to being of service to you again next time!

Summary Heading: Very clean, very good location, just the basics.
Summary: I was very pleased with how clean this hotel is.  The location is fabulous about a 7 min walk right to the gate of Disneyland.  Nothing fancy at all but overall very satisfying experience.  One weird note was there was no fan in the bathroom.  Staff was efficient and friendly.  We stayed on the top floor which we found was pretty quiet.  Mini fridge and microwave oven were an asset.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience during your recent stay with us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your comments and hope to be of service to you again in the future!

Summary: It was really close to the D.L. entrance, McDonald's was next door & we were lucky to be on the 4th floor where the outdoor pool was. The hot tub was great for tired achy legs. I really liked that we had our own safe in the room where we kept our passports & valuables so we didn't have to carry an uncomfortable money belt everywhere we went or use the hotel safe. Thing I liked least was only 1 bathroom and there were 7 of us but we made it work. It would be nice if the tub was separate. I liked that the sinks & mirrors were outside the bathroom. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, dinning table, 2 fridges & a microwave. We watched the fireworks from our balcony one night.The staff was very friendly & accommodating. Would stay there again for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments and feedback regarding your most recent stay with us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites. Happy to hear you were able to enjoy watching the Disneyland fireworks from your balcony! We enjoyed extending our warm hospitality to you and hope we will see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Best disneyland hotel value for the money for large family.
Summary: We stayed here for the first time for nights 3-5 on a five day trip to Disneyland, Seaworld, and Universal Studios.  We moved to this hotel after splurging on Disneyland Hotel the first 2 nights.  So happy with this hotel.  We had the king family suite for our family of 6. Very big rooms with 2 queens in one room and a king, sofa bed, and kitchenette in the other.  Rooms were nicely decorated - better than anticipated - comfortable, clean, and right across the street from Disneyland.  Cannot beat location and value - enjoyed this more than Disneyland hotel at about $600 less per night.  Staff was friendly.  Will make this our permanent go-to hotel for our future disneyland trips.  The only downside was the noise level outside.  You could hear others getting back late from
Manager Response: It's a pleasure to read such positive comments and feedback. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts - we are happy to have made your Southern California vacation special and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Our first time staying at the Camelot Inn. We wanted to stay close to the park and this fit the bill. Nothing fancy, but it was clean and comfortable. The parking area is where all of the housekeeping is done, so you pass by the laundry area to get to your car. They have a laundry mat there and there appeared to be some kind of kitchenette although I was not sure if that was for public use as no one at the front desk mentioned anything about it. I think this is one of the fairly reasonably priced hotels across the street for Disneyland. All of the "maingate" hotels charge a parking fee. This one charged $9., the others charged more.   This hotel also does not have breakfast like many others do. That would have been a definate plus, but with a microwave and refrigerator, we just
Manager Response: We enjoyed extending our hospitality to you and your family during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We value your feedback and look forward to being of service to you again in the future.

Summary: The rooms were clean and you can't beat the location.  Nothing too special.  The Staff seemed to wish they were elsewhere ...not very friendly.  View is of their parking lot. We were underwhelmed.  So many choices for that area, I wouldn't go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Missing jewelry from room. Poor customer service.
Summary: The reservations were made several months in advance. Checked in at 4 pm. As required. Unpacked. At 7 told they put us in the wrong room and would have to move tomorrow morning to a different room. Had to pack and move to another room. The staff was very rude. Jewelry was missing from the room on day three. We were told a report was made. Don't expect to see jewelry returned..  Told by front desk they called for shuttle transportation to airport. They did not do this. Then lied and said they never said they would. There are better hotels in the area to stay in that offer better service and more accommodations for the price. . No breakfasts at this hotel and the pool was tiny.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It's not bad, but you could do better
Summary: The place is not great. It's a little ramshackle -- a piece of the elevator wall was falling apart, the "kitchenette" was 25 years old (it felt like), it was dark (not enough lighting or windows). But the rooms were large, it's the first time I've had a one bedroom suite where there were beds in both the main room and the bedroom. They stopped their breakfast, there is no food there, and when I went to the lobby store it was closed even though the posted hours showed open for two more hours. The distance to Disneyland is AWESOME. But there if I were to go again, I might check out the two places next door: Carousel and Tropicana. It was fine for our two days. And I wasn't unhappy. Just unimpressed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for your trip to Disney, rooms were plenty large enough for our family of 4. House keeping was amazing, the pool was perfect for young kids and to refresh in. We will stay here again on our next trip to see Mickey.
Manager Response: It's a pleasure to read such complimentary comments. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and your family and we are glad to hear you enjoyed our pool and oversized Jacuzzi. Hope we will see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Clean and very close to Disney Park Entrance
Summary: Stayed here with family and friends in February. Rooms were dated but clean, staff were nice but really didn't say or do anything that would make me remember them. They changed door lock systems during our stay without notifying us, so of course after a VERY long day at the park and getting back to our room we found ourselves locked out!!!!  I had to go all the way back to the lobby and get new keys made which was extremely annoying and very inconvenient. A simply note in our room the day before letting us know the door lock system was being changed and to please stop at the desk to get new keys made would have saved us from frustration and must likely resulted in a higher rating other than a three out of five. Pool was nice and again the room was dated but clean. I must admit
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your recent visit to the Tropicana Inn and Suites. We value our guests comments and hope we will see you again soon!

Summary: Just returned from staying 5 nights in a 1 bedroom suite 4 adults 2 kids ages 4 and 11. Room was huge and very clean. It was only 5 min walk to disney parks and had plenty of places to eat close by that were reasonable. We got a deal on line for a 5 night stay which no other hotels offered. Pool was small but okay and staff were friendly and even made up the beds for the kids using stuffed animals. It was our 4th trip to Disney from new york and we stayed at other nearby hotels but I would definitely recommend staying here and we will again for sure thumbs up camelot.
Manager Response: Customer service is very important to us here at the Tropicana Inn and Suites and our staffs main objective is to ensure a positive and memorable experience for each of our guests. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our hospitality to you and your family and look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot for 5 nights & 4 days.  The location of this hotel is fabulous, we were able to see the Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot upon arrival.  I was thrilled with the size our suite, it was perfect for our family of 4 kids (plus Mother-in-law).   My complaints would start with the staff, very unfriendly and unaccommodating.  The morning of the second day, I asked if I could get a couple of blankets.  The beds only had light sheets.  The lady at the front desk acted like it was a huge request.  That afternoon, we were locked out of our room & when my husband went to the front desk, they told them all of the key card boxes and been changed and he would need new key cards (they couldn't tell us they were changing them?).  After receiving new key cards; we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience during your recent visit to the Tropicana Inn and Suites. We are happy to hear you enjoyed watching the Disneyland fireworks from your room! We value your comments and hope to be of service to you again in the future.

Summary: The hotel is a bit run down and in need of renovation like all of the hotels along S Harbour BLVD. We have stayed at the Best Western and HOJO before and I would rate Camelot better than BW but not quite along the same standards as the HOJO. We had a one bedroom suite for 3 adults and one 5yr old. Didn't like that the bathroom was not in the main room, but other than that, it was quite and the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have every had.  One air conditioner leaked badly but they fixed it as soon as we told them. Maid service was great for cleaning but really inconsistent with extra towels/replacement glasses etc. Some days we got some, some days we got nothing.  Great location, can see the park/Matterhorn/Fireworks great from outside the rooms. 3 minute walk to
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments, our staffs main priority is to ensure a positive experience for each and every guest. Happy to hear you enjoyed the view of the fireworks from your room, they're always fun to watch! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I did a lot of research on hotels and was so close to booking at the Candy Cane Inn.  But saw that Camelot was closer so took a gamble. And it paid off! We are Disney Nuts, so we did 16 hours straight each day, and boy were our feet happy that we had only a 7min walk to our hotel. No waiting/missing shuttles just home when you want.   We didn't have a chance to use the pool, but it seemed clean and people were enjoying it. The room itself was huge and CLEAN! They stocked 4 peoples worth of towels for us, so our 2 day stay didn't even require house keeping. There was a nice desk, sofa, 2 chairs, safe, TV and closet that were all in great condition. We had a king size bed as we requested and stayed on the top floor (5th) at the very end. No noise and even a great working heater as
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind words, it's always a pleasure to read such complimentary comments. Thank you for allowing us the privilege of making your Disneyland trip even more memorable. We truly value your comments and look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: We decided to book our stay here since it was walking distance to the parks and relatively inexpensive.  We were very happy with our choice.  The rooms were clean, staff was great, and it was very conveniently located.  We will most likely stay here again when we return in the future.
Manager Response: We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and your family during your Disneyland vacation. We hope you created lifelong memories to be cherished for years to come and we look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: This hotel has a lot going for it.  The location is great...5 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure.  There are half a dozen other hotels along Harbor Blvd that are the same.  The property is a little dated but that doesn't take away from anything.  We had two double queen rooms for our party of 4 adults and 3 children under 12.  The rooms are very good size and you don't feel cramped at all.  Each room has a decent sized refrigerator and a microwave which helped in.having breakfast and snacks.  The maid service was excellent and everything was very clean.  The staff responded immediately to any needs we had and all were very pleasant.  Parking cost $9/day and can get pretty full but they do offer valet parking for no cost if there you need it.
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read such warm and complimentary comments. We truly enjoyed the privilege of extending our hospitality to you and your family. Glad to hear you enjoyed the pool and watching fireworks from the Jacuzzi - they're always spectacular to watch! We look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: We struggled to choose between staying at the Disneyland Resort or staying over the road, being a once in a lifetime holiday we were on, we wanted something special. However on recommendation from my sister who had stayed here before we saved our money and booked to stay at the Camelot. Wow, we were so pleased with our decision, no regrets. The hotel is right over the road, next door to McDonalds, and so close to so many restaurants.  We stayed in a Family Suite (423), the rooms were huge! Having two mini fridges and a microwave meant we were able to bring our own food for breakfast and dinners. We were right near the pool, so we made an effort to get the kids in there one afternoon to chill after a huge couple of days at Disney. The pool area was clean, towels were provided and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. We are so happy to hear you and your family thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us! Glad you had time to lounge by the pool and enjoy the Jacuzzi. We value your comments and hope we will see you again soon!

Summary: Can't beat the location and the price was right for being so close to Disney. Clean rooms, nice to have a little frig, heating/cooling worked well.
