Did have a chance to watch the Disney fireworks from the pool area. Very relaxing. Pool was well heated and relaxing, though hot tub is ridiculously small. So tiny, in fact, it is hardly worth having there. Check in went very smoothly. Comfy bed. No issues.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments. We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and your family during your vacation. Glad to hear you enjoyed watching the Disneyland fireworks from the pool! We look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary Heading: Great place to watch the fireworks!
Summary: During our last DL (Disneyland) trip, god blessed me with a day of puking my guts out and I got to avoid the happiest place on earth for one day, I spent it in my room at the camelot. The room is very well priced for what it is. Our room was clean, the staff was polite and friendly, our toilet flushed, our showers were hot, the hot tub was hot, and the pool was wet what more could you ask for?  There is a little convenience store between the cam and DL, great for beers in the hot tub, the mcdonalds is next door if you are craving a mcrib.  No one helped us get our bags to the room, I prefer this.  I just carried all my stuff from Canada to DL and I don't need to pay someone to roll my bags the last 20 feet onto an elevator and expect a tip from me, Im a dad, I can do it myself.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive comments during your recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. Glad to hear you and your family thoroughly enjoyed your room and our refreshing pool! Hope we can be of service to you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great location with friendly, helpful staff
Summary: We had a family room and found it very spacious and comfortable - however, we did spend very little time in the room as we were a 7 - 8 minute walk to Disneyland.  We did only have one bathroom, however there is a bathroom downstairs if you need a toilet whilst the one in the room is in use.  We had stayed here a few years ago and were surprised they no longer provided the breakfast, which was very basic but at least your kids got a bowl of corn flakes before heading to Disneyland.  We were on the 4th floor and it was very quiet.  We had a vending machine a few doors up which was great for bottled water on the way home after a big day.  The staff were very helpful and all in all we thought  it was a great price for the location and the size of the family room. The housemaids
Manager Response: Customer service is extremely important to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and our staffs main objective is to ensure a memorable experience for each one of our guests. Glad you enjoyed your room and our close proximity to the Disneyland parks! Hope we can extend our warm hospitality to you and your family again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here with friends in the family suite, the hotel is across the road from Disneyland and a short walk to the main entrance.  We slept 4 adults and 4 children in the suite, which was better value than 2 seperate rooms. The rooms are quiet and beds comfortable. The rooms are fastidiously clean, the suite has a small kitchenette and bar fridge, but no crockery are available so unless you bring your own, you can`t really self cater. There is a large dining table and a coffee machine but no kettle if you like tea. The complex includes a pool, laundry facilities and the breakfast is fresh and selection sufficient, (no hot breakfast). The hotel is walking distance to restaurants and a short drive to supermarkets.
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to read such positive comments. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your room and our convenient location to the Disneyland parks! We enjoyed the privilege of extending our warm hospitality to you and hope we will see you again soon!

Summary: My wife had stayed here before and liked it, so we decided to take our son to Disneyland and stay here.  It's literally right across the street from the main entrance of Disneyland, easy walk.  Very kind staff at the hotel.  It's not luxurious, but it's nice and very well kept, very clean.  I will be staying here from now on whenever we go to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such positive comments. We enjoyed being of service to you and your family and am glad you had a memorable experience. We value your comments and look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: My family of 4 stayed for 5 nights and had a fantastic experience. The hotel is across the road from Disneyland, so easy to come back and forth especially with younger kids who need a break in the day. We stayed on the 4th floor towards the back go the property and found it very quiet. The pool was on this level, so great for kids who want to have a splash. You can also see the Disneyland fireworks from here. Our room was extremely spacious and gave us all the space we needed. We had a family suite which had two rooms......great for putting the kids to bed earlier than the adults. The room was very clean and the staff all friendly and helpful. Of course you get some 'kid noise' from time to time, but this is a family hotel and with kids ourselves it never worried us. Would
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive and complimentary comments. We are happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your room and watching the Disneyland fireworks from the pool! Thank you for allowing us the privilege of being your "home away from home" during your vacation and we hope to see you again next time!

Summary: We stayed here for 8 night in sept in 2 interconnecting rooms. We were on the top floor and found this to be quiet. Rooms were large and clean. Only thing was it had one bathroom and was in the kids room. Pool was small but fine after a long day in Disneyland. It was also only a 7 min walk to main entrance to disneyland. We had a lovely stay and would go back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such positive comments in regards to your recent stay with us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites. We are happy to hear you and your family had a lovely stay and we look forward to being of service to you again next time!

Summary: We stayed 2 nights in a Deluxe Family Suite for the 7 of us in December.  Pros :  The location of Camelot Inn is very good. Right in front of Disneyland and Disney California Park. So, there is no need to drive, just take a 5-10 mins walk and you are right at the entrance of Disneyland. There are many restaurants adjacent to Camelot Inn. There is no need to have your meal inside Disneyland. We had our dinner at IHOP which is my daughter's favorite. The Deluxe Suite is good for family with children. We watched 2 nights of fireworks right in front of our room balcony.   Cons :  The hotel is a little run down, so need some refurbishing. Staying in a family suite for our group of 7, it has only 1 toilet /bathroom. So it was quite a rude surprise that this is the case. The room do
Manager Response: Customer service is extremely important to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and our staffs main priority is to ensure a positive and memorable experience for each and every one of our guests. We are glad to hear you enjoyed watching the Disneyland fireworks from your balcony! Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Overated. The difference between a regular room and family suite is a sofabed. Very small.  Only one bathroom located in adjoining room. Inconvenite for people to use bathroom during nite time hours and shower time.Not worth the money.I Suggust getting  reg. adjoining rooms instead. Because they also have micro and frige. The continial breakfast served ok. If you like day old pastries. Only good thing going for this motel is the housekeepers,walking right into disneyland,and view of fireworks from some rooms.
Manager Response: Customer service is extremely important to us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and our staffs main goal is to ensure a positive experience for each and every one of our guests. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our clean rooms and close proximity to the Disneyland parks and hope to see you again next time!

Summary: If you are looking to book a Disney package, this neighborhood hotel was a good choice. It is less than the Paradise Pier, Disneyland Hotel, etc. One thing though, the continental breakfast was very very weak and I believe they are doing away with it. But location and price were spot on!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our close location to the entrance to Disneyland! We value your comments and look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: We arrived December 9th and were given cards to our room right away. We had lugged our luggage up to the fourth floor-swiped our card and proceeded to walk into an already occupied room. Awwkard! I slammed the door immediately and was given another room 517 right away. So we dropped our belongings and went to Denny's for dinner. We walked back and our kids ran ahead us and just walked into our room without a card. Yup that's right the door didn't lock! Each time we left after knowing that our door wouldn't close properly we made sure that it was closed but luckily nothing was stolen.   My children loved the pool. I loved soaking in the hot tub after a long day at the Disney parks. The breakfast was awful. The cereal is no name brand and the pastries were old and stale. The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location - That's where it ends
Summary: Perfectly located across the street from Disneyland. Other than that it really doesn't have much else going for it. The rooms are old the breakfast was bordering on inedible. Donuts and pastries offered as breakfast which were borderline stale. I would have much preferred they do not offer breakfast at all rather than offer poor quality. If you just need a place to sleep and nothing more it is adequate.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for big families at Disney
Summary: We usually stay next door at their sister hotel, The Tropicana. This time, we had 7 people, so we opted for Camelot's bigger room. It had 2 rooms: The first room had 2 queen beds and a kitchenette area. The second room had another 2 queen beds and the bathroom. It was very comfortable. Parking was no hassle, and the entrance plaza to Disneyland is right across the street. When we need a bigger room, we will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience during your most recent visit to the Camelot Inn and Suites. Glad to hear your room was comfortable and you and your family enjoyed the stay. We look forward to being of service to you in the future!

Summary: We stayed at the Camelot Inn for two nights as the base of operations for a one day attack on Disneyland.  The location of the property is ideal for convenient parking, a quick five-minute walk into the park, and a quick retreat back to the privacy of our room.  To say the least, this place is high-volume.  I cannot imagine an empty room on a weekend night.  Parking in such close quarters during our Friday evening check-in was initially confusing, but the valet attendant handled the hectic situation with calm and polite poise.  The front desk was very welcoming and greeted us with a smile, even though they must have smiled to hundreds of parents with small kids prior to our arrival.  The elevator was quick and served to deliver us to our third floor room, 322.  Our room was
Manager Response: We are happy to hear you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us here at the Camelot Inn and Suites and hope to be of service to you and your family again in the future!

Summary: This is a family friendly, clean and neat hotel which is minutes from Disneyland resort.  It is also extremely affordable for a family of four.  We stayed in this hotel in August 2013.  We loved the breakfasts (especially the hot chocolate and donuts) and the seating area was small but clean.  The staff was always filling up the food as fast as the patrons were eating it.  We liked the fact that there was laundry on site as this was the only place we were able to do our own laundry.  My kids also liked the Ms. Pacman game that was in the laundry area.  The pool was small but warm and refreshing at the same time.  We loved the hot tub and used it to warm up once the sun went down. The drawbacks of the hotels are (1) no fan in the bathroom (2) really really cheep toilet paper (my husband wanted to go buy some better stuff) and (3) very minimal continental breakfast choices and small room for the breakfast.
